loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children. She is part of the "Yamen" solidarity group, a lending group of women living in Hasbaya, which is situated in the South of Lebanon.  Leila sells Tupperware items to the families and businesses of the surrounding region. The larger the stock purchase that she makes, the bigger the discount she will receive, and thus Leila has requested a loan of $500 to finance this investment in her business. Her children describe her as a courageous mother and her entire family has confidence in her ability to successfully expand her operations. This is the third time Leila has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase new supply of Tupperware for retail

loans.name: Alonefa

texts.fr: Alonefa W. est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis plus de 3 ans, à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite avec ce crédit, augmenter la capacité de sa boutique en achetant des sacs de riz, des cartons de laits, de savons et autres produits pour répondre aux exigences sans cesse croissante de la clientèle. Il compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
For the past three years, Alonefa W. has been the proprietor of a grocery store in Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan he hopes to increase the amount of goods he has for sale by purchasing sacks of rice, cartons of milk, soap and other products to meet the growing customer demand. He is counting on this opportunity to improve his family’s way of life.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of rice, cartons of milk, soap and other products for retail sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells drinks, foodstuffs and provisions from her shop, as well as building materials like sand, gravel rod and cement. Comfort has been in this business for the past five years. She opens her shop by 7 a.m. each morning and closes by 7 p.m. Comfort is 40 years old and married with six children. Comfort needs a loan of 100,000 N to buy more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Zemaray Group

texts.en: Fahim S.,  who is the group leader is single. He lives in a low rent house in Jalalabad city. He studied until seventh grade. After that he opened a tailoring shop. The other members of the group are  Ershad A. who also has a tailor shop,  Farhad K. who is a taxi driver and Sharif  K. who owns a shop. They are  requesting  a group loan of $850 to improve their businesses. Fahim S. is sure that they can repay the loan on time. He would like to thank everyone who helps with funding this loan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Mrs. Uon Huot Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people who all live in Krang Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province make up this village bank loan group, and they plan to use the loan ifor different purposes. Mrs. Uon H. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Tim Phat, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm wine and palm sugar.

Unfortunately, in his business, her husband faces a small problem because he does not have enough equipment to climb the trees to gather the juice. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Uon H. decided to ask for a loan to buy bamboo to tie to the palm trees in order to climb up to gather juice.

Mrs. Uon H. is the mother of four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only two years old.

Another borrower, Mrs.Sang S., did not come to take the loan but her husband did, so he is in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to tie to the palm trees to climb up to gather juice

loans.name: Jane Nanono Group

texts.en: N. Jane is the leader of the Mbuya group in Kamapala, Uganda. She is a strong and hard-working lady who is able to manage two businesses at her home in Mbuya. She sells tap water to residents around her home area as well as selling matooke (green bananas) to the same people. She buys the matooke from trucks that bring the bananas to the trading centers and uses a rented bicycle to transport them to her home, where she sells them both in bunches and in a heap per finger. The water is supplied by the National Water and Sewerage Cooperation and she clears her bill every month. She needs her portion of this group loan to buy more matooke for sale.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
GABRIELA RAMIREZ D. A., Pertenece al Banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, ubicado en Mz, I Lt. 03, Urbanización Pedro Portillo – Distrito de Yarinacocha, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 43 años de edad, 03 hijos, su esposo es constructor civil.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00), compro una impresora pequeña, artículos de oficina, papeles bond A-4.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, compró artículos de oficina en mayor  cantidad, una impresora con escáner, y se financio una computadora, para realizar en su casa tipeos, y diseños gráfico.

Agradece a Manuel Ramos, por apoyarla, su anhelo era tener una computadora completa, ahora lo tiene gracias a Manuela Ramos, y puede realizar y cumplir con sus proyectos.
texts.en:
GABRIELA RAMIREZ D. A. belongs to the communal Bank called "Las Trinfadoras" located in the urban development Pedro Portillo – District of Yarinacocha in the city of Pucallpa. She is 43 years old and she has 3 children. Her husband is a civil builder. The first loan of 300.00 Nuevos Soles ($90), she bought a small printer, office supplies and A-4 paper. With this loan of 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles ($375) she bought more office supplies, a printer with scanner, and a computer to be able to do graphic designs. She is grateful to Manuel Ramos (Kiva's partner) for supporting her. Her wish was to be able to have a complete computer equipment, now she has it thanks to Manuela Ramos, and she can make and fulfill carry out her projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more office supplies, a printer with scanner, and a computer to be able to do graphic designs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa comercializa calzados para varones tiene su puesto ubicado en la Zona 12 D. Octubre, el esposo es transportista inter provincial dentro el departamento D. La Paz, es su principal fuente D. ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención D. sus dos hijos que están estudiando en la universidad publica tiene casa propia viven en la casa D. sus padres ubicado en la zona Loreto D. la Ciudad D. El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra D. mercadería D. esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad D. demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento D. pago permite la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Rosa sells men's shoes from her post in Zona 12 D. Octubre. Her husband works as an inter-provincial transporter in La Paz, which is their main source of income for supporting their two children studying at the public university. They live in her parents' house, located in the Loreto area of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to meet the market demand. This is her fourth loan from Impro. Her good repayment history allowed the approval of her loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa O. is 45 years old. She is married and has six children. Yaa says two of her children are in senior high school, two are in primary school, and the other two are out of school and run their own businesses. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw, in the eastern region of Ghana.

Yaa runs a palm oil production business to earn income to help support her family. She procures palm fruits from farmers in her community and nearby villages to produce the oil. She trades in vegetables as well.

Yaa distributes her palm oil to customers who come to buy wholesale and retail. She will use her loan to procure palm fruits in bulk, so that she can produce oil in bulk to distribute to her increasing number of customers. She aspires to give her children the very best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Geoconda Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Geoconda vende ropa y productos de cosméticos, y los fines de semana hace sopa para ganar otros ingresos, sus venta las hace desde hace seis años, la cual las inicio con fondos propios de su trabajo anterior ya que ella se desempeñaba como domestica y lo que mas anhelaba era tener su propio negocio, que gracias a sus propios esfuerzos y prestamos que Afodenic le hizo pudo establecer la venta de ropa este es su noveno ciclo. Tiene 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio de Hialeah, con dos hijos, su esposo es ebanista el cual me apoya en todo. Con esta solicitud va invertir en la compra de ropa y cosmético ya que tiene unos encargos. Sus planes es poder tener mejores utilidades para seguir construyendo su casa y poder dar a sus hijos una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Ms. Geoconda sells clothes and cosmetics, and during the weekends she makes soup to earn more income. She has been selling these products for six years, and she started with her own savings from her previous work as a domestic employee. What she wanted most was her own business, and thanks to her own efforts and the loans from Afodenic she established the sale of clothes; this is her ninth cycle. She is 34 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood with her two children and her husband, who makes cabinets and helps her with everything. With this loan she will invest in purchasing clothes and cosmetics as she already has some orders. Her plans are to have better profits to keep building her house and to be able to give her children a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Fatou Tacko

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou Tacko M. est une Sénégalaise agee de 35 ans qui sollicite un crédit pour financer son activité commercial.  Depuis dix ans elle a vendu des tissus, des produits cosmétiques, des draps, et du thé.  Avec ce prêt elle va reconstituer son stock afin de mieux servir ses clients.  Elle n’a jamais reçu un crédit auprès de l’IMCEC.  Elle habite à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  Elle est mariée et avec les revenus de son entreprise, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses familiales.

Madame M. sollicite un produit spécial de l’IMCEC.  Le produit s’appelle Kiva Program de Développement de l’Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF), et il sert à aider les parents des enfants pauvres qui sont dans le projet de Christian Children’s Fund, un partenaire de l’IMCEC.  Les clients profitent d’un taux d’intérêt diminué.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou Tacko M., age 35, is a Senegalese woman who is requesting a loan to finance her business. For ten years, she has been selling fabrics, cosmetics, bed sheets, and tea. With this loan, she's going to replenish her inventory in order to serve her customers better. She has never had a loan from IMCEC before. She lives in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She is married, and with the revenues from her enterprise, she helps her husband with family expenses. Ms. M. is requesting a special IMCEC product. The product is called PDEF (the Kiva program for child and family development). It's for helping parents of poor children who are part of the project, the Christian Children's Fund, a partner of IMCEC. Clients benefit from a reduced interest rate.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, cosmetics, sheets, and tea

loans.name: Mahougnon

texts.fr:
H. Mahougnon est née vers 1958 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Mahougnon est veuve et mère de trois enfants dont deux garçons et une fille. Depuis le décès de son mari Mahougnon vit à Sodjéatinmè dans sa maison paternelle avec sa belle fille. Mahougnon vend de boissons alcoolisées localement produites et des ustensiles de cuisines. Mahougnon a déjà eu un crédit à ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de commerce. Mahougnon a bien remboursé ce crédit. Mahougnon demande aujourd’hui un deuxième prêt pour mieux développer son activité. 
                      
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
H. Mahougnon was born around 1958 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a widow and the mother of three children, 2 boys and a girl. Since her husband died, she has been living in Sodjéatinmè in her father’s house with her daughter-in-law. Mahougnon sells locally produced alcoholic drinks and some kitchen utensils. She has already had an Alidé loan for boosting her working capital, and she has repaid it. She’s now asking for a second loan to develop her business further. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy four 50-liter drums of a local beverage called sodabi and three dozen basins

loans.name: 043 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Thoa N. Thị (106) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Thoa is the leader of a 5-member group loan offered by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 043 - Quảng Hưng (18.01.043).

Thoa is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Thoa owns and operates a butcher shop where she butchers and sells pork in the local community. Thoa has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Thoa joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thoa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.626.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She used her previous loan to expand her business. She is now requesting a new loan of 1.626.900 VND that she will use to expand her business. This will be Thoa's second loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

  • N. Thị Hoa (107) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.
  • N. Thị Phượng (108) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.
  • T. Thị Hải (109) is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.
  • N. Thị Tuyên (110) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 1.626.900 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Thoa N. Thị (106) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Thoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 043 - Quảng Hưng (18.01.043). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ and bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thoa kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. Vào 2008, Thoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị Hoa (107) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. Thị Phượng (108) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. T. Thị Hải (109) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất and buôn bán thức ăn. 4. N. Thị Tuyên (110) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả and giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng and chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Safija

texts.en:
Safija B. was born in 1957 and comes from town of Bratunac. She lives there with her son and daughter-in-law. Her son is employed, but Safija and her daughter-in-law are not. They are busy in the field producing vegetables, and they started orchard farming last year. Safija owns the meadows and sells the grass every year.

Safija decided to request her first loan from WWI (Žene za žene International) in the amount of 1000 KM to buy a cow. Safija saved some money and together with this loan, she will have enough to buy a cow. In this way, Safija's family will have enough milk and milk products and she hopes to be able to sell some as well.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, estado civil casada, y es madre de 4 hijos (3 a su cargo) y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en La Comunidad de Chimu Central.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela R. hace casi 4 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la elaboración de artesanías en totora. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de material quesana y chillihua, Julia va a elaborar sus artesanías en totora y chillihua (plantas de la zona), ella nos cuenta que este es su negocio y le va muy bien.

Su deseo es construir su casa.
A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos que ayuda bastante a las mujeres para que puedan salir adelante solas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a member of the Community Bank "Las Totoritas" located in the Chimu community, Puno district, province and department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married and mother of 4 children ( 3 of which are in her care). She has completed primary school and lives in the Chimu Central community. She has been working with the Manuela R. movement for almost 4 years, with an original loan of 300 New Soles used in the making of crafts made from totora, a locally grown reed. She is currently requesting a loan of 1500 New Soles for the purchase of woven mat materials and chillihua. Julia will make her items from totora and chillihua (plants that grow in the region), she says that this is her business and that it is going very well. Her wish is to build her own home. She likes the facilities of the loans which provide great help for women that want to get ahead on their own.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chillihua and totora

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Marie Vianney H., a 21-year-old single man. He and his 16-year-old sister are orphans so he takes care of his sister with whom he lives in the Mukamira sector of the northern province.

This entrepreneur operates his business in Mukamira, where he sews clothes and sells them. He started this business three years ago and works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Mr H. used to obtain a monthly profit of approximately $200 after paying his three workers who help him to run his business smoothly. Now he is seeking his first loan worth 300,000 RWF from Kiva partner, Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan he will buy more fabric to make more clothes. In this way he plans to expand his business and make more profit. As a result he will buy two more modern sewing machines for making more quality products.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Jorge Luís

texts.es: El señor Jorge Luís T. L. , tiene la edad de 40 años , habita en el barrio , San José de los Ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , la cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades agrícolas , ellos tienen un hijo de siete años de edad , el cual estudia su primaria , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Jorge desde hace ocho años se dedica a ala agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , él inicio esta activad con el apoyo de sus padres . Con  el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha
texts.en:
Jorge Luís T. L., aged 40, is married and the father of a son, aged 7, who attends primary school. They live in the neighborhood of San José de los Ríos in the municipality of Ticuantepe. His wife works and supports him in his farm activities. They hope for a future with better living conditions.

Jorge has been a farmer for eight years. He began this activity with the help of his parents. His greatest challenge is lack of funding. Jorge will use his loan to buy fertilizers and other inputs to his cultivation and get a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his cultivation

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza A., a 37-year-old woman from the village of Purok Mirasal, Cabantian, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental, is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Riza makes and sells snacks and delicacies in her community. Riza has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In August 2009, Riza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Riza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be Riza's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila D. is 57 years old, married with seven children ranging in age from 17 to 37 years old, with the youngest still going to school. The D. family lives in the village of Brgy, Rizal, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Some of her children worked so that they could help shoulder the family's expenses. As her children grew older, the family expenses also increased, and it became obvious that her husband's income would not be able to sustain the family's increasing needs. This situation made her decide to start her own business to augment the family income. 

Leonila started a small food vending business in her local community. She sells "bananacue" and "camotecue' - made by frying whole bananas and sliced sweet potatoes, then adding brown sugar into the oil once the banana or sweet potato is cooked, and caramelizing the sugar until it coats the banana or sweet potato. It is called "bananacue" and "camotecue" because they are sold skewered in bamboo barbecue sticks. She also sells "Halo-halo" - literally meaning mixed. "Halo-halo" is made with a mixture of candied fruit and jellies, scraped ice, milk and sugar. Corn Flakes and Leche Flan (Caramelized milk custard) are also added in many "halo-halo" recipes, and it can be topped with ice cream to make it more special. This is very popular during the hot summer months. She also sells ice candy made with frozen fruit juice or a frozen milk-based mixture.

Aside from her food vending business, Leonila also sells Ready-to-Wear clothes. She's been operating this business for thirty-seven years now and she continues to maintain a good relationship with her customers and maintains the good quality of her products. She earns about $88 a month from her business activities. The income covers some of the family income, provides the allowance of her youngest child who still goes to school, and the balance is reinvested into the business. 

Leonila has retained her good record with the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon. She paid off her thirteenth loan of PHP 19,500 on time, and it went a long way in providing her with a revolving working capital for her business. Now she is borrowing PHP 17,000 for her 14th cycle loan. She intends to use this loan to add to her working capital.


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph T. is married and the father of two young children. He is 31 years old and provides transportation services on his motorbike. For the last 5 years, Joseph has driven passengers on his motorbike along with one employee with whom he initially switched shifts; later the employee drove a second rented bike.

With the loan, Joseph plans to purchase a second motor bike so that he can stop renting one. He hopes, with increased income, he will be able to complete the extension of his apartment where he lives with his family. Joseph is a first time borrower at ARD and the sole breadwinner for his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Momoh

texts.en: This is Momoh Senkoh. Momoh is 30 years old, and lives and works in the town of Magbass with his wife and six children. He is seeking a loan of 1 million Leones from Kiva Lenders and SMT in order to pay school fees for his children, two of whom attend primary school and the rest attend secondary school.

loans.use: School fees for children

loans.name: Julfa

texts.en:
Julfa V. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Julfa owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling different daily-use product in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Julfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bakyala Kwekulakulanya Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en:
S. Amina is the leader of her group in Lugazi. She is 42 years old and married with 9 children aged 23 – 9 years, of whom 6 are still in school; she takes care of 14 dependents.

Amina has a clothing store in Kinyolo that has been operational for 10 years, and she is able to make 60,000/= as profits a week. Her business is mostly affected by the ever changing seasons, high price of stock plus the high rent for her store. She ensures that she has enough stock for her customers to choose from, plus having competitive prices. She hopes to expand her store in future as well as to have an educated family. Amina needs a loan to help increase her working capital since she spent most of it on school fees.

loans.use: buying more clothes for resale

loans.name: Ildeverte

texts.fr: D. Ildeverte est née en 1967 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Ildeverte vit depuis sa naissance dans le 3ème arrondissement de Porto-Novo. Mariée à AHOUANDJINOU Germain, un gendarme, Ildeverte est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Ildeverte vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Ildeverte a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Depuis sept ans, Ildeverte vend de l'huile de palme, de la boisson alcoolisée locale ("sodabi") et de tapioca (aliment local fait à base de farine de manioc) à son domicile. Ildeverte s'approvisionne à Adja dans le Mono au Bénin. Ildeverte a obtenu déjà de ALIDé, deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'agrandir davantage son commerce, Ildeverte sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ildeverte D. was born in 1967 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Ildeverte has lived her whole life in the 3rd arrondissement of Porto-Novo. Married to Germain Ahouandjinou, a policeman, Ildeverte is the mother of one child, who is in school. Ildeverte lives together with her child and husband. The couple provide for the family together. Ildeverte attended school up to the secondary level. For seven years, Ildeverte has been selling palm oil, local alcoholic beverages ("sodabi"), and tapioca (a local food made from manioc flour) at her home. Ildeverte gets her supplies in Adja, in the Mono area of Benin. Ildeverte has already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which were repaid properly. In order to increase her working capital and further enlarge her business, Ildeverte is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cans of palm oil and bags of tapioca

loans.name: Kwasi

texts.en: Kwasi is thirty-two years old. He is a petty trader who trades in used clothes, selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new cloths are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore selling of used clothing has created a market for many men and women like Kwasi. He wants to use the loan to buys more bales of used clothing to increase his inventory. He believes this loan would help him expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mr. Sun S., age 51, and his wife, Mrs. Sokhoeun Khim, age 52, live along National Road Number six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1979 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One son is a fisherman and the other one is a driver. Their daughter is attending school.   

Sun and his wife are rice farmers. He is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorized hand tiller to assist him on his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: El Cupesi Group

texts.es: El grupo “Cupesi” esta representado por la señora Olga y conformado por 17 miembros que van cursando su primer ciclo con la institución, todos los miembros son padres y madres D. familia muy trabajadores y emprendedores. Entre las actividades que realizan esta la venta D. hojalatería, herrería,  pan, pollo, queso, comida, perfumes, electrodomésticos, abarrotes y a la prestación D. servicios como maestra, la dedicación D. las socias a sus negocios es bastante ya que muchas D. ellas dependen del ingreso diario para mantener a sus familias por ejemplo la señora Olga se dedica a la venta D. hamburguesas en el cruce D. dos avenidas para sustentar a sus dos hijos ella es casada pero dada la situación lo que gana su esposo no les alcanza para pagar el alquiler, servicios básicos y la educación D. sus  hijos por lo que en la mañana se dedica a repartir el periódico y en el transcurso D. la tarD. y la noche empieza a vender sus hamburguesas con la ayuda D. sus pequeños. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para mejorar sus negocios y poder adquirir mejor ingresos para el mejoramiento D. sus hogares y la posibilidad D. darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. A pesa D. ser su primer ciclo las socias del grupo ya tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben que se necesita para poder seguir contando con el apoyo económico y con la confianza D. nuestra institución, muchas ganas D. trabajar, muchas ganas D. salir adelante y sobre todos unidad en sus grupo.
texts.en:
The "Cupesi" group is represented by Olga, and includes 17 members who are in their first loan cycle with this institution. They are all mothers and fathers, and are hard-working and entrepreneurial. They are involved in businesses like tinsmithing, blacksmithing, selling bread, chicken, cheese, food, perfume, appliances, and groceries, as well as providing services like teaching. The dedication of these people is high, since they depend on their businesses for daily income to sustain their families.

For example, Olga sells hamburgers at the intersection of two avenues to proviD. for her two children. She is married, but given her husband's income, they don't have enough to pay for rent, basic services, and education for their children. That is why she delivers newspapers in the morning and sells hamburgers in the afternoon and evening, with the help of her small children.

These loans will be used to buy ingredients, materials, and tools to improve their businesses and increase their incomes, so they can improve their homes and give their families a better quality of life. Although this is their first loan cycle, the members of this group already have experience with group loans and know that the group is necessary for them to have access to this economic support and they need to keep the trust of our institution. They have a strong desire to work and to get ahead, and they are united in this group.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Leng Dul Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 20 people who live in Trapeang Angk village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Leng D., 42 years old, is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are weavers, while the others attend the local public school. She is a weaver and her husband Mr. Loung Srey is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to support his family’s living.

In the rice field, they have a problem because it is infertile soil, but they did not have enough money to support it. So in order to improve her family’s living conditions, Mrs. Leng D. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for the field.

All the members are in the picture but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 28 years old and is married with three children who are 1, 3 and 9 years old. She and her family live in Gatsata, a region of Gasabo where Francine owns a small shop selling a variety of goods such as cooking oil, cosmetics products, etc. This is her seventh successful year in this business. Her shop is open from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Although Francine has been in this business for a long time, her shop is still too small to sell all the basic goods to her customers. Most of her customers request foodstuffs such as rice, peas, wheat, corn flour, sugar, etc., but she can't sell them due to a lack of enough capital.

To end this, Francine is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her original investment. With this loan, Francine will save for the future of her children as well as reinvest in her shop so that she can ensure the sustainability of her business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods for her store

loans.name: Leak

texts.en: Mrs. Leak P. is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Chruoy Pisei village, in Kandal province. She is a corn farmer and also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Sary Srei, is a goldsmith, a business from which he can receive a small salary to support his family. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Leak P. wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and the rest of the loan will be used to support her farming crops. This couple has two children, one of whom is a student in the local school while the youngest one is only 4 years old. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding and the rest of the loan she would use to support her farming crops.

loans.name: Marites' Group

texts.en:
Marites C. is from the village of Awallan, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 36 years old. Marites is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marites is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and for sale. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support financially immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Eilleen

texts.en: Eilleen’s family is sustained by pig farming and canteen vending. She is 44 years old and from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. In 2000 she started these businesses. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to back up her business with additional capital. She requested 15,000 Philippine Pesos to buy food ingredients and feed for pigs.

loans.use: pig feed and food ingredients

loans.name: Lemara Ole

texts.en:
Lemara Ole N. is 39 years old. He is married to Mampai Lamara N. and he is the father of eight children. 

Lemara is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last fourteen years.

Lemara learned about KADET from a friend who is already a KADET registered client. This will be Lemara’s first loan. He is planning to spend 20,000 shillings on maize and 30,000 shillings on wheat farming.

With the profits Lemara hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his maize and wheat production. He also hopes to buy a few bulls for fattening and selling latter.

Lemara’s future dream is that he will be able to educate all his children and built a nice house for his family to live in. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To plant maize and wheat

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 28 years old and married, and he has two children. He passed primary school. 

He owns a food store. He will use this loan to purchase a vertical refrigerator and food. He has a good reputation in the market and among his friends. He sells good-quality food at reasonable prices, so many customers buy their daily necessities from him. His business is the main source of his family income.

loans.use: To purchase a vertical refrigerator and food

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes P., 29, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Ronnie P., a vendor, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn money so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling balut (cooked fertilized duck egg, a native delicacy) during the evenings while selling candy and pocketbooks during the day for the past few years.

Gertrudes has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative. She was consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business, by buying additional products to be incorporated into her current inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional products to be incorporated into her current inventory

loans.name: La Hermandad Group

texts.es:
L. Sra. Josefa llego D. su tierra natal el Cuzco  hace 5 años cargada D. ilusiones y con deseos D. progresar, cuando llego a lima empezó a vender caldo D. gallina  en L. calle lo cual era muy riesgoso, juntando algo D. dinero y con L. ayuda D. su esposo que le facilito un capital pudo empezar el negocio D. venta D. abarrotes alquilo un puesto en un mercado compro mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos etc. empezó a vender estos y otros productos D. a pocos fue ganando clienteL. y le va muy bien en su negocio que lleva por nombre “SEÑOR D. HUANCA”.
Con sus ganancias y ahorros Josefa  ha podido comprar su propio terreno, considera que su mayor logro es poder darle a sus hijos una buena educación en un buen colegio para mas adelante quiere terminar L. construcción D. su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales  y con respecto a su negocio quiere tener un minimarket donD. pueda vender D. todo productos variados regalos,comestibles,bebidas etc. Este negocio lo quiere poner en su propia casa, elL. esta segura que podrá concretar sus sueños este préstamo le servirá para el pago D. mercadería D. abarrotes que tiene pendiente ,el grupo “L. HERMANDAD” del cual elL. forma parte esta integrado por 11 socias todas trabajadoras y con ganas D. triunfar .

* Josefa es L. Sra.que esta con casaca ploma
texts.en:
Josefa arrived from her birthplace, Cuzco, 5 years ago - filled with hopes and dreams of success. When she arrived in Lima, she started selling chicken broth on the street - a job that carried considerable risks. With some small savings and financial help from her husband, she was able to start a business selling groceries at a stall that she rented in a market. She would buy produce such as rice, sugar, and noodles and sell these and other products. Gradually, the number of customers she had grew and her business, which she has given the name “SEÑOR D. HUANCA”, is going well. With her earnings and profits, Josefa has managed to buy a piece of land, which she considers her greatest achievement because it has given her the potential to proviD. her children with a good education in a good school. Later on, she would like to finish building her house and hopes her children will secure professional jobs. In terms of her own business, Josefa wants to have a 'minimarket' (a small supermarket) where she can sell a whole range of different products, such as presents, food, and drinks. She wants to set up this business in her own home. She is sure she will be able to fulfil her dream. The loan she has requested will be used to pay for the groceries that she needs. The group to which she belongs, “L. HERMANDAD”, comprises 11 members, all of whom are hardworking and determined to succeed. * Josefa is the woman seated, holding a blue folder.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries for her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre D. familia D. 54 años D. edad que vive junto a sus hijas en el sector Los Aguilares, un centro poblado rural del distrito D. Pítipo, un distrito agricola que pertenece a la provincia D. Ferreñafe y que se encuentra ubicado a mas D. 45 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace cinco años a la venta D. comida en un pequeño puesto D. venta ubicado a un lado D. la carretera que une a la ciudad D. Ferreñafe con BatangranD., su puesto está ubicado cerca a un paradero D. mototaxis, sus clientes son los transportistas D. la zona y las personas que acuden D. los caseríos cercanos a tomar el vehículo que los moviliza hacia las ciudades D. Ferreñafe y Chiclayo. 

Su negocio goza D. muy buena acogida debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el rubro, a la buena atención que brinda y a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus alimentos. Ella complementa sus ingresos con el negocio D. crianza y venta D. animales menores.

Juana desea adquirir algunos insumos para preparar mas platos D. comida y asi poder aumentar su nivel D. ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles. Ella es una mujer alegre y tranquila, anteriormente ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana is a 54 year old mother who lives with her daughters in the sector of Los Aguilares, a central rural village in the district of Pítipo. This farming district is part of Ferreñafe Province and located more than 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For five years Juana has been selling food from a small vending stand located besiD. the highway in the city of Ferreñafe con BatangranD.. Her food stand is situated near a motorcycle taxi stop, so her customers are mostly local drivers and their passengers who are traveling to the cities of Ferreñafe and Chiclayo.

Her business has been well-received the entire time it has been in operation, all attributed to the excellent service she provides and the wonderful taste of the dishes that she prepares. She supplements her income by raising and selling small animals.

Juana wants to acquire a few more supplies for preparing her dishes so that she can increase her sales. In order to accomplish this goal, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN. She is a happy and peaceful woman. Juana has worked previously with Edpyme Alternativa and demonstrated promptness and responsibility when completing her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her food business

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem is the resident of Multan City. She moved there after her marriage. Her home is a small one with three rooms where she lives with her husband and six children. Her husband is 58 years old and has a scrap business in the local market. He works 10-12 hours per day to earn income for his family.  Tasleem’s children could not complete their education and had to start working with their father to financially support the family. Her eldest son has his own business which he started two years ago by receiving his first loan from Asasah. 

Tasleem is a housewife as well as an embroidery artist. She makes beautiful embroidered clothes on order for her neighborhood clients. 
She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to expand his scrap business. With the loan, he will buy scrap to sell at his shop. He has five years' experience in this business and he is sure that he can improve his financial condition with the help of an investment. Tasleem is in her third loan cycle. She has proved to be a very responsible loan user and always attends meetings on time.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 63 years old and is married. Basilia owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Basilia's husband makes furniture for a living and she helps him sell his products in their community.

Basilia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Basilia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Basilia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to invest in improving her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Bourama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bourama Konaté est un homme marié de 29 ans et père d’un enfant qui vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, dès son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus telle la vente des habits. Cette activité ne lui est pas réussi, alors il décida de suivre son oncle pour apprendre la vente d’articles divers dans une boutique.
 Avec une expérience de plus 2 ans, Monsieur Bourama Konaté maîtrise son activité.
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant, il décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA Avec ce bénéfice il ambitionne  agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Bourama Konaté is a 29 year-old married man. He lives with his wife and child in the Massablacoura neighborhood of Bougouni. Not having attended a modern school, at a young age he embarked on activities that would generate an income, such as selling clothing. That business was not successful for him. Then, he decided to observe his uncle to learn about selling grocery items in a store. After more than two years of experience, Mr. Bourama Konaté has mastered his business. In order to obtain a consistent working capital, he decided to affiliate with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program to buy a variety of grocery items for his store. This is his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. He gets his supplies in Bamako (capital of the republic of Mali) from wholesalers. His customers come from the local population. He expects to make a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA with this loan. He wants to use the loan to expand his store.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of items for his store

loans.name: Zanabayar

texts.en:
Zanabayar N. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and 6-year-old son in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a "ger," the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent. Her son attends a local elementary school while Zanabayar operates a sewing business in her home by customer order. 

Her husband is a carpenter and makes a variety of wood products in their town. He had been operating a repairing center for wheels and tires between 2007 and 2009. And Natsagdorj, Zanabayar's husband, started his carpentry business in 2009. 

They have used their earnings to provide for their family and to pay the monthly loan principle with interest on time. Zanabayar is a very open-minded and friendly woman, She says, "We want to open our own carpentry workplace and increase more jobs." 

She is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan in order to purchase fabrics and materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia A. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 48 years old. Virginia is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she sells daily use products such as lotion, soap and perfume in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 8th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase groceries for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Fabiao

texts.pt:
Carlos Fabiao M. nasceu no Distrito de Macie, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 8 filhos cujas idades não se lembra e todos vão a Escola. Fez somente 2ª classe não continuou porque tinha que ajudar na pastagem do gado familiar. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua segunda esposa que se encontra na província de gaza enviando algum valor para as despesas de casa.

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo a procura de emprego e veio sozinho. Trabalha numa empresa agrícola como operador Agrícola ha mais de 4 anos, recebe um salario de 1.690.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda com ajuda da esposa que faz negócio consegue poupar algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.

O seu maior sonho é terminar a construção da sua casa. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito.


























Carlos Fabiao M. nasceu no Distrito de Macie, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 8 filhos cujas idades não se lembra e todos vão a Escola. Fez somente 2ª classe não continuou porque tinha que ajudar na pastagem do gado familiar. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua segunda esposa que se encontra na província de gaza enviando algum valor para as despesas de casa.

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo a procura de emprego e veio sozinho. Trabalha numa empresa agrícola como operador Agrícola ha mais de 4 anos, recebe um salario de 1.690.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda com ajuda da esposa que faz negócio consegue poupar algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.

O seu maior sonho é terminar a construção da sua casa. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito.
texts.en:
Carlos Fabiao M. was born in Macie District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique.  He is married and has 8 children whose ages he does not remember; all the children go to school.  Carlos only finished second grade and did not continue because he had to help graze the family's cattle.  He lives in his own house with his family and supports his second wife, who lives in Gaza Province, by sending her some money for household expenses. 

Carlos left Gaza to move to Maputo looking for work, and he came alone.  He has worked for more than four years at an agricultural company as an agricultural operator.  He receives a salary of 1,690 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses.  With the help of his wife, who runs a business, he is also able to save some money through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings).

He has never had loans from other banks.  Carlos learned about Hluvuku through co-workers who are also customers of this institution.  This is his first loan.  He is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron, and other items) to continue construction on his house.

His greatest dream is to finish building his house.  Carlos is confident he will pay off the loan ahead of time and ask for another loan.

loans.use: Construction materials (cement, sand, stone, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Roben

texts.en:
Roben is a thirty-five year old married man with six children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He dreams of building rentals to increase avenues of income for his family, buying a car, and opening up a store in Kampala.

He wants a loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: Buying maize and beans to resell at a profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For seeds, manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Domenic

texts.en:
A very driven small business owner, Domenic purchased his laundromat in 2009 in order to seek business opportunities on his own terms. 

The previous owner had focused more on taking money out of the business rather than reinvesting, leaving Domenic with some heavy work to accomplish. However, he successfully remodeled the building, replacing the floors and purchasing all new furniture. He has established a whole new feel to the business with music constantly playing and laptop accessibility for the busy Bostonian with a full service laundromat and dry cleaning service.

His day begins at 8 AM and isn’t complete until 8 PM. And it is all done in the style of what Domenic calls "a one man band." Domenic paid for all of the original remodeling of the laundromat out of pocket because a local bank declined to lend him money due to the size of his business. With this loan from ACCION USA, Domenic will be purchasing a new hot water heater to maintain the flow of business and increase his energy efficiency. His current hot water heater is 75 years old and incurs high energy costs as well as being much smaller then newer versions.

Eventually, Domenic wants to be able to purchase more stores and hire a team of employees to run his growing businesses. Watching his current business take root has inspired him to continue growing and continue to provide for the increasing number of his returning clients.


About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA:
An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.’

loans.use: To purchase a new hot water heater

loans.name: Sarey

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarey L. is 47 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Pha, is 52 years old. They have been married since 1983 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. The family lives approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sarey sells vegetables in Phnom Penh City. Her husband is employed fulltime. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to ride to work

loans.name: Manzanitas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “MANZANITAS” es un grupo de 10 mujeres que ha decidido unirse para solicitar crédito y además recibir capacitación y atención en salud,  serán parte del centro focal de Panamericana, ellas están iniciando su primer ciclo.

Cada una de las socias tiene negocio propio, de servicio, producción o comercio. 
Para su organización, la B. C. Manzanitas cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Isidora, una tesorera, la señora  Alejandra y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Sonia.

La  Presidenta, la señora  Isidora vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos,  la señora Isidoro está en el negocio de la venta de  queso, ella tiene este trabajo desde hace treinta y cinco años.   El negocio fue aprendido de su mamá,  trae queso de poblaciones cercanas, como Peñas y Los Andes y los vende en la Ciudad de La Paz, en la Feria de la Garita de Lima.  En cuanto a la venta, recibe la colaboración de su hija.  
El préstamo solicitado fue por Bs.2000.- y será destinado para la compra de más queso.

La señora Isidora indica que esta es su primera experiencia como socia de Pro Mujer,  cuando se le consulta que es lo que le  gusta de la institución, ella responde “la capacitación”.
texts.en:
The Manzanitas community bank is a group of ten women who have decided to come together to request a loan and also receive training and health services.  They are beginning their first loan cycle and will work within the Panamericana regional office. 

Each of the group's members has her own business in services, production or commerce.  The bank is run by a board of directors which is made up of a president (Isidora), a treasurer (Alejandra) and a secretary (Sonia).

The group's president, Isidora, lives with her husband and four children.  Her business is selling cheese and she has been in this business for thirty five years, having learned the trade from her mom.  Isidora buys her cheese from nearby towns such as Peñas and Los Andes and then sells it at La Garita de Lima Market in the city of La Paz.  Her daughter helps her to make her sales.

Isidora requested a loan for 2,000 bolivianos which will be used to buy more cheese.

Isidora says that this is her first experience as a member of Pro Mujer.  When we asked her what she likes about the institution, she replied "the training".

loans.use: To buy cheese

loans.name: San Agustín Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Agustín” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de Mariano Roque Alonso.
La Señora María es una de las integrantes del comité, ella es docente y a la vez se dedica  a la  confección de almohadas y sábanas.
Ella tiene una familia muy unidad con dos hijas y su marido es guardia de seguridad.
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
La señora María solicita el crédito para comprar telas.
texts.en:
The "San Agustín" group was established by several neighbors in Mariano Roque Alonso.

Mrs. María is one of the members of the group.  She is a teacher and also makes sheets and pillows.  She has a very close-knit family made up of two daughters and a husband who is a security guard.  She is very satisfied with the activity and training she receives from the group.  

Mrs. María is requesting a loan to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad is a 36-year-old married man, the father of four kids, living in Tayouneh region. Ziad has been selling religious clothes since 1998. His business is doing well since such clothes are in high demand in his area. He is a good businessman, knows his job well and knows what's needed. He always tries to add new designs. He seeks out different clients' ideas and opinions. His work is exciting and hard, as he claims it's hard to address all customers' likes and dislikes. Ziad hopes to expand his business so that one day his children can start a company of their own to take care of and expand. All of this led him to request a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his capital by buying a new collection.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: La Sr, Juan es nacido en la ciudad de Tarija el 10  de febrero de  1969 tiene como responsabilidad llevar adelante su hogar, su conyugue es la señora  Nancy tienen un hijo de 10  año, el señor Juan Carlos  lleva trabajando en este rubro de lo que es el alquiler de camioneta hace 6 años. Solicito el crédito en emprender lo cual se la esta brindando una el apoyo necesario para que el pueda salir adelante el crédito tiene como destino el mantenimiento de su camioneta reparación del motor, es una persona responsable y trabajadora tiene ganas de superación y desea mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, el Sr, Juan esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juan was born in the city of Tarija on February 10th, 1969.  His responsibility is to get his household ahead.  He and his wife, Nancy, have a ten year old son.

Juan Carlos has worked in the field of renting a truck for six years. 

He requested a loan from Emprender, which is providing him with the needed support to get ahead.  He will use the loan for maintenance on his truck and to repair the motor.  He is a responsible and hard-working person with a great desire to succeed.  He wishes to improve the quality of life for his whole family.  He is grateful to the institution for the support provided to him.

loans.use: Maintenance on his truck (general mechanics)

loans.name: Arca De Noe Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "ARCA DE NOE" se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 8 personas de los cuales dos son varones,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida, de bebidas, equipos de música, pintores, venta de cosméticos, confección y venta de pelotas de futbol, son de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de tres socias: La Sra. Virginia  que se dedica junto con su esposo a la confección y venta de pelotas de futbol que distribuyen en los diferentes mercados de la Zona del Plan 3000, con lo ingresos que generan sustentan los gastos de su hogar además de la educación de sus hijos, con el dinero de crédito la Sra. Comprara material para la fabricacion de pelotas de futbol. La Sra. Roxana es de las más jóvenes del grupo ella tiene 21 años pero eso no la detiene para atender su negocio de venta de comida que tiene en la casa donde vive en alquiler hace tres años, ella todos los días muy temprano realiza las compras de abarrotes y carnes que necesita para la elaboración del almuerzo que vende en su pensión, ella con esto colabora a los gastos que tienen en su casa ya que tiene un hijo y su esposo trabaja como músico los fines de semana, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería como ser abarrotes e ingredientes para la elaboración de sus platillos, todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que esta agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank "Arca de Noe" [Noah's Ark] is in its first cycle with the institution.  It is made up of 8 people, 2 of whom are men.  Their businesses include selling food, drinks, musical instruments, painters, cosmetic sales, producing and selling soccer balls.  They are from the area known as "Plan 3000".  

The group formed thanks to the initiative of three members, including: 

Mrs. Virginia, who together with her spouse makes and sells soccer balls that are distributed in the different markets of the area.  With the income that they generate, they are able to cover the costs of their home and the education of their children.  With the money from the loan, Virginia will buy material to make soccer balls.  

Mrs. Roxana, who is one of the youngest members of the group.  She is 21 years old, but that doesn't stop her from taking care of her business.  She sells food from the home that she has been renting for 3 years.  Every day she gets up very early to buy her groceries and meat that she needs to make the lunches that she sells at her apartment.  Through this, she is able to contribute to the finances of the household, since she has a son and her husband works as a musician on the weekends.  With the loan, she will buy merchandise like groceries and ingredients to make her dishes.  

All of the women are responsible and hardworking  and are very thankful to the bank for the support it has given them.

loans.use: to buy materials to make soccer balls

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina, D. 64 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija menor Leslie D. 15 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. DesD. muy pequeña Catalina aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra arveja, col, brócoli, olluco, papa y habas, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista D. Tarma. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 49 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos D. las plaga D. insectos que pueden afectar a sus plantaciones. Su deseo es comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus nuevas siembras le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Catalina, 64 years old, is a woman who has always fought to survive in life. She lives in her own home with her cherished youngest daughter, Leslie, who is 15. She wants to be able to give her a better quality of life.  

At a very young age Catalina learned to work in the field with her parents, who taught her everything she had to do to get a good harvest. Now she has her own land, which she cultivates and cares for with a lot of love and patience. She plants peas, cabbage, broccoli, ulluco [a tuber], potatoes and broad beans, which she takes to the wholesale market in Tarma to sell. What she likes most about her work is planting the crops, since she feels that her hard labor bears fruit. 

She has been doing this for 49 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting the crops from the insect plagues that can affect her plantations. She wants to buy new land, so that she can increase her production. This is her 10th loan with MFP. She knows that she must make her payments punctually and is ready to do so. With the 1,009 nuevo soles that she has requested, she will buy manure for her land, so that the new plantings will bear good fruit.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Kabende Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
James is a member of Kabende Tukwatanize group, which literally means "we should cooperate" and as a group policy each member has to guarantee the other in accessing a loan. 

James is 32 and lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a number of businesses including tailoring and charging phones. He is also the headmaster of a secondary school. James has been in service for 6 years and he is still doing well despite challenges in finance and bad debts. Nonetheless, he dreams of setting up a tailoring school in the next 5 years. James wants to buy a tailoring machine his portion of the loan.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 33 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Danny de 27 y sus 2 queridos hijos Kevin de 5 y Evelyn de 10 meses, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Miguel el trabajo duro es una actividad que lo dignifica, es por eso que desde muy joven decidió trabajar en todos los trabajos que se le presentaban. Ahora se encuentra laborando como estibador en el Mercado Mayorista de la ciudad de Lima, él pone todo su esfuerzo en su trabajo, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende el sustento de su familia, paralelamente a esta actividad ha logrado poner un pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su barrio, la cual es administrada por su esposa y juntos esperan que este negocio propio les brinde los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su vida. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus compañeros de trabajo, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados bultos que llegan hasta el mercado, pero sabe que es su trabajo y tiene que hacerlo. Con el tiempo, espera hacer crecer su tienda. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable. Con los mil nuevos solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Miguel, 33, is a kind, hard working man living in his own house with his wife, Danny, 27, and their two beloved children, Kevin, 5 and Evelyn, 10 months, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life.

For Miguel hard work is an activity that dignifies him and this is why he’s worked from a very early age at whatever jobs came to him.  He is currently working as a Stevedore in Lima’s Wholesale Market.  He puts all his effort into his work because he knows that his family’s support depends on it.  At the same time, he’s managed to install a small grocery store in his neighborhood that his wife runs.  Together they hope this business of their own will provide the necessary income to improve their lives.  What he likes best about his work is chatting with his coworkers.  He’s been in this job for two years and considers the most difficult part of it having to carry the heavy bundles that arrive at the market.  However, he knows that it’s his job and he has to do it.  In time, he hopes to enlarge his store.

This is his second loan with MFP and he knows that he has to repay it on time if he wants to access a future loan.  He is a very responsible member of his communal bank.  He will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more products to better stock his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Gloria L. es socia del banco comunal Cumbe, vive por el sector de San Antonio en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido y se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, esta parroquia cuenta con hermosos lugares para visitar y admirar la belleza de la naturaleza.

Doña Gloria tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 11 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, están construyendo su casa pero actualmente  viven en casa de un familiar.
 
La Señora. Gloria se dedica al a venta de animales hace 5 años, vende pollos, chanchos, cuyes, etc.  en los días de ferias y también son para su consumo.
