Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más animales como pollos, cuyes, chanchos, etc. para su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
Gloria  L. is a member of the Cumbe communal bank.  She lives in the San Antonio area in Cumbe parish.  This parish has a cold climate but its people are very warm and they work in the business of raising animals and farming.  This parish has lovely places to visit and to appreciate its natural beauty.

Gloria is 32, married, and she has 2 children: 12 and 11. Her oldest son is in secondary school and her youngest son is in a city school.  Her husband is a bricklayer. They are building their own house but currently they live with a relative.
Gloria has worked selling animals for the past 5 years.  She sells, chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, etc on market days and also she uses them for food.

She has been with the communal bank for 6 years and she will use her new loan to buy more animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, etc. for her business.

Her goal is to have her own car.

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, etc

loans.name: Fabio

texts.es: Fabio, tiene la edad 62 de  años, está en unión libre y vive con  su esposa y sus 4 hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. El lo que quiere es realizar la compra de los insumos apara la asistencia de su almacigo. El cuanta con la experiencia y el terreno apto para la siembra de ese cultivo, lo que quiere es generar todas las ganancias para seguir adelante con su proyecto y así poderle ofrecer a sus hijos el estudio para que lleguen a ser profesionales en su futuro y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Fabio, 62, is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and their 4 children, who are his main priority.  What he wants to do is to purchase some supplies for his cultivations.  He has experience and land that is well-suited for coffee crops.  He wants to generate earnings to get ahead with his business, so that he can offer his children an education so they can become professionals in the future.  He also wants to provide a better quality of life for his family.  This is the first loan that he has taken from FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken other loans before from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents. He is from Lebanon. He works as a mechanic. He has a good business reputation and works hard with his father to better satisfy the family's needs. Each day he looks for valuable services to add to his business. Today, he is requesting a loan of $800 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to improve his business and purchase new mechanical tools to be able to serve more customers. He is very positive and he is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanical tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for assorted provision items by cartons.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: Fortunato tiene  65 años, es un hombre humilde. Hace 33 años unió su vida a Agustina, su esposa desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad. Ahora viven solos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de San Juan de la Libertad. La zona de San Juan, es conocida por sus buenas tierras de cultivo que en su mayoría son de papa. Por ese motivo el nombre de la asociación es “Capital semillera”. Desde muy joven comenzó con su oficio de agricultor, desde entonces sembró toda variedad de papa como: “pericholi, canchan y yungay”, todo depende de la temporada de cosecha y la calidad de sembrío. Su trabajo esmerado y su dedicación hicieron que adquiera 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde pudo obtener buenas ganancias y apoyar a sus hijos. Los que ahora con orgullo comenta: “Todos viven en Estados Unidos”. Se siente orgulloso de lo que logró y quiere seguir hasta el fin de sus días; trabajando la tierra que lo vio nacer. En todo este tiempo logró obtener un camión con el que trasporta cargamento de frutas y verduras a todo el país, además de visitar cada 6 meses la costa del país, donde comercializa la semilla que cosecha. Por todo ello quiere continuar sembrando y mejorando la calidad de sus cultivos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “capital semillera” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para lograr sus objetivos. Además se compromete a cumplir con puntualidad sus cuotas. Fortunato de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, para distribuirlos entres sus cultivos de papa de la variedad “yungay”, que tiene sembrado en una hectárea de terreno agrícola. Asimismo piensa utilizarlo en sus próxima cosecha de papa  de la variedad “única”
texts.en:
Fortunato, age 65, is a humble man.  Thirty-three years ago he joined his life with Agustina, who has been his wife for eight years.  They have four children, and all of them are adults.  Now they live alone in their own house in the rural community of San Juan de la Libertad.  The San Juan zone is known for its good farmland upon which potatoes are mostly grown.  That is why the name of the association is “Capital Semillera” (Seed Money).

He started his occupation as a farmer when he was very young.  From then on he has planted all types of potatoes like “pericholi” (a white potato that is sweet and full of water), “canchan” (has a pink, thin skin; the meat is of a pale whitish color), and "yungay" (round white potato good for boiling).  Everything depends upon the harvesting season and the quality of the plants.  Through his painstaking work and his dedication he acquired three hectares of farmland.  With the land he was able to get good income and support his children.  He now proudly comments, “All of them live in the United States.”

He is proud of what he has achieved.  He wants to continue working the land where he was born until the end of his days.  In all of this time he managed to get a truck, which he uses to transport his fruit and vegetable cargo throughout the country.  In addition, he visits the coast of the country every six months to sell the seeds that he harvests.  He therefore wants to continue planting and improving the quality of his crops.

He belongs to the “Capital Semillera” (Seed Money) Commual Bank.  This is his seventh loan with MFP.  He hopes for your collaboration in order to achieve his objectives.  He pledges to make his payments on time.  Fortunato will use the requested loan to buy various sacks of organic fertilizers to apply to his yungay potato crops, which he has planted on a hectare of farmland.  He is thinking of using that land for the “única” variety of potato for the next harvest.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase horticultural seeds to grow fodder.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor  Juan Antonio  tiene  treinta y nueve años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria terminada, y tiene  un  total de un hijo  de tres años de edad. El se  dedica a la venta de comida  desde tres años atrás.
El pidió el préstamo para comparar mas ingredientes para la venta  de  comida, sus clientes le recomiendan  vender cena  ya que a ellos les  gustaría comprarle en la noche.  Esta muy contento por que su  negocio le ha dado las ganancias que el deseaban, su esposa Claudia le ayuda a cocinar y atender  a los clientes, entre los dos han ello crecer su negocio para darle un mejor futuro  a su hijo.
Uno de sus sueños es  tener un restaurante  cuentan con muchos clientes   ha quienes, también le gustaría  que  pusiera un restauran para que fuera toda la familia a saborear los deliciosos platillos de  Don Juan Antonio.
Le da  las gracias a fundación por  el apoyo que le ha dado para  salir adelante y ofrecerle  una mejor  vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio is 39 years old, he has one child aged 3, he studied through the second year of high school and he has been engaging in selling food for the past three years.
He is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients for his food selling activity. His customers suggest to him to sell dinners, because they would like to buy from him at night. He is very happy because his activity has provided him with the earnings he wanted. His wife Claudia helps him cooking and tending to customers, and the two of them together have made the activity grow in order to offer a better future to their son.
One of his dreams is to own a restaurant, and he has many customers who also wish he would open a restaurant in order to bring all of their families to taste Juan Antonio’s delicious dishes.
He is grateful to the institution for the support received in progressing and in offering a better standard of living to his family

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for his food selling activity.

loans.name: Gbotema Ii Group

texts.en:
Bintu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Kenema city 34 years ago. She is married to a carpenter and the couple has 2 children, one in primary school and the other in secondary school. 

Bintu sells clothes and has been doing this type of business for many years now. She and her team members have applied for this loan in order to add more goods to their respective businesses. In this way, sales and profits can increase, and consequently, their standard of living will also improve. Bintu is going to use her share of the loan to buy bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime  tiene 54 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ganado. Hace más de 40 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que con la ayuda de su esposa es que ha logrado salir adelante. Consiguió adquirir experiencia necesaria para este negocio, pues la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan muy buenos productos. El crédito es para la compra de toros, vacas, chivos, entre otros. El sueño de  Jaime es que sus hijos logren seguir con este medio de vida  pues obtiene ciertas ganancias.
texts.en: Jaime is 54 years old.  His business is buying and selling livestock and he has been in this business for more than 40 years.  With the help of his wife, he has managed to get ahead in life.  He managed to acquire the experience which he needs for this business as most of his customers request very good-quality products from him.  This loan will be used to buy bulls, cows, goats, etc.  Jaime's dream is for his children to manage to continue in this business as it makes decent profits.

loans.use: to buy bulls, cows and goats

loans.name: Othman

texts.en:
Othman is 40 years old, married and has two children.  He is from Iraq. 

In 2006, Othman opened a workshop for selling and repairing spare parts, oils, and wheels for cars. He has gained a good level of experience in this field because he began work at a young age. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to buy an air compressor and two small crane machines. He is aiming to make higher profits to purchase additional items and inventories and to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor and two small crane machines.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 52-year-old married woman with 5 children. She lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. 

Erlinda is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for 30 years. She works hard to support her family. Erlinda has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and other farm inputs. Erlinda hopes to improve her income so that she could pay in full the land that she acquired.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a 45-year-old married woman with 7 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Mirasol sells her husband's catch at their town's market and also buys from other fishermen to have more fish to sell. In addition, Mirasol dries fish outside her house and sells them around her neighborhood.

Mirasol has requested this loan to buy an icebox and more fish to sell. Mirasol hopes for their business to grow bigger and to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy an icebox and more fish to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years.  He is 29 years old, married to Wambui, and they have one school-going child.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this is his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs.

In future, Stephen hopes to expand his farm and improve his farming methods and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya and operates a motorcycle transport business. He has done this for two years and it has enabled him to start an outside catering business too. He is married and has four children. The two youngest children still depend on him and are in school.

Owing to the increase in the cost of fuel, Benard has applied for a loan of KSH 20,000 to revamp his outside catering business. He believes from this, he can continue to educate his children and improve his living standard.

Benard has set a target of opening up an electronics shop and a wholesale business in the near future. He is happy to be associated with Milango and its partners.

loans.use: To purchase catering items/utensils

loans.name: Chiratidzo

texts.en: This is 28 year old Chiratidzo from Chitungwiza, married with one child. He also cares for one dependent. Chiratidzo is into poultry business. The business has been in operation for 11 years. He says the main challenges faced are competition and the rate at which the chicks die. Chiratidzo has requested a loan of $600.00 to buy chicks and feed. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him  to improve the standard of life of his family. In the future Chiratidzo plans to expand his business and sell more than 300 birds per month.

loans.use: To buy Chicks and Stock feeds

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a 61-year-old married woman with four children between 14 and 25 years old. Maxima's husband works as a carpenter.

Maxima has had a tailoring business for 15 years. She repairs clothes and makes dresses. She also makes uniforms. Maxima earns 4,000 PHP per month with this business. She plans to use her loan to repair her sewing machine and buy parts. Maxima hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her children to finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to repair her sewing machine and to buy parts.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with three children, one boy and two girls. She lives in a rental house with electricity and running water, and her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and electricity. For the past six years, Grace has operated a juice-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. Grace decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Grace is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to establish an electronics shop and purchase electronics to sell. In the future, she dreams of establishing a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase electronics and establish a shop

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 53 years of age, married and blessed with five children. She and her husband are striving to give the highest level of education to their children since they believe that education is the only treasure they can give.

To make living, Leticia engages herself in farming, which is her family's main source of income. She and her husband plant and harvest rice and sell it in the future. Most of the profit she earns from the business went for their children's fees in school.

Leticia wants to borrow a loan of PHP 27,000 to pay for the labor cost in farming and to buy fertilizers for her rice crop. She will use the loan wisely to earn a higher income from the business.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost in farming and to buy fertilizers for her rice crop.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 18 years to 26 years. She describes herself to be a kind woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells onions and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. In addition, she also sells small fish commonly known as ''omena''. Her primary customers are residents in her home area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of traveling when getting onions and tomatoes for selling. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more onions and tomatoes. Her business goal is to be selling tomatoes and onions wholesale within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо живет в городе Душанбе. Ей 45 лет. Она разведена с мужем. У нее есть дети. Она воспитывает детей одна. Мехринисо живет вместе детьми. Она обеспечить детей,  предоставляя услуги портнихи у себя дома. Мехринисо принимает заказы на шитье женской одежды. Уже 3 года она занимается своей деятельностью. Мехринисо очень любить своих детей, и хочет улучшить  их условия жизни, чтобы дети жили комфортно. Она решила взять кредит и отремонтировать дом. За счет кредита она намерена приобрести стройматериалы.
texts.en: Mehriniso lives in the city Dushanbe. She is 45 years old. She is divorced from her husband. She has children. She is raising the children on her own. Mehriniso lives with her children. She supports them, offering services as a dressmaker from her home. Mehriniso accepts orders for sewing women's clothing. For three years already, she has been involved in this activity. Mehriniso loves her children very much, and wants to improve their living conditions such that they will live comfortably. She decided to take a loan and repair their home. On account of the loan, she intends to acquire construction materials. Mehriniso hopes for  support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and repair her home.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Hello lenders, meet Salome who is a 31-year-old smallholder farmer from Kapsowar area in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Salome owns a 2-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. The kind mother keeps dairy animals and grows varieties of crops and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming. Salome is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder women farmers with little irregular income are hard to get in Kapsowar. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Salome. Juhudi Kilimo facilitate loans that empower smallholder farmers like Salome because the institution believe that women too are good and hardworking farmers.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Ninci

texts.es:
Ninci es de la ciudad de Villarrica, ella es personal  policial y al mismo tiempo estudia la carrera de derecho.
Su meta es terminar  la carrera de derecho, para tener  más  ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida  y para tener más posibilidad de ayudar  a su familia. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad

loans.name: Messan

texts.en:
Messan A., born in Ahépé (Yoto prefecture) on October 17, is married and the father of two. He holds a high school diploma, but his parents had no money left to provide a university education for him. He found employment in a shop, earning a little money to help support his three brother and his retired parents. Household expenses continued to grow, so he used the little he had saved, plus a $350 loan, to open a hardware shop that he manages strictly and efficiently. The location of his shop brings him a good number of customers, and he often runs out of certain items for sale. He buys his merchandise locally, in Lomé, which does not leave him a profit margin in proportion to the size of his business. Finding that more and more of his customers are disappointed, he has decided to stock goods from Nigeria. Now, in order to do this, he needs more financial resources.

So, to expand his business and augment the income he needs for his family that depends on him alone, Mr. A. is requesting a loan of $1,500 to enlarge his shop and to diversify the range of goods offered. His level of education and his experience are major assets for good management and a profitable business.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Messan, né le 17 octobre à Ahépé (Préfectur de Yoto) est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Après son baccalauréat, ses parents n’avaient plus de moyens pour l’inscrire à l’Université. Il s’est fait employé dans une boutique de la place où il gagnait un peu de revenus l’aidant à subvenir aux besoins des ses trois frères et ses parents devenus inactifs. Les charges devenant plus lourdes et avec ses petites économies et un crédit de $350, il ouvrit une boutique de quincaillerie qu’il gère avec rigueur et efficacité. L’emplacement géographique de sa boutique, lui amène assez de clients et il a souvent de rupture de stock de certains articles. Il achète ses marchandises sur place ici à Lomé, ce qui ne lui laisse pas une marge bénéficiaire à la taille de ses activités. S’apercevant que sa clientèle devient de plus en plus importante qu’il n’arrive pas à satisfaire à temps, il décide de approvisionner à partir du Nigéria. Or, ces transactions demandent un fonds de commerce plus important qu’il ne dispose pas.

Ainsi, pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus aux besoins de sa famille qui ne compte que sur lui, Monsieur A. Messan sollicite un crédit de $1500 qui servira à agrandir sa boutique et à diversifier la gamme de ses articles. Le niveau d’études et l’expérience de Monsieur A. Messan constituent un atout majeur pour une bonne gestion et rentabilité de ses activités.

loans.use: To stock up and sell hardware and related goods.

loans.name: Loh

texts.en:
Loh is married and mother of six children. Coming from a Moslem background, it was difficult for her to join a group. Her inability to raise capital for business was the source of her motivation. She received training on marketing techniques and credit management from GHAPE. With her first loan of $40 she succeeded in providing her community with raw foodstuff and roasted corn, plantain and cocoyams.

With a loan of $200, she plans to continue in the same trade but increase stock by buying more charcoal, plantain, cocoyam and corn. She plans to pay her loan in 15 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the first month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Mobile Koki restaurant

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda has 6 years expericen trading in the market. She started her business with a small table and a limited number of goods. She faced many difficulties but over time, she expanded and developed her business. She wanted people to find everything for their babies that they were looking for and that is why she has a wide assortment of clothes and toys. She is married and has 6 children of her own.

Her children help her when she is away for a trip to wholesale market. With the new seasons, Mavjuda would like to buy a new assortment of goods and is hoping to use the loan for the same.

loans.use: Business development; procure new inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothes-selling business

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
" I have some construction that I need to get done. I need to install the roof, doors and windows so that we can use these rooms since our house is very small and my family is starting to feel uncomfortable." I'm requesting a loan in the amount of $500 USD to install the roof, doors and windows.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar, me falta solo poner el techo, puertas y ventanas para poder habitar esos cuartos ya que mi casa es muy reducida y mi familia ya esta muy incomoda”. Solicito 500.00 dlls para poner el techo un cuarto, una puerta y las ventanas

loans.use: To install a roof, doors and windows in extra rooms

loans.name: Neba Evelyn

texts.en: Neba Evelyne is 35 years old and the mother of two children. She has been abused by her husband and his family because she is unable to have additional children. Because she and her children receive virtually no support from her husband, she has gone into business for herself frying and selling potato chips. She has applied for a loan that will allow her to continue her current line of work, as well as sell bananas and raise chickens. She will use her income to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy bananas, potatoes and baby chickens

loans.name: Taliilagi

texts.en: Taliilagi is 40 years old and is married with five children, who are all in school. Her business was started when she joined SBPD at the end of last year. She started by selling ice cakes. She now also makes and sells pancakes. She sells her pancakes two days a week at the primary school in her village. Her husband helps her in the business because there is a lot to do every morning and afternoon. They earn a profit of $110 WST ($44) a day. This money helps meet her family's needs and expenses such as church donations, food expenses and phone bills.  The money will also help her send her children to school and to pay back what she owes SPBD. Taliilagi is a hard working mother.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pancake business and for home improvement

loans.name: Jesús Gilberto

texts.es:
I have over 7 years experience with the business of operating and managing heavy machinery for construction. This business is the source of income for my brothers' two families and myself. I am applying for a loan of $1,200 USD in order to provide maintenance to my machinery and to buy tires.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Tango ya más de 7 años con el negocio de renta de maquinaria pesada para construcción. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para la familia en el trabajamos dos de mis hermanos y yo. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para darles mantenimiento a la maquinaria y comprar llantas.

loans.use: To supply maintenance to my machinery and to purchase tires.  (Mantenimiento y compra de llantas a la maquinaria.)

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long C., 38, is a housewife and lives with her husband and three school-aged children in Prey veng province, Cambodia. Her husband works as a construction foreman and generally makes around $7 each day. This amount of money is shared to several part of her family’s expense. Mrs. Long C. hopes to use this loan to purchase construction tools for her husband to facilitate his works.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools for her husband to facilitate his works.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia is a member of the communal bank, located in Bella Vista in the district of Calleria. She is 43 years old. She has 4 children. With her first loan she decided to invest it in the sale of food.

She continues her business. She wakes up early to go to the marketplace and buy ingredients needed for the preparation of food. With help from her kids, they manage to make the food and sell it in the afternoon.

She hopes to get another loan, this time for 1,000 Soles, which she will repay in 5 months. She will buy a bulk of rice, sugar, chicken, fish, bananas, vegetables and other spices.

Lidia is a mother and father to her kids and she does it with a lot of effort to give them a great education and meet their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal Juntas Hasta el Final, ubicado en la Av. Bellavista 1101, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años es separada, tiene 4 hijos. Ella con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad continua con este negocio, se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los víveres que necesitara para la preparación de sus comidas, con la ayuda de sus hijos realiza la preparación, y por las tardes realiza las ventas

Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, pollo, pescado, cecina, plátano, verduras, condimentos, etc.

Lidia es madre y padre para sus hijos y todo lo hace con mucho esfuerzo, para darles una buena educación y que no les falta nada,a sus hijos

loans.use: she will buy products for making her meals to sell

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es:
Hernando lives on Cotaña St. in the Amor de Dios neighborhood in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and their six children, aged 24, 22, 19, 17, 15, and 12 years old. He works as a bricklayer in the construction industry.

The credit from this loan will be used to purchase school supplies for his younger children, who need notebooks, colored pencils, crayons, etc. This is his fourth loan with Impro, and a credit evaluation qualifies him for its request. Hernando has been a customer of ours since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Hernando vive en la calle Cotaña de la zona Amor de Dios o ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposa y su 6 hijos de 24, 22, 19, 17, 15, 12 años respectivamente. Trabaja como constructor albañil. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material de estudio para sus hijos pequeños ( necesitan cuadernos, lápices de colores,crayolas, etc.). Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Hernando es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Purchase school supplies for his school-aged children.

loans.name: Philista

texts.en:
Philista A. is a 48-year-old dedicated community health worker (CHW). She lives in Sagam Siaya, Kenya, with her husband and four of her children, and she also supports nine orphans. She was trained in 2001 by KMET in home-based HIV/AIDS care. Through her own initiative and hard work, she opened a community pharmacy at Midhine market in Sagam, the only one serving the surrounding community. Philista has managed to expand her business and build a successful enterprise. People come from from far away to buy drugs from her pharmacy, as it is the only one in the area. She requires an additional $700 in order to purchase more stock of drugs, which are fast moving and in high demand, in order to boost her income.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To buy stock of drugs

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married with two children. She has been selling soft drinks for ten years. She used to sell at the road side but with the support from her husband and Sinapi she now has a store of her own. She currently sells snacks to passengers and drivers as her store is close to a lorry station. She wants to stock a larger variety of soft drinks to meet the tastes and preferences of her loyal clients. Abena is a member of the group called “Lydia Mma” meaning Lydia’s children. Lydia is the mother who formed the group in the community to seek financial support to the economically active but poor women. Hence the name, Lydia “Mma” to honor her. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks and assorted biscuits

loans.name: Delfina Noemi

texts.es:
Doña Delfina Noemí has a well-established restaurant in Grau avenue in front of the principal square in Yunguyo where national and international tourists as well as workers from the different nearby organisations come to enjoy breakfasts, snacks and lunches that she prepares every day.

For many years, she used to sell food on the street: becoming a member of the Community Bank “Villa Copacabana", she received a loan of 300 soles, which she used to buy rice, oil, noodles and vegetables. With these her business expanded.

With this loan of 3000 soles, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will buy the necessary ingredients to prepare extra dishes. Part of the loan will also be used to build her house.

Delfina is 62 years old, she managed to complete primary school She is married, and has three children (one son and two daughters), who are now independent.

She has learnt to be responsible, and wants to continue working, living happily. She would like to complete the construction of her house and see all her children find work.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Delfina Noemí tiene su restaurante muy bien instalada se ubica en el Jr. Grau frente a la Plaza principal de Yunguyo a donde llegan turistas nacionales, extranjeros y trabajadores de las diferentes instituciones que existe, donde acuden a degustar, desayunos extras y almuerzo que todos los días prepara.

Desde hace años atrás se dedicaba a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria ; siendo socia del Banco Comunal “Villa Copacabana” donde tuvo un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compro arroz, aceite, fideos y verduras. Con lo que fue creciendo su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará los insumos necesarios para la preparación de platos extras. Parte del crédito está destinado a la construcción de su casa.

Delfina tiene 62 años de edad, logro estudiar primaria completa, casada, tuvo 3 hijos un varón un dos hijas mujeres quienes ya son independientes.

Ella aprendió a ser responsable, tener ganas para seguir trabajando, vive feliz, le gustaría terminar la construcción de su casa y que sus hijos tengan trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase of raw ingredients.  House building.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. He is 28 years old and is married with three young children. His wife sells cosmetics to help with the household expenses and to help improve the living conditions for their children who are in grammar school. Juan works as service laborer; a job he has held for four years. The loan that he is seeking will be used for improvements on their home such as pouring in a concrete floor as their home currently has a dirt floor. For this he needs to buy cement, sand and stones. He wants to improve his home in order to be more comfortable with his family. His dream is to continue improving his home and to help his wife in invest in the sale of clothing as she has been successful in the sale of cosmetics. Juan also wants to be able to have his children continue in school so that they can make an honest living.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Juan habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad, ella vende cosmético para ayudar en los gastos del hogar y así apoyar a su esposo y poder tener mejores condiciones para sus hijos que están estudiando en la primaria. Juan trabaja de operario de servicios, tiene cuatro años de estar laborando. El préstamo que está solicitando es para hacer mejoras en su hogar como es poner piso de concreto ya que hasta el momento es de tierra quiere hacer la mejora en su casa para estar mas cómodo con su familia, para esto necesita comprar: cemento. arena y piedrin. Su sueño es seguir mejorando su vivienda, ayudar a su esposa para que invierta en la venta de ropa ya que le va bien con la venta de cosméticos. Lograr que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que puedan ganarse la vida honestamente.

loans.use: Add a concrete floor to home.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina  vive en la calle Antonio Arze  de la zona villa Ingenio en la ciudad de El Alto. Ella es casada (su marido es transportista) y tiene 3 hijos. 
Se dedica al la venta ambulante de golosinas en las diferentes ferias de la cuidad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercaderia en mayor cantidad. 
 
Es su segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Celestina lives on Antonio Arze street in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city of El Alto, Bolivia. She is married (her husband works in transportation) and has three children. She is a street vendor and sells sweets at different markets in El Alto.

She will use the loan to buy bulk merchandise. This is her second loan from Impro, and according to a review of her credit history she is qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets in bulk to resell

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luís P. Q.  vive en una casa de madera por lo que se ve en la necesidad arreglar el techo  ya que es de lamina y en tiempote frió es muy helado también cuando llueve se le traspasa el agua, ya vienen estas temporadas y el quiere arreglar este problema lo antes posible. Como pueden ver es una persona muy humilde que necesita de nuestra ayuda el tiene hijos y no desea se que pudieran enfermarse. José Luis solo necesita la cantidad de $150 dólares.
El y su esposa trabajan en una maquiladora de la ciudad pero lo que ganan es muy poco para poder hacerlo de contado pero si en pagos muy pequeños y largo plazo.
texts.en:
José Luís P. Q. lives in a wooden house for which he sees the need to fix the roof since it is made of laminate and, in cold weather, becomes very frozen. Also, when it rains, water seeps through. These seasons are approaching and he wishes to fix this problem as soon as possible. As you may be able to see, he is a humble person who needs our help. He has children and he does not want them to become ill. José Luís needs only $150. He and his wife work in a factory in the city, however they earn very little and to be able to make what they need would take a long time and be in small payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix the roof of his house.

loans.name: Lorm

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorm C. (pictured with her daughter and grandchildren), 47, is widow with two children, one son and one daughter. Her son is married and lives outside of the family home. She lives with her daughter and her two grandchildren. The family lives in a small village across from the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Lorm has been weaving silk for ten years, a skill she learned from her neighbors. She buys silk and thread from Phnom Penh and sells her finished products to middlemen who market her products in Phnom Penh. Her daughter is also a silk weaver. Lorm is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter's loom.

loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving silk.

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Mrs. Norn Y., 46, cultivates rice and makes Khmer Cakes that she sells in front of her house, earning a daily profit of about $2. She is married to Mr. On Srey, 48, a fisherman, and they have four children, all single, one a garment factory worker earning $75 per month.

In order to earn additional income and enlarge the business, Norn is requesting a $300 loan to purchase piglets to raise plus more ingredients and carving wood to make Khmer Cakes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for raising.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Mrs. Channy P. is a villager in Toek Nim village in Kandal province. She is a fish seller in the local market. As her business is going well, she wants to expand it. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish to re-sell in order to fulfill her customers' demand. Her husband, Mr. Man Prak, helps her in the current business. Mrs. Channy P. is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fish to re-sell in order to fulfill her customers' demand.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Bancomunal Luz de la Esperanza 
Paulina es de Junín, de la bella ciudad de Tarma, es casada, tiene 50 años, cinco hijos mayores que trabajan y estudian;  llega a Lima por que a su esposo lo trasladan en su trabajo, ella decidió salir a vender en un mercado como ambulante gelatina y  marcianos, cada vez vendía mas, alquilo un pequeño puesto  y también empezó a vender jugos, ahora ella es propietaria de su puesto  han pasado veinte años y su esfuerzo valió la pena. 

Desde que entro en Finca ha aprendió hacer responsable en la puntualidad de sus pagos, le gusta las charlas que recibe de cómo mejorar su negocio.
Necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles, para ampliar su negocio y comprar artefactos como licuadora, vitrina y vender mas cosas. 
El sueño que tiene es que sus ahorros crezcan mas, para poder construir de material noble su puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Village Bank Luz de la Esperanza. She is from Junín, in the beautiful city of Tarma, and is fifty years old and married, with five grown children who are working and studying. She came to Lima because her husband was transferred by his job, and she decided to work in the market selling gelatin desserts on foot. She began selling more and more, and rented a small booth where she began to also sell juice. She now owns her booth and has spent twenty years there; all of her effort has been worth it. Since she has joined Kiva partner FINCA Peru she has learned to be responsible with making punctual payments, and she enjoys the tips she gets on how to improve her business. She requires a loan of 1800 soles in order to expand her business and buy items such as a blender and a display case to generate more sales. She hopes to save enough money to build a more durable booth in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a blender, a display case, and other items to improve sales

loans.name: Mónica Lizbeth

texts.es:
MONICA LIZBETH, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”, ubicado en Jr. Los Céticos N° 651 – San Fernando, Distrito de Manantay, tiene 39 años de edad, 04 hijos, su esposo compra y vende productos de la región.
Se levanta muy temprano por la mañana, a las 04:00 a.m., para ir con su esposo al puerto fluvial de la ciudad de Pucallpa, compran plátanos, pescado, frutas y animales en variedad.
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con los cuales compró 30 manos de plátanos, pescado fresco, pescado salado 01 fardo, para venderlo en el mismo puerto fluvial. Con el ahorro y sus ganancias compró un motokar para poder transportar sus productos de un lugar a otro vendiendo  por la ciudad.
Con este préstamo de S/.1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró repuestos para el motor de su motokar, lo pintó, tapizó los asientos, ahora esta listo para continuar trabajando.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el gran apoyo que le dio en el momento de crisis que pasaba su familia.
texts.en:
Monica Lizbeth is a member of the Banco Comunal (Communal Bank) Vecinas Unidas, located on Jr. Los Céticos N° 651 – San Fernando in the Mantanay district. She is 39, has four children and is sells products throughout the region. She wakes up very early in the morning, at 4 a.m., to go with her husband to the inland port in Pucalipa to buy bananas, fish, fruits and meat. The first loan she received was for S/. 300 Nuevos Soles, with which she bought 30 bunches of bananas, fresh fish, and one bundle of salted fish to sell in the same inland port. With her savings and her earnings, she bought a motokar in order to transport and sell her goods from one side of the city to another. With this new S/. 1,300 Nuevos Soles loan, she will purchase replacement parts for her motokar, paint it and upholster the seats so that it can continue to be of service. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the great support she provided during her family crisis.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts for her motokar, paint, and upholstery

loans.name: Sarona

texts.en:
Sarona A., 34, is married with five children. She has one year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and general public two days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 230 Tala (about $95). SPBD loans are Sarona’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and equipment needed for her plantation business

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is thirty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. According to her, all of her children are currently in school – junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Afia works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is farmer.

Afia trades in secondhand clothes. She procures bales of secondhand textiles from Kumasi and Accra. She sells in the local market and hawks to sell as well. She wants a loan to procure more bales of textiles so she can trek to other markets to sell. She aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.en:
Lọc Phan is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has two young children. To make a living, Lọc owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Lọc has been engaged in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Lọc joined TYM Fund (a Kiva partner) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lọc has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Lọc is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Lọc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Tasuthekeh Group

texts.en:
These is Mariama K., Marie S., Sallay K., Aminata F., and Fatmata Kanu. They call their group Tasuthekeh. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them to strengthen their businesses. This will helped them a lot as sales will improve, profit increase and consequently their standard of living will also improve.

Mariama is the leader of this group. Mariama was born in Waterloo, twenty miles form Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is thirty-four years of age, married with three children – two in secondary and one in primary school. She has been a businesswoman since childhood days. She sells cottons. With this loan, she will add onto her present business capital to buy a bale of cotton. A bale of cotton costs Le 1,400,000.

loans.use: Buy a bale of cotton

loans.name: Kossigan

texts.fr: A. est un jeune homme célibataire qui travaille très dur pour subvenir à ses propres besoins. Il a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle il fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Son stock actuel de marchandises a diminué, raison pour laquelle il s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter un crédit pour acheter 02 cartons de détergents , 08 bidons d’huile de 25l, 10 sacs de riz, des cartes de recharges et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
A. is a young unmarried man who works very hard to support himself. He opened his own shop in which he does commerce in grocery items. His current stock of merchandise has shrunk, so he's inquiring with WAGES to request a loan to buy two boxes of detergents, eight 25-liter drums of oil, ten sacks of rice, some mobile phone recharge cards, and various grocery items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
"H. Trương Thị  (20203050042) is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 8-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 08 (8).


H. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new L. of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The L. will be the first L. taken out by H. from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị L. (20203050043) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business iraising livestock.


2.  Trương Thị M. (20203050044) is a 20-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.


3.  Trương Thị S. (20203050045) is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.


4.  Cao Thị L. (20203050046) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  N. Thị N. (20203050047) is a 55-year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


6.  Nguyễn Thị D. (20203050048) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


7.  Nguyễn Thị T. H. (20203050049) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND L. to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Trương Thị  (20203050042) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 08 (8).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trương Thị L. (20203050043) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Trương Thị M. (20203050044) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ T.ật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ.


3.  Trương Thị S. (20203050045) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ T.ật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ.


4.  Cao Thị L. (20203050046) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  N. Thị N. (20203050047) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  Nguyễn Thị D. (20203050048) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


7.  Nguyễn Thị T. H. (20203050049) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr:
B. Delphine est née vers 1973 à DANGBO dans la vallée de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Delphine est mariée à OLIVIER HINNNOUHO un menuisier de profession. Delphine est mère de deux enfants, tous deux scolarisés. Delphine vend des glacières, des tissus, des chaussures et des céréales. C’est à Lomé, Capitale de TOGO pays frontalier au Bénin que Delphine fait ses provisions de glacières, tissus et chaussures. Quant aux céréales, Delphine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Delphine achète ses produits sur commande et les distribue à crédit à ses clients. Delphine
a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé ; et Delphine rembourse ses crédits toujours sans aucune difficulté. Pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire davantage ses clients, Delphine sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
B. Delphine was born around 1973 in DANGBO in the Ouémé valley in southern Benin. She is married to OLIVIER HINNNOUHO, a cabinet-maker by profession, and is the mother of two children who are both in school. Delphine sells coolers (insulated containers), cloth, shoes, and grains. Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin, is where she acquires her supplies of coolers, fabrics, and shoes. As for grains, she supplies herself at Dantokpa, the grand international market of Benin. She buys goods by special order and distributes them on credit to clients. Delphine has already benefited from two loans from Alidé and has always repaid them without any difficulties at all. To bolster her business and to satisfy her customers more, she is requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six 5-meter lengths of damask cloth, six small coolers, and two 100-kg sacks of corn

loans.name: 008 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en: Liên N. Thị (13) is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Liên is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 008 Quảng Hưng (18.02.008). Liên is married and has six adult children. She owns and operates a business running a food stall, primarily selling vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,300,000 VND a month. In 2004, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in renovating her business. The loan will be her 10th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. Thị Tú (74) is a 21-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business. 2. N. Thị Bình (75) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Liên N. Thị (13) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa. Liên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 008 Quảng Hưng (18.02.008). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán rau trong cộng đồng địa phương. Liên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Liên kiếm được khoảng 1.300.000 VND. Vào 2004, Liên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Liên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 10th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị Tú (74) là 21 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc. 2. N. Thị Bình (75) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel C., who has received senior high school education, sells soft drinks in Elmina. He is married to a trader and has two children. Responsible for paying school fees and bills, Samuel has been selling soft drinks since 1998.  His loan will be used to buy more soft drinks to increase sales and expand the business. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to complete a building project.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to increase sales and expand the business.

loans.name: Palomitas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Palomitas Blancas” se encuentra en el Centro Focal “Los Andes”, se agruparon hace tres años, por la necesidad de contar con capital de trabajo para mejorar sus negocios. Una buena parte de las integrantes tiene el negocio de venta de medicina natural como jarabes hecho a base de eucalipto y miel, pomadas caceras para la piel, jarabes de uña de gato y otros,  una de las que se dedica  a la venta de estos productos es Roxana A. hace 10 años, ella trae su mercadería de Perú y vende en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y La Paz, en esta ocasión requiere del préstamo para la compra de mercadería.

Otra buena parte de las integrantes del grupo se dedican a la confección de  prendas de vestir como chamarras, faldas, camisas y necesitan el préstamo para comprar tela,forro o hacer mantenimiento a sus máquinas de costura.
texts.en:
The Community Association “Palomitas Blancas” (Little White Doves) is located in the regional center of “Los Andes”. The members joined together three years ago because they needed working capital to improve their businesses.

Most of the members have businesses selling natural medicines such as syrups made of eucalyptus and honey, homemade skin creams, cat’s claw elixir, and other remedies. One member who has been selling these products is Roxana A., who has been in business for 10 years. She brings in her merchandise from Peru and sells them at different fairs in the cities of El Alto and La Paz. At the moment, she needs a loan to buy more merchandise.

Other members of the group manufacture clothing such as jackets, skirts, and shirts. They need a loan to buy fabric and lining, as well as pay for repairs and maintenance of their sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & raw materials

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly Rosillo, 42 years old, mother of five children from Surallah South Cotabato City.. Her eldest child is 23 years old and her dreams for all her children are to have a good, healthy life and to be responsible persons always in everything that they do.

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farming materials and pay the laborers who helped prepare the lands. 

Now, she is hoping that with her decision to loan for farm financing, she will reap a good return of investment and she is happy because her loan has only 2% interest rate.

loans.use: farm financing and payment for the laborer

loans.name: Mirador De Carabayllo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. GLADYS MILAGROS Z. R., quien se encuentra sentada en la fotografía; tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos varones, menores D. edad. Ella forma parte del Grupo “El Mirador D. Carabayllo” integrado por 10 socios activos.

Hace diez años, cuando su esposo perdió el trabajo, y al notar que pasaba por muchas necesidades primordiales como alimentación, vestimenta y estudio D. sus hijos, tuvo la iniciativa D. poner un negocio, que le pudiera dar un  ingreso todos los días y a la vez le diera tiempo para atender a sus pequeños hijos luego que ellos regresaran del colegio.

Así,  empezó a trabajar vendiendo jugo D. naranja en una avenida principal, inició con un pequeño préstamo que pudo conseguir, con el que adquirió las herramientas necesarias que en éste caso eran el pelador D. naranjas, el exprimidor, unas mesitas, vasos, las naranjas y azúcar.

Con su trabajo, ella ha podido apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, adquirió algunos muebles para su casa, trasladó a sus hijos a un colegio particular.

Hoy en día, han adquirido 2 autos para hacer taxi, y le gustaría en un futuro no muy lejano tener una empresa D. taxis constituida formalmente.

El préstamo solicitado lo destinará la compra D. llantas para uno D. los autos para que pueda pasar la revisión técnica, requisito indispensable para dar servicio D. taxi en Lima.
texts.en:
Gladys Milagros Z. R., who appears seated in the photograph, is 39 years old and married with two sons who are minors. She is part of the "El Mirador D. Carabayllo" group, which consists of 10 active members. Ten years ago when her husband lost his job, she realized that they were lacking many basic necessities such as food, clothing, and education for their children, and she took the initiative to start a business which would proviD. her with income each day and at the same time leave her with time to take care of her small children after they came home from school. So, she began to work selling orange juice on a major road, starting her business with a small loan that she was able to secure and with which she acquired the necessary tools, which in this case were an orange peeler, a juicer, a few small tables, glasses, oranges, and sugar. With her work, she has been able to support her husband and cover household expenses, purchase some furniture for her home, and move her children to a private school. Today, they have acquired two cars to use as taxis, and in the near future she would like to formally open a taxi service business. The loan requested is intended for the purchase of tires for one of the cars so that it can pass inspection, an absolute requirement to proviD. taxi service in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in a new business idea

loans.name: Melsie

texts.en:
Melsie A. M. is a married woman with three dependents. Melise leases a shop at Tobu Market and runs a general store that sells foodstuffs, toiletries, and other sundry products. She has been in business for two years and has requested a loan to purchase additional provisions and local food for her store.

Melsie intends to use proceeds from the loan to pay school fees for her kids and build her own food store in the future. She has a shop assistant who normally helps her in her business while she uses part of her day to work as a cashier at a non-profit organization.

Melsie hopes to eventually buy land and build a house from income generated from her business.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for her store

loans.name: C2583 Abitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Claude H. is 26 years old and single. Claude and his family live in Gasabo district, where he opened a shop in 2006 and employs five people in his business. His general store is open every day from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening.  

Claude is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business, which will help him to earn more profit. With this profit he plans to save money so that he can buy his own house.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Saifurhman

texts.en:
Saifurhman F. lives in Jalalabad city. He is 21 years old, single, and lives with 8 members of his family. He has a video and CD shop in Jalalabad city and is responsible for paying all of the household expenses.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 AFN to expand his business and buy more CDs for his shop. He is very happy about the small loan process in Jalalabad, Afghanistan. He wants to continue his partnership with both KIVA and AFS and would like to thank all lenders from around the world.

loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 36 years old and is married with four children aged between 2 and 8 years. He lives in Kayonza district, approximately one and a half hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Samuel has been selling a variety of goods for the past ten years. He is a proven businessman and well-known in his community. The hours of his business require that he works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Samuel is now requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company, which will allow him to expand his business. He will use the loan to purchase a larger variety of goods for sale which he knows his customers want but which he has not been able to provide. With this expansion, Samuel hopes to earn more profits than ever. With this profit, he will be able to build a stronger business and take better care of his young family.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of goods and to use as working capital

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es: La señora Gloria Elena C. L., tiene 33 años de edad es casada y su esposo le ayuda con la economía de la casa, tienen tres hijos los cuales tienen las edades de 11, 8, 6 años de edad, los niños de 8 y 6 años cursan actualmente la escuela primaria y el mayor está en la escuela secundaria, solicito un préstamo con Kiva con el firme objetivo de reinvertirá a su pequeño negocio el cual es una “pulpería” (venta de abarrotes y granos básicos), ella es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace 6 años comenzó su negocio con capital brindado por su esposo el fin de este propósito es que ha futuro su pulpería logre generar mayores utilidades que se conviertan en cambios óptimos de sus niveles de vida y que puedan realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda para brindarle las comodidades necesarias para toda la familia y es que sus hijos van creciendo y le van demandando mejores espacios para cada una de los miembros de su familia y sobre todo poder ofrecerles una mayor seguridad a ellos, pues en lugar donde habitan, es en el “Barrio Waspan Norte” un barrio conocido por la inseguridad social que posee.
texts.en:
Gloria Elena is 33 years old, married, and her husband helps her with the household expenses. They have three children who are 11, 8, and 6 years old. The children who are 8 and 6 currently go to the elementary school and the older child is in secondary school. She requests a loan from Kiva with the firm goal of investing in her small business which is a general store (selling groceries and grains.) She is a hardworking woman who started this business six years ago with capital offered by her husband with the goal that her grocery will generate good profits which will allow them to improve their standard of living. They want to make some home improvements to provide necessary comforts for the whole family as the children are growing and they need better spaces for all the family members. Above all, they want to offer greater security to their children because they live in a place called "Barrio Waspan Norte", a neighborhood known for its insecurity.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her general store

loans.name: Geneviève

texts.fr: A. Geneviève est née en 1975 et vit depuis 25 ans environs à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à BALOGOUN Chérif un géomètre, Geneviève est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Geneviève vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Geneviève n’a fait que l’école primaire. Il y a 12 ans déjà que Geneviève mène comme activité, la vente de poissons fumés et divers autres produits, au marché de Fiégnon. C’est au bord de la mer et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Geneviève s’approvisionne. Geneviève a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Geneviève voudrait augmenter son fonds de roulement et agrandir son activité. C’est pourquoi, Geneviève sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Geneviève A. was born in 1975 and has lived for 25 years in the vicinity of Fiégnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Chérif BALOGOUN, a surveyor, Geneviève has two children, both at school. Geneviève lives with her children and her husband. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Geneviève has been to primary school only. For 12 years now Geneviève has been selling smoked fish and various other products at the market in Fiégnon. She gets her supplies at the seashore and also at Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Geneviève has already had three loans from ALIDé, all of which have been repaid without problem. Geneviève would like to increase her working capital and expand her business. It is for this reason that Geneviève is asking for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Mr. Phan Kong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Phan K., 46, is a village-bank president who lives in Krouch village in the Kandal province. This village bank consists of 10 members who receive different individual loans. 

Mr. Phan K. is a palm-juice collector who gathers juice to sell for an income. He now has a problem because he does not have enough money to buy bamboo to tie to the palm tree to climb. Mr. Phan K. decided to borrow a loan to buy bamboo for this purpose. His wife, Mrs. San Kang, is a farmer with four children: One is a laborer, two are studying at local public school and the other one is too young to go to school or study.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to tie to the palm tree to climb

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 60 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijas.
Desde hace 21 años vende comida en la puerta de su casa por la mañana, para ello cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para trasladar los objetos pesados. Durante la tarde se encarga de la limpieza de los utensilios y dejar todo listo para el día de mañana.
Delia cree que la rentabilidad de su negocio es porque se encuentra ubicada en una avenida muy transitada de su ciudad y gracias a sus buenas ganancias planea alquilar un local donde pueda implementar un pequeño restaurante.

Esta es la séptima oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una socia que ha demostrado ser muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos no perecibles para la preparación de sus comidas;  como arroz, azúcar y menestras.
texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and 2 daughters. She has been selling food in the mornings from the doorway of her home for 21 years. She counts on her husband’s support, and he helps her move heavy items. In the afternoons, she is busy cleaning her utensils and getting everything ready for the following morning. Delia believes the profitability of her business is due to the fact that she is located on a very busy street, and thanks to her good earnings she plans to rent a small space to open a restaurant. This is her seventh loan through MFP, and she is a member that has shown herself to be very punctual with her payments. The funds she is now requesting would be invested into the purchase of non-perishable food items for preparing her foods, such as rice and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making her food.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Née en 1971 au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, A. Elise est mariée à AKUESON Laurent, un mécanicien. Elise est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de leurs enfants. Elise vit depuis 18 ans environs à Womey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Elise n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Elise mène comme activité, la vente de condiments de sauce (tomates, piments, oignons) ainsi que du poisson fumé à son domicile. Elise s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo. Elise mène cette activité depuis 8 ans environs et a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé et qui lui a permis d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. Elise sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de se faire plus de revenu. Elise ambitionne plus tard, diversifier son activité par la vente de produits vivriers.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Togo, the country next to Benin, A. Elise is married to Akueson Laurent, a mechanic. Elise is the mother of three children, all of whom are attending school. The couple has another child in their care, in addition to their own children. For the past 18 years, Elise has lived around Womey, in the town of Abomey Calavi, with her husband and their children. The couple takes care of the needs of their family together. Elise did not attend very much school. In order to handle the needs of her children, Elise has a business selling condiments (tomatoes, hot peppers, onions) and smoked fish from her home. Elise supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Lomé in Togo. Elise has done this business for about 8 years and has already benefitted from one loan from Alidé, a loan which she fully repaid and helped her grow her income.
