Elise is requesting a second loan with Alidé, with which she intends to grow her stock and also her revenue. Ultimately, Elise aims to diversify her business by selling a variety of crops.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 crates of fresh tomatoes, 1 crate of hot peppers and 2 crates of fish.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Group 1, Kayunga

texts.en: Appearing in the small photo is K. Ben. He is part of the big group and the leader of the same group in Kayunga. Ben is 32 years old and married with 4 children, all in primary school, as he takes care of three dependents. He has had a retail shop for 4 years where he sells general merchandise from the Seeta-Nyize zone, and from his sales he is able to make 60,000 as weekly profits. Ben is a friendly and very devoted man, and he would like to expand his shop into wholesale so that he could earn a lot for his children’s school fees and future development.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise for his shop and pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Y. is 56 years old and she is a villager who lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a Khmer cake seller, where she can earn a small income to support her family.  She tries to work hard with her business but she still does not earn enough income to support her family. Thus, she is now requesting a loan of USD 400 from AMK to buy rice to sell. With her new business, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's living conditions. Mrs. Sam Y. is a widow with two children who are farm laborers and support their mother's business.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S., age 30, is married and resides with his wife and a young child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. He is a farmer, growing morning glories and selling his farming products for a gross income of about $13 per day.  His wife helps her husband in the business, earning a gross income of $12 per day.  

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike, morning glory seeds and pillars in order to increase agricultural output. He would like to use any additional profit to fix his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike, morning glory seeds and pillars

loans.name: Ester

texts.es: Ester R. G. de 60 años de edad, reside en Antiguo Cuscatlán, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y su única hija la cual se dedica a estudiar.  Ester posee una venta de productos de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa, y de la que dependen en gran manera, ya que es de una gran ayuda para la estabilidad económica de su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jabón, pan, jugos, golosinas y otros productos más. Ester tiene el deseo de poder mejorar el estado de su negocio, surtiéndolo y de esta manera poder mejorar en gran manera sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ester R. G. is 60 years old and resides in Antiguo Cuscatlán, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and her only daughter who is a student. Ester has business in her house where she sells basic necessities. She is dependent on her business since it has been a great help in providing financial stability for her family.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy large quantities of rice, beans, sugar, soap, bread, juices, candy, and other products. Ester wants to improve the state of her business. By increasing her stock, she will be able to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 40 years old. 

He is a baker. He has been working in this business for long time. He is a skilled and experienced man. 

He will use this loan to replace his old clay oven with new one and to buy a kneading machine. 

He has a good reputation in the market. His bread is fresh and flavorful and he has constant clients. People come from all districts to purchase bread from him.

loans.use: Replace an old clay oven

loans.name: Mateo's Group

texts.en:
Mateo A. is from the village of Tabid, Ozamiz City. He is 54 years old and is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. Mateo is married and has six school-aged children. He owns and operates a business planting and harvesting seaweed for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Mateo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mateo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 26 years old and single. He is student in an evening high school. In addition to his studies, he has a blacksmith shop. He will use this loan to develop his shop, to purchase an iron welding machine, and to make some shelves to hold the iron bars. 

He has good reputation in the market and he is a dependable guy. He has a strong desire and ambition to raise his income. He has been in this business for 5 years and he has a great deal of experience in his field.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and shelves for iron bars

loans.name: Nasiridin

texts.ru: Пармонкулов Насиридин проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 55 лет. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Дети живут и работают в России. Сам Насиридин имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности проработал более 10 лет. Сейчас он занимается растениеводством. Сажает фрукты и овощи для перепродажи их на рынке. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Nasiridin P. lives in the area of Shahrituz. 55 years of age. Married, with 7 children. His children work and live in Russia. Nasiridin himself has a postsecondary trade school diploma. He worked over ten years in his trade. Now he is a farmer. He grows fruits and vegetables in order to sell them at the market. He has been in this business for 15 years already. He is taking out a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Leslie Karen

texts.es:
Leslie tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Manco Capac del distrito de Paiján, una zona que se encuentra experimientando un movimiento comercial ascendente, pertenece a la provincia de Ascope y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo comida en un pequeño puesto ubicado frente a la posta médica del distrito, a un costado de la carretera Panamericana ( la via asfaltada mas grande del país), ella comparte el negocio con su madre: mientras que por las mañanas ofrece en venta platos como cebiche, papas rellenas (platos típicos del país) y otros platos que ella misma prepara, por las tardes su madre vende cachangas (especie de pan hecho en base a harina de trigo) y champús (bebida caliente hecha en base a maíz).

Leslie siempre atiende a los transportistas y a las personas que transitan cerca a la zona, su buen trato y la excelente sazón con la que prepara sus comidan han hecho que sea conocida en el rubro y que cada vez tenga mas clientes que atender, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de mas insumos para preparar mas platos de comida e incrementar su nivel de ventas.

Leslie es una joven trabajadora y empeñosa, con las ganancias que percibe de su trabajo ella se paga sus estudios en un instituto de la zona. Sus vecinos y amigos la consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Leslie is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the Manco Capac sector in the district of Paiján, an area that is experiencing an increase in business movement. This community is part of Ascope Province and is located in the region of La Libertad, which is two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Leslie sells food from a small stand in front of the district medical clinic situated along the Pan American Highway, which is the longest paved road in the country. She shares this business with her mother. In the mornings, she sells dishes such as ceviche, stuffed potatoes (a traditional Peruvian dish), and other delicacies that she prepares herself. In the afternoons, her mother sells “cachangas” (a type of bread made from wheat flour) and “champús” (a hot beverage made from corn).

Leslie always serves the drivers and anyone else who travels near the area. Her good service and the delicious flavor of the food that she prepares have brought her local recognition. Each day she has more customers to serve. Leslie is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 600 PEN so that she can buy more supplies to prepare her dishes and increase her sales.

Leslie is an enterprising and earnest young woman. Using the income she earns from her work, she is able to pay for her studies at the local institute. Her neighbors and friends consider her to be a peaceful and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction materials to replace roof of home

loans.name: Ludia

texts.en: Ludia Y. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and rice and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans and pulses (cereals) to sell. Ludia is 42 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 5 children and only 2 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her store.

loans.use: To stock bags of beans and pulses (cereals) to sell.

loans.name: Chamreoun's Group

texts.en:
B. Chamreong, 33 years old is the village bank president, having been selected by its ten members, who are located in Preak Toch village, Kandal province. 

The members will use the money to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes.

B. and her husband fish for a living.  They are able provide a small income to support the family.  B. will use the loan to buy a fishing boat and supplies for fishing.  They have seven children: five are students and also help their parents and the others stay at home.

loans.use: Buy fishing boat and supplies.

loans.name: Kanymbubu

texts.en:
Kanymbubu S. is the resident of Balykchi, a nice city in the Isykul region. Kanymbubu is 45 years old and she is married.  Her husband is a pensioner. She has raised two sons and two daughters. The sons are married and live separately with their families and the daughters work in Russia. 

In order to make money, Kanymbubu sells milk every day. She also sells apricots raised in her own garden. Her husband breeds livestock and sells some farm animals each month. With money received from the loan, Kanymbubu wants to purchase five sheep and three goats in order to increase the number of livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused micro-finance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only micro-finance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Gappal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Teresita is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Teresita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Twendagane Development Group-Jinja

texts.en:
K. Susan is 24 years old and she belongs to Twendagane Development Group-Jinja. Though she has been inundated with the stereotypical view that women’s chances of success in business are low, she like other entrepreneurial women has chosen to blaze a trail that will go a long way in demystifying that idea. It is 3 years ago that she drew up the blueprint that started her beauty salon, home decoration and poultry businesses in Bugembe-Jinja. She accords credit to her mom whom she says inspired her. 

Previously she was working in a local factory. 350,000 shillings is what accrues to her business weekly. Susan is married with 2 kids. With this loan, she wants to buy more chicks for her poultry business.

loans.use: The purchase of more chicks for her poultry business

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío Santa Rosa del distrito Las Lomas de la provincia de Piura. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas. El cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele instalar maíz. Esta actividad es la fuente mas importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre trata de manejarla del mejor modo posible. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino.

Porfirio desea adquirir fertilizantes y semillas para instalar una vez más el cultivo de maíz en su terreno. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

El es un padre bastante emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Porfirio, 53, is married and lives with his wife and children in Santa Rosa, Las Lomas district, Piura province.  The area is located in Piura region over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

He is a farmer.  He has a field where he usually plants corn.  This activity is his most important source of family income so he always strives to care for it in the best possible way.  He also raises sheep to sell.

Porfirio wants to get fertilizes and seed to plant corn on his property.  He is, therefore, asking for his first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach this goal.

He is quite an enterprising father with a strong drive to get ahead.  His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and corn seed.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: La Sra. Jaqueline es una cliente antigua de la institución, la señora vive  en la casa de su papá, ella se dedica a la venta de condimentos en cajas como ser comino ajo, pimienta, ají con picante y otros los cuales los elabora en su casa para repartir los días sábado en la graneros y  mercados, también los días miércoles viaja a Oruro donde reparte por mayor la mercadería. Doña Jaqueline vive sola ya que su pareja le abandono hace mas de cinco años y ella trabaja para sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo el cual tiene 6 años de edad la señora saca el préstamo para la compra de material para envasar los condimentos.
texts.en:
Sra. Jaqueline is a longtime client of Emprender. She lives at her father’s house and sells packages of condiments such as cumin, garlic, pepper, chili powder, and other spices that she makes at home. Jaqueline delivers her products on Saturdays to granaries and markets. On Wednesdays, she travels to Oruro to sell her merchandise in bulk.

Doña Jacqueline lives alone because her husband abandoned her more than five years ago. She works so that her six year old son can get ahead. Jaqueline is taking out a loan so that she can buy materials for packaging her condiments.

loans.use: Purchase materials for packaging condiments

loans.name: Mazakhir

texts.en:
Mazakhir K. is 51 years old man who is an independent businessman who is engaged in various activities.  In 2004 he started a small retail business along with construction materials sales and now he has his own shop where he sells electronic goods.  

He is married and has two sons who actively help him in his business.  From the first loan he was able to generate enough income to open his own shop. Now he has two businesses:  construction materials sales and electrical goods sale. The shops brings him stable income and he is going to enlarge it. Now Mazakhir has applied for 1,000 AZN to increase the inventory.

loans.use: To increase the amount of merchandise to increase profit.

loans.name: Carmen Domitila

texts.es:
Carmen de 47 años, tiene un puesto en donde vende juguetes, luces, accesorios. Vive con su hijo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores.  

Comenzó a vender juguetes por unidad para tener su propio negocio poco a poco con esfuerzo y con la motivación de mantener a su hijo ya que es madre soltera comenzó con un puesto a vender juguetes, luces, accesorios etc. Poco a poco incremento su mercadería, ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 14h00pm todo los días. Vende las luces de navidad a $ 2.25, juguetes a $ 2.00, vasos a $ 0.60 c/u. Una de las complicaciones que a veces se presenta son las enfermedades. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar juguetes y luces para la época de natividad que es cuando mas se vende. En el futuro quiere incrementa la mercadería y tener su local propio.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 47, has a vending stand where she sells toys, lights, and accessories. She lives with her son in an urban area called Orquídeas that was named after the many flowers that existed upon its discovery. There is now a park where orchids continue to grow.

Carmen began selling individual toys as way of having her own business. With a little effort and the motivation of supporting her son as a single mother, she opened a vending stand where she sells toys, lights, accessories, and other items. She gradually increased her inventory and now works every day from 7am to 2pm. Carmen sells Christmas lights for $2.25, toys for $2.00, and glasses for $0.60/each. One of the difficulties she faces is combating illness.

With this loan Carmen wants to buy toys and lights for the Christmas season, the time when she sells the most. In the future she wants to increase her inventory of merchandise and open her own store.

loans.use: Purchase toys & Christmas lights

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, de 43 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Eulogia de 47 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene Fernando en su chacra, le han ayudado a mejorar su economía, es por eso que trabaja todo lo que puede, sembrando cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus plantaciones, ya que sabe que unos productos sanos se venden y a un mejor precio. Lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que subir los empinados cerros de su poblado, ya que es ahí donde tiene sus sembríos. Para el futuro, espera mejorar sus chacras y sembrar en totalidad todas sus tierras. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea entrar en mora y perjudicar a su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará pesticidas y herbicidas, para cuidar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Fernando is 43 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 47 year-old Eulogia, and his three dependent children, for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life.

Fernando's hard days working on his plantations have helped him to improve his finances.  For this reason, he works as much as he can, growing cacao, coffee and coca leaves which he then takes to sell in the market in the city of San Francisco.  What Fernando likes most about his work is caring for his plantations since he knows that healthy products sell and at a better price.  Fernando has been in this business for 24 years and he considers the most difficult thing about his work to be having to climb the steep hills of his village because that is where his crops are.

In the future, Fernando hopes to improve his plantations and sow all of his land.  This is his sixth loan from MFP and he is ready to make all his repayments on time since he doesn't want to default and harm his community bank where he is very well liked for the order that he brings to the meetings.  He will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy pesticides and herbicides so that he can care for his crops.

loans.use: To buy chemicals to protect his crops from insect infestations

loans.name: Kry's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kry S., 47 years old, and his wife are farmers who own four hectares of land which they use to cultivate rice, corn and different vegetables to sell to make a living. This couple is working hard on the farm but they still do not have enough money, so Mr. Kry S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline. He is working hard to support his four children who are all students and also help their parents farming. 

This village bank includes ten members from Chong Kaoh village, Kandal province. The members of this village selected Mr. Kry S. as the village bank president. They hope to increase their income to improve their standard of living with these loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline for cultivating rice, corn and vegetables

loans.name: Osmel Hancel

texts.es: Osmel tiene 32 años, es un padre muy responsable y disfruta de su medio de vida. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería general. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, ha sido difícil mantener este negocio pero con el paso del tiempo ha tenido la experiencia necesaria para ofrecer a sus clientes lo más necesario en lo que ellos le solicitan. Osmel necesita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como calzado, ropa, cosméticos entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Osmel is 32. He is a very responsible father and benefits from his way of life. He sells general merchandise and has had this business for over 10 years. It has been difficult maintaining the business, but with time he has gained the necessary experience to offer his customers everything they need and want. Osmel needs this loan for the purchase of basic materials such as shoes, clothing and cosmetics, among other items.

loans.use: working capital; the purchase of basic materials such as shoes, clothing and cosmetics, among other items.

loans.name: Jairo Ramón

texts.es:
Don Jairo Ramón S. A., es Responsable de Cobranza Filial, de una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado desde hace 7 años.

Es Acompañado de 38 años de edad, tiene 3 personas que dependen de él. Vive en el Departamento de Managua, en el Municipio de Tipitapa.

Este es el Primer Crédito con CEPRODEL, el cual solicitó para invertirlo en la mejora de su vivienda, y de esta forma mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Jairo Ramón S. A. has been in charge of collections for an aqueduct and sewer system company for seven years. He is 38 years old and has three people who are dependent upon him. He lives in the city of Managua, in the municipality of Tipitapa.

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL, and he requested it to invest in home improvements. In this way, he will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 41-year-old married man, the father of three kids. He has specialized in making the tastiest Arabic sweets ever for the past 25 years. His father's shop opened in 1973 and he inherited the business. His sweets are like homemade ones; they are tasty and smell great. Everyone in the region is his client, in addition to relatives, friends, friends of friends, and passersby.

Bilal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the sixth time. All his previous loans were for improving his business and had great impact. He has been a great borrower, since his repayment history is perfect. This time the loan isn't for his business – it's requested to pay for his children's school fees. He hopes to provide the best education for his children; one that he couldn't get.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Bilda

texts.es: Bilda, de 47 años, es una mujer admirable que enviudó hace 4 meses. A pesar del dolor que siente, lucha por cuidar a sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa Kivinaki (selva central peruana). Luchadora incansable así definimos a Bilda, ella es jefa de la comunidad y como tal apoya y ayuda a los pobladores de su localidad, asimismo es vicepresidenta de la sociedad de mujeres nativas del país; puesto que le ayuda a hacer trabajos de facilitación en temas de biodiversidad y derechos humanos. Pero como mujer del campo, hace 7 años que se dedica a la siembra de cítricos en toda su variedad. En sus 5 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, no solo comparte la pasión por la siembra, también la dicha de poder producir la tierra. Ahora ella desea obtener buenas cosechas, y expandir sus terrenos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y es el primer crédito con MFP; donde espera encontrar un aliado para la realización de sus proyectos. Bilda, muy pronto comenzará con la cosecha de café, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico; los cuales esparcirá entre sus cultivos para afianzar la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Bilda, age 47, is an admirable woman who has been widowed for four months. Despite the pain she feels, she strives to take care of her three children. Bilda lives in her own home in the native community of Kivinaki in the central Peruvian jungle. She is defined by her tireless fighting spirit. Bilda is a leader in her community and supports and assists the local villagers. In addition, she serves as vice president of the native women’s society that works on issues related to biodiversity and human rights. As a woman farmer, she has spent seven years growing a variety of citrus crops on five hectares of land. Not only does she enjoy planting her crops, but she also likes seeing land be productive. Now she wants to obtain a good harvest and expand her farm.

Bilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Almendra” (Almond Blossom). This is her first loan with MFP. She hopes to be an advocate for completing her group’s projects. Bilda will soon be harvesting coffee, so she will use her loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizers which she will apply on her crops to guarantee her output.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of organic fertilizers

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Luis Miguel; el tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero; el socio es ingeniero de sistemas y alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de artesanía como chompas de alpaca, polos, gorros, mantas entre otros mas, el trabaja de forma independiente repartiendo a sus clientes la mercadería solicitada el socio lleva un par de años en este negocio el cual le brinda satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, el socio es una persona bien alegre y responsable y de esta manera el sale adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en: Luis Miguel is a member of the community bank “COMUZONE III” in Cusco.  Luis Miguel is 28 and single; he is a systems engineer and divides his time between the daily tasks buying new products and selling handcrafts such as alpaca clothing, blankets and other items.  He works independently delivering products to his clients, and it has taken him several years to establish his customer network.  Luis Miguel is very satisfied to see his business grow and is a responsable and joyful person.  He seeks a loan to buy inventory for his business in order to offer greater product diversity to his clients, and is committed to prompt repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his business in order to offer greater product diversity to his clients

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana nació en la provincia de la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 57 años de edad. Actualmente, Roxana vive junto con sus tres hijos en la ciudad Imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en arreglar zapatos, ellos tiene una zapatería que está básicamente implementada con una maquina y con hilos. Ya son varios años que se dedican este negocio y les va excelente gracias al esfuerzo que ponen en su trabajo.

Roxana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo cuero, zuelas y otras cosas más que necesita.  

Roxana es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Roxana was born in the province and city of Cusco and is 57 years old. She currently lives with her three children in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Peru). She is a responsible mother who gets her family ahead and has a family business fixing shoes. They have a cobbler shop with a basic set-up of a machine and thread. They have been running this business for several years already and it is going very well thanks to the effort they all put into their work.

At this time, Roxana needs a loan to buy materials like leather, soles, and other things that she needs.

Roxana is a responsible person who belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Sumac Purisisun” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy materials like leather, soles, and other things that she needs

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia  is 28 years old, married to Morris, and they have two children between ten and four years. She operates a retail shop in Sultan Hamud trading center. This is her primary business and she has been running it for four years. 

This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD.  She has not borrowed from other financial institutions apart from KADET.  Cicilia hopes that she will be able to add more stock and grow the business substantially.

She hopes to grow her business so that she will be able to complete the construction which had begun on her business premises.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, maize flour, grains, rice, and other food items.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 41 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Flora de 40 años y sus 04 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. El trabajo de Jorge es labrar la tierra, oficio que heredó de sus padres desde muy niño. Él viene trabajando 20 años en sus propias tierras donde cultiva plantas de cacao, café y hojas de coca de manera tecnificada. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y  jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo en sus diversos trabajos. Jorge sabe muy bien que el dinero que obtiene es por producir buena calidad de frutos. Sus productos cosechados los comercializa  en la ciudad de San Francisco y Quimbiri, lugares donde mejores precios percibe por la particularidad de sus granos y hojas de coca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados sacos de sus productos desde la chacra hasta su comunidad. Más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Es el tercer préstamo de Jorge con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de abono y fertilizantes que le serán de gran utilidad para mejorar sus producciones.
texts.en: Jorge is 41 years old and is a very hardworking man.  He lives in his own home with his wife Flora, 40, and their 4 beloved children, for whom they wish to provide a better future.  Jorge works as a farmer, an occupation that he learned from his parents when he was very young.  He has been working for 20 years on his own land where he cultivates cocoa plants, coffee and coca leaves in a technical manner.  At harvest times he counts on help from his children and from day workers who provide him with support on various tasks.  Jorge knows very well that the money he gets is related to the good quality of his fruit.  He sells his harvested products in the markets in the cities of San Francisco and Quimbiri, places where he can get the best prices for the special quality of his coffee and cocoa beans and his coca leaves.  What he enjoys most about his work is harvesting the fruit, since that is when he feels that the months of arduous labor pay off in the quality of his fruit.  What he considers most difficult is to transport the heavy sacks of produce from the fields to his community.  In the future, he hopes to buy more land to increase his production.  This is Jorge's 3rd loan with MFP, and he feels capable of making all of his payments.  He is one of the most active members of his communal bank.  The loan that he requests is to buy manure and fertilizers that will be very useful in improving his production.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
Reineiro tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su familia en casa propia. Su casa está ubicada en el distrito de José  Leonardo Ortiz a unos minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Reineiro se dedica a se dedica a realizar el oficio de pintor de muebles y metales, ésta es la actividad principal a la que se dedica, pero  también  ofrece servicios de  transporte público en un taxi, el cual es de su  propiedad.

Reineiro esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar herramientas para su trabajo de pintado ya que necesita de herramientas más sofisticadas para realizar  su trabajo de una manera más eficiente.

Reineiro es una persona que cuenta muy buenas referencias, de ser responsable y puntual, las personas que lo conocen, le tienen mucho estima pues conocido en su localidad como una persona trabajadora.
texts.en:
Reineiro is 34 years old, single, and he lives with his family in their own house. Their house is located in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, a few minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Reineiro's business is to paint furniture and metals. This is his primary business activity but he also provides public transportation services with a taxi car which he owns.

Reineiro requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase tools for his painting business. These tools are more sophisticated and they would help him work in a more efficient way.

Reineiro is a person who enjoys very good references for being responsible and punctual. Those that know him hold him in high esteem and he is known in his neighborhood as a hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his painting business.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria se dedica a compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, Maria tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, a pesar de sus dificultades que ha tenido que atravesar ya que el precio de la ropa ha aumentado, pero esto no le impidió a salir adelante con su actividad ya que siempre ha viajado a Managua en donde puede conseguir la ropa un poco más barata. El crédito es para la compra de  pantalones, faldas, camisas, vestido, trajes y ropa para niños.  Sueña con aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a clothes merchant.  She’s had this business for over 6 years.  She has three children in her care.  Despite the difficulties she’s had to go through since the price of clothes has risen this has not kept her from getting ahead with her activity since she always has traveled to Managua where she can get the clothes a little less expensively.

The loan is to buy pants, skirts, shirts, dresses, suits and children’s clothes.  She dreams with increasing her income to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lerma works hard to support her family.

She has a balut-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Lerma is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more eggs and to maintain her processing for balut-making.

Lerma has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and to maintain her processing for balut-making

loans.name: Jefrilus

texts.en:
Jefrilus is a 28-year-old single man. He lives with his mother and his sister since his beloved father passed away eight years ago. 

Jefrilus initiated a pig breeding business in 2008. He usually raises the pig for 7-8 months before selling it at around 2,500,000 IDR (~$300) per pig as long as the pig reaches the weight standard. With the income from his business, Jefrilus is able to support his mother in fulfilling their daily needs.

He is a hard worker. Even though he has a pig breeding business he also works as a guard in an elementary school near his residence and is a motorcycle-taxi driver as well. He is willing to do any work for his family and he also desires to save part of his income for his future.

Jefrilus has sold one pig recently, so currently he is fattening one pig. He desires to raise more pigs. He is sure that the more pigs he raises, then the more income he can earn. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000,000 IDR from TLM. He would like to purchase more piglets to be raised and fodder for them. He is hoping that TLM will assist him in improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to be raised and fodder for them.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 31 años, está casada con Héctor de 35 años de edad. Ambos tiene 3 hijos: Jessica, de 13, Piero, de 6 y Sandra, de 4 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. El trabajo al que se dedica está talentosa mujer es la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja y flor de gladiolo; según menciona su cosecha de gladiolo, le ofrece constantemente ingresos, ya que cosecha semanalmente. Ya tiene 13 años dedicándose a ello, y es conocida entre los vendedores del mercado mayorista de Tarma, los que aseguran que es una mujer trabajadora y honesta. Lo que le molesta de su trabajo, son las temporadas donde bajan los precios de sus cosechas, pero a pesar de las inconveniencias, está segura que podrá salir adelante. Ya que también se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una tienda que abrió en su casa, y le va muy bien en su negocio. Por ello está pensando en expandir su tienda de comestibles, pero en la ciudad de Tarma, donde hay mayor movimiento comercial. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con su negocio. Además se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que obtendrá buenos resultados en sus proyectos con el apoyo de su banco comunal, que son personas responsables y trabajadoras. Nancy de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja para su próxima cosecha. Además de varios sacos de abono orgánico para distribuirlo entre sus cultivos de flor de gladiolo.
texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old.  She is married to 35 year-old Héctor and the couple have three children: 13 year-old Jessica, 6 year-old Piero and 4 year-old Sandra.  They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the small village of Cumutay.

This talented woman is a farmer.  Her main crops are potatoes, peas and gladioli.  She tells us that her gladioli constantly make her income as she harvests them weekly.  She has been in this business for 13 years and is well known by the sellers in the wholesale market in Tarma.  They say that she is a hard-working and honest woman.  What Nancy doesn't enjoy about her work are the seasons when the prices for her harvests drop.  However, in spite of the difficulties, she is certain that she will be able to get ahead.

Nancy also sells basic household products in a store that she opened in her home and her business is doing very well.  For this reason, she is thinking of expanding her grocery store but in the town of Tarma where there is more sales activity.

Nancy belongs to the 'Pioneros de Cumutay' (Cumutay Pioneers) community bank and this is her ninth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you so that she can continue in her business.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments on time as she will obtain good results in her projects with the support of her community bank.  The members of her community bank are responsible and hard-working people.

With your support, Nancy will invest the money she has requested in buying a bag of pea seeds for her upcoming harvest.  In addition, she will buy several sacks of organic fertilizer to spread over her gladioli.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold is a single man with three children, all of whom attend school. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eight years, he has operated a posho mill machine. His potential customers are neighbors grinding maize (into flour). He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of purchasing another posho mill machine in the future. 

With the 60,000 KES he wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria es la propietaria de un negocio de  variedades y una pequeña tienda en el barrio donde habita con su esposo y sus hijos en las edades de 3 a 9 años en la ciudad de Cartagena. Ella inició su negocio con un capital semilla que le otorgó la alcaldía  y en él ha puesto todos sus esfuerzos para hacerlo crecer y generar cada día más ingresos que beneficien a su familia. Inicialmente vendía pocos productos, pero con su disciplina ha ido reinvirtiendo sus utilidades y hoy cuenta con una variedad de productos como ranchos, víveres, refrescos, artículos para damas, accesorios para el hogar, papelería etc. Su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital e trabajo para atender la creciente demanda que diariamente aumenta sus exigencias. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará artículos de la canasta familiar y mercancías variadas como accesorios femeninos. Su inversión sería exitosa porque ella vende a crédito las mercancías y conseguiría dar buenos precios por  sus compras en mayor volumen a sus rentables clientes. Su meta más adelante es adecuar su vivienda y lograr la plena prosperidad de su negocio para continuar logrando mayor bienestar en su familia.
texts.en: Maria is the owner of a variety business and a small store located in the neighborhood when she lives, in the city of Cartagena.  She lives with her husband and their children, who are ages 3 to 9 years old.  She started her business with seed capital awarded by the mayor's office.  She put all of her energy into the business to make it grow and generate more income each day, to benefit her family.  Initially, she sold few products.  But with her discipline, she has re-invested her profits, and now she offers a variety of products for sale, such as: food, supplies, sodas, women's articles, household accessories, paper products etc.  Her greatest challenge is having sufficient capital and work to meet the growing demand that exceeds her expectations daily. This is the reason she requested her credikiva, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan she will purchase "family shopping basket" items and varied merchandise, like women's accessories.  Her investment will be successful because she sells her merchandise on credit.  She would be able to offer better prices to her customers for items purchased in greater volume.  Her goal down the road is to fix up her home and achieve full prosperity from her business in order to assure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase "family shopping basket" items and various merchandise such as women's accessories.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 42 years old and married to John. They are blessed with three children. She has been a mixed crop farmer for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 18,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD. Jane will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and increase her farming and venture into dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FRATERNIDAD DE URUBAMBA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urubamba, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Celedonia; tiene 40 años de edad,  la socia es soltera;  La socia se dedica  al comercio minorista, la socia vende desayunos hechos de quinua con manzana, la socia trabaja en la avenida principal de su barrio desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la mañana que se acaba los desayunos, la socia también vende sándwich de queso, tortas;  después se va a casa lava sus servicios arregla su pequeña improvisada carreta y se va a comprar algunos insumos frescos para el día siguiente, ella prepara estos desayunos desde las 3 de la mañana, la socia desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de insumos  como manzanas verdes, quinua es esta un poco cara, leche en tarros, tortas en moldes, algunas veces ella prepara los queques para vender y siempre prepara los sándwich. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la preparación diaria de sus desayunos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Celedonia is a member of the Communal Bank “Fraternidad de Urubamba” (Brotherhood of Urubamba) which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old and single. Celedonia is a small businesswoman who sells breakfast meals made with quinoa and apples. She works along the main avenue of her neighborhood between the hours of 5am and 8am, or until she runs out of food. Celedonia also sells cheese sandwiches and cakes. Afterwards, she goes home to wash her utensils and rearrange her small improvised cart and then goes to buy a few fresh ingredients for the following day. Celedonia begins preparing breakfast meals at 3am. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies such as green apples, high-quality quinoa, canned milk, and prepared cakes. Sometimes she makes cupcakes to sell, but she always prepares sandwiches. Celedonia is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of these supplies that are used in her daily preparation of breakfast meals.

She is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing breakfast meals.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф умный и целеустремленный человек. Он занимается и выращиванием сельхоз культур. Он выращивает пшеницу и кукурузы. Имеет 2 гектара земли для посева и в этом году он посеял там пшеницу и кукуруза.  Он еще занимается откормом скота. Он получает доход от переработки абрикосов и в этом году высушил более 1 тонны кураги. Этот бизнес является семейным и летом все участвуют в сушке абрикоса. На полученные доходы, приобрел корову дойную. Шариф запрашивает займ на сумму 1500$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений и горюче смазочные материалы.
texts.en: Sharif is a smart and goal-oriented person.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He grows wheat and corn.  Sharif owns two hectares of land for sowing and planted wheat and corn there this year.  He is also involved in fattening up livestock.  He received an income from processing apricots and made over a ton of dried apricots this year.  This is a family business, and everyone participates in the apricot drying process during summer.  Sharif used his resulting profit to buy a dairy cow.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and fuel and lubricant materials.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel and lubricant materials

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is a 57-year-old married man with 4 children. His oldest child is 22 years old.

Norberto is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He has been growing and selling rice for 25 years. He has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and herbicides. Norberto hopes that his business will grow. He also hopes for his children to finish their studies and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and herbicides

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 65 years old. He is a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Rhoda, who is also a farmer. He has been in the farming business for the past 10 years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. John will use the loan to buy animal feeds and a dairy goat. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand the business. His hopes and dreams are to venture into greenhouse farming, which will help him improve the living standards of his family

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and a dairy goat.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has operated a business in the transport industry in Njabini for the last five years. He is 29 years old and married to Catherine. They have one child. 

His primary venture is the motorcycle business and he plans to venture into farming. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid for all his previous loans well and on time. He plans to use the loan to buy a cow, as well as in his transport business. 

In the future, Moses hopes to buy a matatu (minibus) to boost his business.

loans.use: To support his transport business and buy a cow.

loans.name: Washintong Joffre

texts.es:
Washington Jofree tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

LA VRC MONTE DE LOS OLIVOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 14 socios y socias. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao.

Washington se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es que los hijos culminen los estudios.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  disfrutar de las festividades de la localidad.
texts.en:
Washington Joffre, 31, is in a common law relationship and has two children.  He lives with his wife and children who are 10 and 6 years old in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Monte de los Olivos” communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from this office; it has 14 members, both men and women.  This communal bank’s members are short cycle corn, orange and cocoa bean farmers.

Washington is a corn, orange and cocoa bean farmer. His sales and his purchases take place in Chillanes Canton.  He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain his crops in good condition.

The loan will be very helpful because it will improve his quality of life.  The challenges he faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  His dream is that his children complete their schooling.  In his free time he likes to enjoy the local festivities.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet has been a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya for 18 years with her produce of maize and vegetable supplied to the local market.She depends solely on farming for the upkeep of her family of 4 children aged between 23 and 15 years.

Vilolet has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva, partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds and venture into poultry business.This is her second loan request with Juhudi after the first one of 25,000 KES. She says the income generated will help her educate her children.

Violet laments of poor market prices for the farm produce and animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Namulanda Group

texts.en:
Evans is the facilitator of the Namulanda B group. Evans and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Evans takes care of one child at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, access fertilizers and hybrid seeds and later educate his child. In the recent 2011 season, Evans had a good maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Evans was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Evans and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Evans will rent more farmland for more production and educate his child.

In 2012, the members of Namulanda B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Evans is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
At 53 years old, Reynaldo has just finished elementary school. It took him so long due to his underpriviledged background. His parents made their living through their farming business, and now he also supports his family in the same way. His children have now finished their education. He still needs to work in order to provide for his wife and secure their future in case he is no longer able to work. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides to use in his corn field. He hopes this will make a real contribution to a better crop at the next harvest. He will save his profits so he has some funds in case of an urgent situation, such as a medical emergency - which is more lkely as he and his wife are getting older.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es:
Norma, quiere invertir en el negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo para contar con capital para invertirlo en mariscos frescos (pescado, langosta, conchas), además que tendrá dinero disponible para hacer inversiones periódicas, por estos productos se dañan rápido, ella comprara la cantidad suficiente para vender en una semana.
Está contenta porque ha mejorado con el negocio, y ha tenido mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Norma wants to invest in her business. She is requesting a loan in order to have capital to invest in purchase of fresh seafood (fish, lobster, shells). In addition, she will have money available to do periodic investments because these products spoil quickly. She will buy enough to sell in one week. 
She is happy because she has improved her business and has had better sales.

loans.use: purchase fish, lobster and shells.

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en: Bayasgalan is 57 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornod Province, Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard and her two kids are unemployed. She started her construction material retail business in 2000 by renting a counter in a market. Her business location is good and stable. Over the years, she has gained many trusted suppliers and customers. Since her income is the main income in the family, she has to work hard in order to support them. She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more construction supplies. She is a sharp and hard-working woman who says, "My income is not enough to support my family. I have to do something."

loans.use: to buy more construction supplies

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 35-year-old, retail shop proprietor in Bamburi, Mombasa. 

She is married and a mother of four children. Jane has been running her shop for the past four years with great success. She was introduced to KADET and this is her second loan to finance her business. She plans to purchase more rice, cooking oil, maize flour and baking flour. With the profits, she will add more stock and educate her children. 

She hopes to have a bigger shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, cooking oil, maize flour and baking flour.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a single lady, aged 38 years old.  She is  a parent of four children, aged 17, 15, 13 and 11 years old.  She operates a dairy farm in Kosirai  and has been in operation for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of KES 11,500.

Viola has borrowed a second loan from KADET LTD for KES 30,000 after she has repaid the previous one successfully.  She wishes to use this money to improve her dairy farm and purchase feeds for her dairy livestock.  The profits will be used to purchase a plot of land.  

Her dream is to  improve the number of dairy animals on her farm and educate her children.

loans.use: improve her dairy farm and purchase livestock feeds

loans.name: Huệ's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huệ is 27 years old and she is married with 2 children.
 
She has a stall selling fruit for 6 years.
Huệ lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
In 2011, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Huệ has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Huệ is a reputable person in the community. 
She is the leader of her solidarity group. 
The main hardship that Huệ faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.
With her business profit, Huệ hopes to buy land of her own, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Madam Elizabeth L. trades in kitchen supplies including pestles, woven baskets, charcoal etc. She however does not own a shop but is hopeful of acquiring one someday and expanding her business. She is therefore very happy with the assistance Kiva is offering and believes her dream will come true. She is therefore seeking a loan of $850.00 from Kiva in order to implement her desired goals.

loans.use: working capital to expand her kitchen supplies business

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a rice farmer in the rural sector of Ecuador. He has lived in Santa Lucia his entire life. Although he is now separated from his wife, he still maintains close contact with his kids, only one of which is still in school. He hopes that he can invest the money from the loan in increasing his production. Thanks to the help of his farm association he feels that he can commercialize his product well if he has enough to sell.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Jose is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Production

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.en:
Jhonny has a small business selling fish, pork and poultry. He sells some animals live while selling other metas by the pound. He started off in this business with the help of his father who provided him with a loan about two years ago after Jhonny was fired. When he just started, Jhonny only sold fish that he bought from wholesalers. Today he still sells fish be he also has included many other animals and types of meat.

Jhonny needs this loan so that he can buy a cart or set up a store on a main street. Although he sells well from his home, he is hoping he can take his business to a larger scale from somewhere he can attract new clients more easily.

He and his family of two children live in a small house made out of wood. He is hoping that the loan will provide sufficient profit to make some improvements.

loans.use: Set up a point of sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her food-selling business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is 56 years old, a produce merchant, and married to Eric Escobar, who is 47 years old and a professional chauffer. They have three children who are older now and don't live with them.

Teresa has had her position selling fruits and vegetables in the city market of Paraguarí for over 20 years. Before then, she was selling them from her home. Later she took action and opened her own shop, which has a good location since it's found in the most important market in the city. She trades with an established clientel. Thanks to her work, all her sons are professionals.

She needs a loan to buy a freezer that will be very useful in the summers.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Teresa tiene 56 años, comerciante, está casada con Eric Escobar de 47 años de edad de profesión chofer, tienen 3 hijos todos mayores de edad ya no viven con ellos. Teresa tiene su puesto de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de Paraguarí hace 20 años, anteriormente vendía en su casa, luego se animo y abrió su propio local, la cual tiene una muy buena ubicación ya que se encuentra en el mercado más importante de la ciudad; cuenta con clientela formada. Gracias a su trabajo todos sus hijos son profesionales. Necesita el crédito para la compra de un congelador que es de mucha utilidad para ella en época de verano

loans.use: Purchase a freezer

loans.name: Mahsudjon

texts.en: R. Mahsudjon is a young farmer. He is married and has one child. His farm is located in Kuybushev, in the district of Khujand. He has been engaged in business for over 6 years. He has 6 bulls and uses his loans for fattening them for market. With his loans from Microinvest he purchases fodder for them. When they become fat enough, he sells them in the animal market and buys the next group of bulls. He says that he loves his business and in future he plans to increase the number of his bulls. Currently he is requesting a loan to buy fodder for them.

loans.use: Purchasing fodder.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is a mother from Puipaa Center. She is thirty-one years of age and she is running a small farm and an ice cake (popsicle in a bag) business. She has three children who are still young. Her husband works as a carpenter and that was her only source of income for the family before she joined our programme.

Mele sells her ice cakes for fifty cents each at the Primary School Compound, but she sells the produce from her farm at the Fugalei Market. She is one of our really hard-working ladies and she is reliable and supportive.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her ice cake (popsicle) business

loans.name: Erisa A (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Safina is a 48-year-old widow with six children. She supports her family by poultry farming. Rose sells produce in the local food market. Teopista sells second-hand clothes. Hadijahis is a cook in a hotel and Bilal works as a seamstress. With the extra income generated by this loan, Safina intends to pay her children's school fees.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses by buying more items to sell to customers

loans.name: Zainabu's Kabala Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is 38 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 28, 18, and 15. Zainabu owns a food vendor store, which she started in 2007. She works from 6am to 6pm at her business every day.

In the past, Zainabu has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in timber selling, grocery and charcoal selling.

loans.use: To buy more food items.

loans.name: Peng

texts.en: Mrs. Peng P., 43, works as a tailor earning around $2 a day of profit. Her husband is a farmer and grows a variety of vegetables on a plot of farmland. On average, he can makes about $2 a day of profit. Sometimes he can makes more especially in raining season because he has enough water for his crops. This couple has eight children, five of who are tailors like their mother and the rest are students. To increase the output from his  farm they request a loan from Kiva  to purchase cow to plow the farm. Now he hires a tractor to plow the farm so it costs him a lot.

loans.use: This loan will used to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a thirty-four-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She operates a small roadside store near the coastal town of Elmina.

Because she lives in a fishing community, she will use the proceeds of the loan to buy fish hooks to sell to the local fisherman. She also wants to start selling yams – a Ghanaian staple. In addition to adding inventory to her store, Aba hopes to use some of the loan to improve her store’s appearance and to replace some of the older wooden beams.

Aba is a member of the "God is Alive" lending group. The lending group uses a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure payment.

loans.use: To buy yams and fishhooks

loans.name: Jeymi

texts.es:
Jeymi R.'s business is a beauty salon which is located in a booth in the Ciudad Sandino market. She stands out as a woman that has put forward a lot of effort and with a lot sacrifice has supported her humble home composed of three small children and another on the way.

Today she is requesting a loan at CEPRODEL with the purpose of obtaining the tools necessary for her business such as gels, dyes, perfumes, etc. That's why she trusts that her loan will be approved and with it she will improve the economic situation of herself and her children, whom very much need the support of their mother.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio que se dedica la señora Jeymi R. es el salón de belleza el cual atiende en su tramo en el mercado de Ciudad Sandino. Se ha destacado por ser una dama muy esforzada que con mucho sacrificio ha llevado el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación compuesto por sus tres pequeños hijos y el próximo que está por nacer por estar en estado de embarazo.

Hoy en día ha solicitado un crédito en CEPRODEL con el propósito de obtener las herramientas necesarias para trabajar tales como gelatinas, tintes, colonias, etc. Por este motivo es que confía en que su crédito le será otorgado y de esta manera mejorará su condición económica y el de sus amados hijos que tanto necesitan del apoyo de su madre.

loans.use: Buying materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es:
In the municipality of Somotillo of the city of Chinandega señor Jorge Rye C. is dedicated to the production of dairy cattle and the production of basic grains and oils. With a lot of effort and sacrifice he carries out this work every day for the purpose of improving the conditions of his family, bringing the daily bread to his table and, at the same time, saving for the improvement of his dwelling, which needs a lot of help because it is in bad state which little by little he has come to improve.

His family admires him for the fact that his multiple efforts have permitted him to bring food to his home and that in addition he has managed to keep his children in school. The need that this gentleman faces is that he needs to invest in his business through the purchase of cows for its development. By this he hopes that Ceprodel will offer him the loan to do well along with his family.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega el señor Jorge C. C. se dedica a la producción de ganado lechero y la producción de granos básicos y de oleaginosas. Labor la cual con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio la realiza todos los días con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su familia llevando el pan diario a su mesa y a la vez ahorrando para el mejoramiento de su vivienda el cual necesita de mucha ayuda por estar en mal estado el cual poco a poco la ha venido mejorando.

Su familia lo admira por el hecho de que sus múltiples esfuerzos han permitido que lleve el alimento a su casa de habitación y que además logre mantener a sus hijos en el colegio. La necesidad que atraviesa este caballero es que necesita invertir en su negocio por medio de la compra de vacas para su desarrollo. Por esto espera que Ceprodel le otorgue el crédito para salir adelante junto con su familia.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows to further develop his business.

loans.name: Po

texts.en:
Po S., 30, is a bricklayer as well as a farmer, and his wife is a garment worker. Their combined income is $3 per day. They have three children and live in Khsom Village, Kandal Province, Cambodia. Mr. S. wishes to expand his farming business, so he is requesting a loan of $700 US. He will use the loan to purchase an ox, which will be used for plowing his fields. The loan will enable him to expand his farming business and thereby increase his family’s income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings.
