In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase one ox, which will be used for plowing his fields

loans.name: Maria Ceferina

texts.es:
Ceferina started the business 7 years ago because she could not catch up with her regular expenses. She decided to sell meals among her neighbors. Not only did they buy meals from her, but now she is commissioned to make tortillas for the panuchos (a Yucatan specialty) which are made every morning in the town market.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay over 3 months, to buy a grill in order to speed up the meal preparation. With you help she will achieve it!

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Ceferina inicio el negocio hace 7 años al ver que no alcanzaba para los gastos familiares decidió vender comida entre sus vecinos, los cuales no solo le compran comida, sino que ahora le encargan tortillas para la venta de panuchos que se hacen todas las mañanas en el mercado del pueblo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una parrilla para hacer mas rápida la elaboración de su comida. Con tu apoyo podrá lograrlo!!.

loans.use: To buy a grill

loans.name: Wass Na God Dae Sabe Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu C. is the leader of the Wass Na God Dae Sabe group. She was born in Magburaka and is 37 years old. She is married to a business man and they have 4 children. Two of her children are already in school, and two are still too young to go to school. For 3 years, Kadiatu has been selling cooked rice, cold water, and soft drinks. She added some money to her previous loan to buy the freezer that she is using to sell the drinks. With this new loan, she plans to buy bags of rice and the condiments that she uses for cooking.

The other members of the group are Kadiatu C., Nenneh C., and Adama B.. They are all local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town, the headquarters of the Tonkolili District. They are requesting their third loan from Kiva through SMT. They have repaid their previous loans successfully. However, they are requesting a new loan to add to their current principle. Their previous loans allowed them to make a lot of improvements in their lives, so they are requesting a new loan.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for restaurant

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Asha M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has four children. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting another dependant because his parents do not take care of him. Asha M. sells fish that she buys fresh daily from local fishermen. Since 2006, she has sold these fish either in the fish market or along the roads of the city. Her business is doing good. She works at the business for 12 hours a day, 6 days a week. Asha currently earns about $300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $850 USD to buy more fish for her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Asha thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Osas

texts.en: Osas I. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 28 years old and married with a child. She sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She started this business in 2007. She requests a $425 loan to purchase more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
Komil O. is 47 years old, and lives with his wife and 6 children. He has been breeding cattle for more than 7 years, and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, above all getting milk from his cows, which he sells in local markets. Komil keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children, along with his wife who help him with caring for the animals. Now Komil needs a loan to purchase more cattle to expand his business. With your help this will be possible. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 34 años, empezó a convivir con su pareja desde que tuvo 14 años y fruto de esa relación marital tiene 4 hijos, viven en el Pueblo de Cumutay, donde han construido su casa de adobe y piensan en empastar con yeso para que quede mucho mejor. A los 15 años ya era madre de su hija Jenny, desde entonces se levantaba muy temprano, a las 5.00am juntamente con su suegra para ayudarla a preparar el almuerzo para los trabajadores de la chacra, y una vez que fue creciendo su hija mayor, ya iba a apoyar a la chacra. Después de varios años de trabajar para sus suegros, decidieron cultivar con chacras alquiladas sus propios productos, después sus suegros les dieron unos terrenos, donde ahora siembran papa y arvejas en grandes cantidades y poco a poco ya están comprando más terrenos de cultivo. La agricultura le es muy rentable y está muy contenta, porque se da tiempo para todo, la dificultad que tienen en estos tiempos es la lluvia, temen que pueda provocar la plaga a las arvejas, en el caso de la papa la lluvia no les deja cosechar, ya que si la guardan húmeda se irá pudriendo. Flor ya viene trabajando por cuarta vez consecutiva un crédito con MFP, y todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable en sus pagos, asimismo asiste a todas las reuniones del banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de sacos de abono, cada uno cuesta 115 soles, también comprará insecticidas para las arvejas, lo que calcula le costará cerca de 350 soles.
texts.en:
Flor is 34 years old and she's been living with her partner since she was 14. Now she and her husband have four children and they live in the Cumutay villiage. They've built their own adobe house and hope to fill it with plaster so that it is more stable. Flor was a mother at age 15 and since then she's woken up at 5am to help her mother-in-law make lunch for the farm workers. Once her eldest daughter began to grow up, Flor was able to help on the farm. After several years of working for her husband's parents, she began to cultivate her own crops on rented land. Later her husband's parents gave Flor and her husband some land, where they now grow potatoes and peas in large quantities. Little by little they're able to buy more arable land. Farming is profitable and Flor is happy with her work because it gives her time to do everything. The challenge during this time of year is rain, and Flor and her husband fear that it could create a plague for the pea crop. Too much rain ruins the potato harvest, because if the potatoes hold water they'll rot. Flor is in her fourth loan cycle with MFP and she's shown herself to be a responsible client. She makes her payments on time and attends all of the community bank meetings. Flor will use the money to buy sacks of fertilizer, which cost 115 soles each. She'll also buy insecticides for the peas, which she calculates will cost 350 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Erminia

texts.es:
La señora Erminia V. A. tiene 47 años, vive en el sector Gran Chimu del distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio hasta 3ro de primaria, dejó los estudios debido a que su padre se enfermó y tuvieron que trabajar para salir adelante, tiene una pequeña hija que depende enteramente de ella.
Erminia se dedica a la venta de ropa de dormitorio y quesillo, se inicio con la venta de accesorios de carro, negocio que le fue muy rentable hasta que perdió todo su capital cuando le decomisaron su mercadería. Viajo a Argentina por un tiempo y al regresar empezó vendiendo menú, el mismo que abandono debido a que se enfermó; luego se inició en la venta de carne, quesillo y ropa de dormitorio, negocio que aun desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres  del Milenium”, lo invirtió en la compra de una cocina semindustrial.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de  ropa para dormitorio. 
Erminia sueña con abrir una tienda de accesorios para carros.
texts.en:
Ms. Erminia V. A. is a 47-year-old woman who lives in Gran Chimu, district of Porvenir, in the Trujillo province of the department La Libertad, Peru. She completed three years of grade school, but then stopped studying because her father got sick and they had to work in order to get ahead. She has one dependent young daughter. Erminia sells bedclothes and cheese for a living. She began by selling car accessories, which was a very profitable business until she lost all her capital when her merchandise was confiscated. She then went to Argentina for a while and when she returned began selling menu meals. She had to abandon this business because she got sick. She then began selling meat, cheese, and bedclothes from her home. A business she is still in the process of developing. She invested the first 300.00 loan she received from her local bank “Mujeres del Milenium” in the purchase of a semi-industrial kitchen. She will invest this 1000.00 loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, in the purchase of bedclothes. Erminia’s dream is to open a car accessories store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invertir en la compra de ropa para dormitorio, negocio que tiene en su casa.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene un hijo con quienes reside en su casa propia. Ella es docente en una institución privada, pero para cubrir las gastos en su hogar inició hace 8 años un negocio de venta de zapatos, los cuales compra en el centro de Lima para venderlos en su distrito donde ofrece a sus vecinas y amigas, a quienes les deja a crédito diversos zapatos para que poco a poco le puedan pagar, siendo así un negocio rentable pues el costo es mayor al que puede dar al contado, ya que incluye el costo por la movilidad que hará para los cobros semanales. Sin embargo, es muy cansado tener que trabajar durante el día enseñando y salir por las tarde a distribuir sus pedidos de zapatos y a realizar sus cobranzas hasta muy noche. Por estos motivos desea alquilar un stand donde pueda atender su negocio en las tardes sin tener que caminar mucho por las calles y dedicarse a buscar nuevos modelos de zapatos que llamen la atención de las personas. Mónica es cliente de MFP desde hace cinco años y este es su octavo préstamo y espera seguir formando parte del grupo, pues encontró un verdadero equipo de trabajo. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá nuevos modelos de zapatos escolares para seguir aprovechando la temporada de inicio de clases.
texts.en:
Monica is 33 years old. She is married and has a son that she lives with in their own house. She is a teacher at a private school, but in order to cover all of her expenses, she began a shoe sales business 8 years ago. She buys the shoes in downtown Lima in order to sell them in her neighborhood to her neighbors and friends. She sells the shoes on credit, allowing her customers to pay for them little by little, which makes it a profitable business, as the final price is higher, because it includes the fees charged for making monthly payments.

However, she is very tired of having to teach during the day and then go out in the evenings to deliver shoe orders and collect her payments until late at night. For this reason, she would like to rent a stand where she can run her business in the afternoons without having to walk so much around the neighborhood, and can focus on looking for new shoe designs that will interest people. Monica has been an MFP client for 5 years and this is her 8th loan. She hopes to continue being part of the group, because she has found a true work team.

With the money she is requesting she will acquire new school shoe designs, in order to take advantage of the start of the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana G. is thirty-eight years old. She is a divorced mother of two children. According to her, her children are still in the basic school. She lives with her children in a family house in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She says a misunderstanding that ensued between her and her husband led to the divorce. She therefore works very hard to help herself and provide for the children.

Diana trades in yams and other vegetables. She procures tubers of yam all the way from Yeji in the north and sells them to retailers in her community. She has been in business for five years. Diana also deals in vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, groundnuts etc.

Diana wants a loan to procure yam in bulk. She aspires to give her children the best education and to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Nelson Xavier

texts.pt:
Nelson nasceu em inhambane tem 27 anos de idade estudou ata e 9 classe, vive maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos o primeiro de 6 anos e o segundo de 2 anos o mais velho vai a escola e o novo frequenta o centro infantil.

Nelson sai de inhambane a namaacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia alegando que ia visitar a sua irma, esta começa a adoencer e ele teve ficar a  cuidar dos seus sobrinhos, ano seguinte não consegue engressar a escola por falta de documentos e aranja um emprego como motorista no colegio maria auxiliadora governada pelas irmas missionarias, trabalha das 6h as 11h no periodo da manha com interrupçao as 12h, e das 12h30min as 17h no periodo da tarde auferindo um valor mensal de 1.800.00mt.nelson e um rapaz muito ocupado, para alem de trabalhar  estuda a noite e com a ajuda da sua esposa que e negociante no mercado informal shoprite onde há intercambio de produtos extrangeiros e nacionais  consegue colectar um fundo e inicia a sua propria obra. Concequentimente teve que sair  da casa da sua irma. Numa conversa com seu irmao que e nosso cliente soube da existencia da hluvuku e aproxima se solicitando um valor de 10.000.00mt para dar continuidade da obra. Nelson não responsabiliza se por niguem e mesmo assim não consegue poupar nenhum valor porque ganha pouco e pretende concluir a sua obra o mais rapido possivel e pedir um novo emprestimo para mobilar a sua casa.


Este e o primeiro emprestimo de nelson na hluvuku e kiva. Seram usados para comprar material de construçao para dar continuidade da sua obra, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e solicitar um novo emprestimo para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Nelson was born in Inhambane. He is 27 years old and studied until the 9th grade. He is married and the father of 2 children. The first is 6 years old, and the second is 2 years old. The oldest goes to school, and the youngest attends day care. Nelson left Inhambane for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, alleging that he was visiting his sister. She had become ill, and he had to stay to take care of his nephews. The next year he was unable to enter school because he lacked documentation. He arranged a job as a driver for the Maria Auxiliary College governed by the sister missionaries. He works from 6:00am until 11:00am in the morning with a break at 12:00pm; then from 12:30pm until 5:00pm in the afternoon earning a monthly sum of 1,800MT. Nelson is a busy man. Besides working he studies at night. With the help of his wife, who is a merchant in the informal market, Shoprite, where there is exchange of foreign and domestic products, he was able to collect a fund and begin his own work. Consequently he had to leave his sister's house. Through a conversation with his brother, who is our client, he came to know about the existence of Hluvuku and solicited a loan for 10,000MT to continue his work. Nelson is not responsible for anyone but is still unable to save any money because he earns so little. He intends to finish his work as fast as possible and request a new loan to furnish his home. This is Nelson's first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. It will be used to purchase construction materials to continue his work. He is confident that he will pay off the loan before maturity so he can solicit a new loan to furnish his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ilie

texts.en: Ilie, who has worked in retail since 2001, operates a business marketing food products and cosmetics. He is married and lives with his wife and three-year-old daughter in an apartment in Balti town. Sales are made in several shops in Balti. He leases booths that are open around the clock and also has a boutique inside the METRO. Ilie needs a loan to diversify his existing inventory in order to attract customers from the market. He is also working to maintain his existing clients. Ilie is a responsible person.

loans.use: To promote his business by diversifying inventory.

loans.name: Cándida

texts.es:
La Señora Cándida de 48 años de edad es comerciante y está casada con el Señor Dionisio de 51 años de edad quien trabaja como albañil y con quien tuvo 5 hijos: José de 27 años quien trabaja en albañilería con su padre, Nancy de 25 años quien es docente, Juana de 24 años quien se encuentra trabajando en España, Enrique de 19 años  y Juan de 12 años de edad quien está cursando el sexto grado de la Educación Básica 
Comenzó su actividad en el año 2006, con  mucho esfuerzo y la ayuda de toda su familia pudo salir adelante y hoy cuenta con una despensa muy surtida.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para un nuevo salón comercial debido a que el lugar donde funciona actualmente su negocio ya le resulta pequeño.
La misma  espera terminar su nuevo local y con ello aumentar sus mercaderías y así sus ventas, incrementando sus ingresos para su bienestar y de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Cándida is a 48 year old vendor, married to 51 year old Dionisio who works as a bricklayer and with whom she has 5 children: 27 year old Jose who works in brick work with his father, 25 year old Nancy who is a school teacher, 24 year old Juana who is working in Spain, 19 year old Enrique and 12 year old Juan who is in 6th grade of primary school. She began her business in 2006. With great effort and help from the entire family, she was able to be successful and today has a well-stocked convenience store. She is seeking a loan to buy construction materials for a new commercial room because the place where she currently has her business is too small for her business. She hopes to be able to finish her new locale and increase her merchandise and subsequently her sales, thereby increasing her income for her and her family’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new commercial room for her business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita S. is from the city of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro. She is 44 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children.

To make a living, Anita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not her only means of generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling vegetables. Anita has engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services, to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase products to sell.

Anita is requesting a loan of 11000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family income.

--------------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase new items to expand product offerings.

location.town: Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: W. Julien

texts.fr: A. W. Julien est né vers 1972 à Gbakpo dans la Commune de Akpro Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Julien réside dans cette Commune depuis son enfance et il y mène comme activité principale la mécanique. Julien est père de deux (02) enfants dont un (01) est scolarisé. Julien est un mécanicien vélo moteur. Pour améliorer ses prestations de mécanique dans le but d’accroître ses revenus, Julien a besoin de moyens financiers pour acheter les équipements nécessaires dans son atelier de mécanique. C’est la raison pour laquelle Julien sollicite un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. W. Julien was born around 1972 in Gbakpo in the township of Akpro Missérété in the Department of the Oueme. Julien has lived in this township since infancy and he works here at his principal business as a mechanic. He is the father of 2 children, one of whom is enrolled in school. Julien is a bicycle/motorcycle mechanic. In order to improve the services he renders and to increase his income from them, Julien needs working capital to buy the necessary equipment for his mechanic's workshop. This is the reason why Julien is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of mechanic's equipment

loans.name: Rachabgul

texts.ru: Аташбекова Рачабгул проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 55 лет. Вдова, имеет 5 детей. Рачабгул более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Она торгует национальными тканями, на рынке. Ей конечно же помогают ее дети. Старший сын находится на заработках в России. Сама клиентка просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Rachabgul A. lives in the Hamadoni district. She is 55 years old, a widow and has 5 children. Rachabgul has been involved in sales for over 6 years. She sells traditional fabrics at a market. Of course, her children help her with the business. Her oldest son works in Russia. The client is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia A. is a widow and has 4 dependaents. She has received schooling through junior high school. Lydia sells plastic bowls at Beposo near Shama, which she has done since 2007. Lydia uses her income to educate her children. Lydia will use the loan to buy more bowls for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Lydia plans to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more bowls for resale.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena, 36 years old and married with five children, has been selling sarongs for the past seven years. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia N. is a 45-year-old married mother of two children. She is married to James Kuria, who is an accountant.

Virginia runs a shop in Mombasa's central business district where she offers computer typing and printing services, and also sells stationery and beverages. She mainly serves office workers and college students who are located near her shop. Virginia's business has been in operation for the last nine years. This marks her first loan from the Kiva field partner, KADET, and with the money, she plans to purchase a second hand computer, a modem, assorted stationery and beverages. 

Virginia hopes to diversify her business and open a hairdressing salon in the future.

 ABOUT KADET LTD. 

Kadet Ltd is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya that was formed in 2000 to offer access to financial services to the rural communities through the microfinance model. Kadet is the only microfinance in Kenya with a strong rural presence and a genuine concern for the welfare of children and the communities we serve. As a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya, Kadet has continued to empower communities by providing access to easy-to-pay loans. Loan products available at the MFI are designed to offer solutions to challenges facing communities in these rural habitations. Obtain more information on Kadet from the press section of the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase a second hand computer, a modem, assorted stationery and beverages.

loans.name: Angel Olinto

texts.es:
El socio es el SR: Angel, el pertenece al banco comunal grupo esperanza. El socio vive en el distrito de san Sebastián en la ciudad D. Cusco

Nuestro socio tiene 54 años de edad, el es  casado y tiene 4 hijos, nuestro socio es de profesión ingeniero civil, él se encuentra formando parte D. banco debido a que siempre un ingreso extra es beneficiosos para todos y es precisamente este modo de banca financiera la que le ha permitido adquirir sus electrodomésticos y demás, el socio solicita el préstamo para una inicial de un nuevo artefacto. El socio respalda sus préstamos con el trabajo fijo que tiene de ingeniero civil.

Nuestro socio agradece el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Angel belongs to the communal bank "Esperanza." He lives in the district of San Sebastian in the city of Cusco Nuestro. He is a 45-year-old civil engineer, married, with 4 children. He joined the bank because the access to credit is beneficial for everyone and it is precisely due to this mode of financing that he was able to acquire his household appliances. He is requesting the loan for a new appliance. Angel backs up this loan with his permanent job as a civil engineer. He is grateful for the support that has been provided, and he pledges to make the payments on his debt in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy household appliances

loans.name: Alian

texts.en:
Alian is married to Che Julius. They have six children; she lives in a quarter near the metropolitan town of Bamenda, Cameroon.  She plans to invest this loan in food selling in a nearby school in her quarter G T H S Alabukam Mankon Bamenda.
This is Alian's seventh loan; she has been a GHAPE member since 1998. She is a long time mixed farmer and produces all species of tubers.

With the profit from this loan, Alian plans to take care of her family, ensure that they eat well and buy their medication.  She knows she will be able to repay this loan because of the low interest rate and the small repayment installments.
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of puff-puff, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Fe En Cristo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Adrien is the coordinator of his group Fe en Cristo (Faith in Christ). His story is representative of both the members of his group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti) clients more generally. His group is based in the areas surrounding Santiago, the second largest city in the DR. Santiago's economy is agricultural and the region is famous for tobacco and beef, despite these benefits, many of the region's poor, including the members of this group have limited access to running water (none of which is potable) or electricity. It is in these conditions that Adrien makes his home as a single father with his 7 year old daughter. 

Adrien is excited to take his first loan with Esperanza. He will use this loan to invest in a business selling used clothing which he will buy in bulk to get a better price. He hopes that this loan will help him build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for his daughter. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Bulk packages of used clothing

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong S., 39, is married with four children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is raising pigs and has a business of buying recycling materials, earning approximately an income of $5 USD per day. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Her husband is involved completely in the recycling business, earning an income of $7 USD per day to help cover the family expenses.

Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $1,000 USD to buy a plot of farmland, animal food, and recycling materials.

loans.use: Buy a plot of farmland, animal food, and recycling materials

loans.name: God Time Group

texts.en:
Bendu M. is a leader of a group called "God time." This group has five borrowers. Bendu, 32, is married and has three children between the ages of 2 and 9.  One is in kindergarten and one is in second grade.

Bendu dropped out of school in the sixth grade because of poverty. She lives and work in the VOA community, which is north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia. She sells food stuffs such as oil, pepper, rice, and so forth that she buys wholesale and then resells at retail prices to the residents of VOA. She has been running this business for three years, and she hopes to improve her shop in the future. Bendu talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. 

She started her business with LD1000.00 that was given to her by her husband. Bendu needs this loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper and so forth to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education so they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, pepper and and other food items

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 36 and is married with four children aged 10 and 19 years. All her children go to school. She resides in a rented four-room house where she is staying with six people. Dorothy takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and no piped water and gets three meals a day. She incurs transport costs for buying local gin from Nakawa, one of the markets in Kampala city. Dorothy has a pub in Naguru and sells all types of goods like salt, sugar, flour and flour liquors. She works in a semi-urban area that is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week.

She receives an average of 40 customers a day and sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees for her children, and monthly rent for her business and residence. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the rainy season, which hinders her from reaching her customers. She has been in this business for ten years and with Micro Credit for Development and Transformation (MCDT) for five years. She is now servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. Dorothy joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerry cans and boxes of sachets of alcohol and other drinks like umqombothi. She wants to see her business grow bigger and she would like to start selling only wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more jerry cans and sachets of alcohol and umqombothi

loans.name: Akwata Empola Group, Kayunga

texts.en:
L. Juliet's business is basically mending old clothes and making new ones on order for her customers and for display. She is happy to have won over many clients due to her clean and tidy work. She is 45 years old and married with four children, ages 17, 15, 11, and 10, and she takes care of her own siblings.

Juliet is a hardworking and devoted lady with a tailoring business. She also sells clothes from Kayunga. Her goal is to be able to win tenders from various schools and institutions as well as to have a healthy family. She hopes to increase her stock as well as educate her children towards a brighter future. Juliet needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials for tailoring and resale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is married with three children and her youngest child is two years old. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports his home.

Felicia sells groceries and foodstuffs to make a living and has been in this business for a long time. With this business, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. She hopes for a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Felicia is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Gerson Jonathan

texts.es: Gerson Jonathan A. C. de 21 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su familia, la cual está conformada por su madre y tres hermanos menores los cuales son estudiantes de educación básica. Gerson posee una panadería en la cual se encarga de elaborar pan dulce (nombre el cual se le da al pan, el cual es hecho a base de harina, con miel o dulces, y su sabor es muy parecido al de las galletas). Gerson se encarga de elaborar el pan que luego sale a repartir a sus clientes, cabe mencionar que él cuenta con la ventaja de poseer una ruta trazada en la cual va entregando su producto. A pesar que cuenta con un año de poseer la panadería, él cuenta con muy buena reputación, por ser una persona muy responsable quien siempre entrega los pedidos a tiempo. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de harina, huevos, y todos los productos necesarios para la elaboración del pan. A su corta edad, Gerson es un joven el cual ha tomado la responsabilidad de un negocio, esforzándose a diario por llevarles el sustento diario a su familia, la cual colabora en el negocio, pero a pesar de esto es Gerson quien se encarga de administrar la panadería a lo largo del día.
texts.en:
Gerson Jonathan A. C., 21, lives in San Martín, San Salvador department, with his family, which is made up of his mother and three younger siblings, who are in elementary school. Gerson has a bakery in which he makes pan dulce (a type of bread made with flour, honey or sweets; its flavor is similar to a cookie). Gerson bakes the bread and then distributes to his customers. It's worth mentioning that he has a set route along which he distributes his bread. Although his bakery is only a year old, he has a very good reputation for being very responsible and always making his deliveries on time. He is requesting funding to buy flour, eggs, and the other needed ingredients for his bread. At his young age, Gerson is a young man who has taken responsibility for his business, struggling daily to provide support for his family. His family members help out with the business but it's Gerson who carries the main responsibility for running the bakery throughout the day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs and sugar.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.es: La señora Tecla P. tiene 69 años ,tiene 5 hijos todos mayores  de edad ,ella tiene una despensa  que heredo de familia por lo que ya tienen una buena clientela formada en el barrio en donde vive ,ella se levanta muy temprano para ir a  surtirse  del mercado de abasto en  donde realiza sus compras  ,Tecla   necesita  de este crédito para la compra de mercaderías en cantidad y asi lograr a mejor precio  .En el futuro desea comprar un vehículo para realizar mejor su trabajo.
texts.en:
Tecla is 69 years old and has five adult children. She has a pantry store that she inherited from her family and she has a good customer base in her neighborhood. She gets up very early to go to the marketplace where she buys her stock. Tecla needs this loan to buy merchandise in large quantities so that she can negotiate better prices. In the future she wants to buy a vehicle so that she can do her work better.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel A. is a piggery owner. She raises pigs and sells the meat at the supermarket. She bought a stall and is able to market meat to a lot of customers. She is also supplying meat to popular restaurants and canteens in Talibon, Bohol.

Maribel’s father was confined with diabetes. Some portion of her savings were used to pay his medications that reached more than Php 100,000. Her business is what sustains her family. She wants to apply for a loan of Php 50,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) to continue her business.


CEVI is helping its clients not just during the early stages of their business. It continues to support its clients who accomplish more in the later stages of their businesses because the businesses help create more jobs or employment in the community.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from the village of Baybay, Liloy. She is 46 years old. Virginia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs for sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase land to raise additional livestock. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rahat Akmatova`s Group

texts.ru:
Рахат, 51, замужем. Она мать 6 детей. Самому старшему 25, а самому младшему 12. Ее супруг занимается частным извозом. Клиент работает преподавателем в средней школе, кроме этого дома занимается птицеводством и откормом МРС. Клиент начинала бизнес с 10 куриц в 2001 году. В данное время у нее имеется 60 куриц, а также 5 коз. Цель кредита купить коня для использования в весенне-полевых сельхоз работах.

Калыйман 42 года. Она замужем, ее супруг работает преподавателем, также подрабатывает завхозом в школе. У нее 4 детей. Старшие сын и дочь студенты, а младшие дети школьники. Сама же работает поваром и техничкой в средней школе.   На кредит клиент планирует купить овцу.

Исламидину 23 года. Пока холост, однако в планах женится в этом году. Он в данное время проживает с родителями.  Исламидин занимается перепродажей МРС на местном рынке. Бизнес был начат с двух овец, сейчас у него есть 7 овец, а также за счет бизнеса купил дойную корову. Цель кредита закуп двух овец.

Айнагул 46 лет. Она замужем и воспитывает одного 1 сына. Он школьник. Ее супруг работает в цементном заводе. Клиент занимается откормом домашнего скота. Ранее клиент занималась торговлей, от прибыли купила 4 овцы. Сейчас она хочет расширить свой бизнес и докупить еще пару овец.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Rahat is 51 years old, married. She is a mother of 6 children. The oldest is 25, and the youngest is 12. Her husband provides transportation services. Rahat works as a teacher at a secondary school and is also involved in bird husbandry and raising small livestock. She started the business with 10 chickens in 2001. Currently, she has 60 chickens and also 5 goats. The goal of this loan is to purchase a horse and use it for spring field work. Kalyiman is 42 years old. She is married. Her husband works as a teacher and also as an office manager at a school. Kalyiman has 4 children. The oldest son and daughter are college students, and the youngest are school students. Kalyiman works as a cook and as a janitor at a secondary school. She plans to use the loan to buy a sheep. Islamidin is 23 years old. He is single for now, but plans to get married this year. He currently lives with his parents. Islamidin is involved in sales of small livestock at the local market. He started the business with two sheep and now has seven, and he was able to buy a dairy cow. The goal of this loan is a purchase of two sheep. Aynagul is 46 years old. She is married and is raising one son, who is a school student. Aynagul’s husband works at a cement factory. The client is involved in raising domestic livestock. She was previously involved in retail sales and used the profits from this business to buy 4 sheep. Now she wants to expand her business and buy a couple more sheep.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a horse

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes M. has an agricultural business. She is 40 years old and married to Rodan. They have 3 children. Her eldest child is 18 years old. She joined CEVI to get additional capital to sustain her business. She would like a loan of PHP 10,000.00. The loan will be used to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Kuteesa Women's Group, Kampala

texts.en:
On the face of it, N. Rehema’s seven-year-old hardware business in Kiseka Market, Kampala, is a beehive of activity. She has mostly been selling car spare-parts since she began.

Rehema is a married woman with three children. In keeping with her parental responsibilities, she has gone to all extremes to give her children an education through earnings from her business. Her stock in trade factor has been her resilient hard-work ethic. With this in tow, she has managed to get into a profit stride of 70,000 shillings a month.

Rehema’s dream is to transform her business into a wholesale franchise with the assistance of this loan. With this loan she wants to buy more car spare-parts like shock-absorbers and engines.

loans.use: To purchase more car spare-parts for her business

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina S. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Felina is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Felina owns & operates a business planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Felina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Felina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Felina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Felina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita A. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Tita is 40 years old and a widow.  She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bar.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Lung

texts.en:
Lung M., 56, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. M. appears in the photograph with her husband.

M. sells snacks at a primary school for an income of USD 7 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about USD 5 per day.

M. is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase cosmetics products. By doing so, M. is able to help one of her daughter to expand her business of selling cosmetics. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her sixth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics products for her daughter to sell

loans.name: My

texts.en:
Mrs. My Y. is a hard-working woman who has spent her life with her own small business in order to earn money to feed her children. She has been producing several types of traditional cakes to sell. She owns a medium size store inside a primary school where she sells her cakes to the students, earning $5 a day. She also received help from her husband with selling these items. 

This older couple are the good parent of seven children. Two of their children are now married and live away from home, while the remaining five are single, going to school or work. My Y. is concerned that her current income is not adequate as her business suffers from insufficient financial capital. My Y. request additional funds to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to ask for a $500 loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To increase her business capital.

loans.name: Sichat

texts.en:
Miss Sichat K., is single, and lives with her brother and elderly father on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has been a silk weaver for more than 20 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

She is asking for another loan in the amount of $200 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Kiddawalime Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
She took the cue to begin her grocery business in Kyaliwajjala, Mukono, after a pep talk from a close friend twelve years ago. On net weekly profits of 70,000 shillings, 41-year-old N. Resty, a single mother of four, is highly upbeat about the future financial prospects of her business.

With her high self esteem, Resty has brought hard work to bear in her business. She set forth with savings from a now-defunct restaurant business. She also operates a rental and water sales business which helps her supplement the profits from her grocery store business.

With this loan, Resty wants to buy more stock for her business. She principally wants to buy more tomatoes, Irish potatoes, and fresh fruits.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes, Irish potatoes, and fresh fruits to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is currently in the business of selling bread, groundnut phase (similar to peanut butter), and tomatoes at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock onions and dried fish to sell.  
Esther is 39 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To stock onions and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira D. is a 33-year-old attentive mother of two girls. Her husband, Taalay, works in the police department. This couple lives in harmony and teaches their daughters to develop in balance. Nazira graduated from Trade College and worked as a cashier in a local supermarket. As it was hard to live on low wages, she decided to begin her own business. Using her initial capital of 9,000 KGS, she started to sell women’s clothes at the local market. Her start as an entrepreneur was successful due to her strong efforts. In 2009, Nazira obtained her first loan of 50,000 KGS from Bai Tushum and Partners, which was used as intended and repaid without any delays. As Nazira’s activity started successfully and her clientele has increased, she is applying for a loan of 60,000 KGS to broaden the range of goods in her shop. With the revenues, she plans to give a good education to her daughters. In the future, Nazira wants to enlarge her business by opening a second selling point. As for personal plans, she dreams of giving birth to one more child. About Bai-Tushum and Partners: Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable members of the population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, it contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine S. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old, married, and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as milo, coffee, milk, canned goods, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Asadu

texts.en:
25-year-old M. Asadu has been in his commercial motorcycle business in Bwaise-Kampala for one and a half years now. By and large, his circumstances have been a mixture of good and bad. Bad given the increasing competition that directly translates to frustration, especially on days when clients are few. Good on the basis that at least he is able to make ends meet. Often he has had to begin with a new slate after some disappointing days at work. 

Upbeat tenacity, courage and perseverance stand out as his winning attributes. 50,000 shillings as weekly profits is quite modest but he remains optimistic that with this loan he can make a lot of headway in his trade. At his young age Asadu is already married with four high-spirited kids. 

 Asadu looks back with nostalgia at the time when he was a builder.  It is with money saved from building houses that he was able to purchase his motorcycle. With this Kiva loan, he says he is going to buy another motorcycle that he says will go a long way toward enabling him to earn more profit.

loans.use: The purchase of another motorcycle

loans.name: María Idalia

texts.es: María Idalia M. D. M. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en San Martín, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 9 y 4 años D. edad. María trabaja en su propio negocio el cual esta ubicado sobre la calle principal, frente al mercado D. San Martín, la cual es una zona  muy concurrida por lo que es muy beneficioso para su negocio. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo comprando y vendiendo ropa para mujeres y hombres, así mismo comercializa ropa interior y sabanas para niños. Este negocio es la única fuente D. ingresos con la cual cuenta esta familia, por lo que María solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo D. invertir en la compra D. más ropa y D. esta manera aumentar sus ventas lo cual es lo principal para María y su esposo ya que D. esta forma podrán contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en: María Idalia M. D. M., thirty-seven, lives in San Martín, in the Department of San Salvador, with her husband, and two children, who are nine and four-years-old.  She works in her own business on the main street in front of the San Martín market, a high-traffic area, which is great for business.  She works with her husband buying and selling men's and women's clothing and children's underclothing and sheets.  The business is the family's only source of income, so María is seeking a loan through Apoyo Integral to invest in more clothing.  That way she can increase sales, which is most important to her and her husband because it will help them have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Agapo

texts.es:
El Señor Agapo Rodríguez Condori, el curso hasta 4to. De primaria, es soltero y no tiene hijos, El es padre y madre para sus tres hermanos que estudian y le ayudan con los quehaceres de su casa, ellos desde muy pequeños se quedaron sin su padre y hace como unos 6 meses es que falleció su madre desde entonces él se dedica a educar y hacerse cargo sus hermanos, el se dedica al servicio de moto taxista en Ivirgarzama hace mas de 3 año, el está afiliado al sindicato de moto taxista "10 de NOVIEMBRE",  en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.

 Cabe señalar que el señor Agapo Rodríguez Condori, se apersono a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Mr Agapo Rodríguez Condori studied up to his fourth year of elementary school.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  He is mother and father to his three siblings who are still studying and help him with the household chores.  The children have been without their father since they were very young and then 6 months ago their mother died.  Since then, he has been in charge of educating and taking care of them.  He has been working as a motorcycle taxi driver in Ivirgarzama for more than 3 years and is affiliated with the motorcycle taxi drivers' union “10 de Noviembre”.  He has been an active member of the union for more than 3 years.  The service he provides is profitable since a lot of people request this service for its ease, speed and efficiency.  The union has stops and shifts for each member at different points in the town of Ivirgarzama where people turn up to request the service.

This is the first time that this client has obtained a loan from our institution.  He will use it to buy a new motorcycle since the one he has now has already reached the end of its life cycle and in this way he will be able to provide a better service to his customers, improve his income and thereby improve his quality of life.

We must point out that Mr Agapo Rodríguez Condori turned up in person to request his loan since his work colleagues told him about the good credit conditions with which our institution works.

loans.use: To buy a new work tool (motorcycle)

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a forty-nine-year-old married and enterprising man living in his own house with five children in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of providing the basics to the family all alone. He envisions having an educated family with a blissful family business. 

For five years he has been working with a water company and this has enabled him to pay school fees and complete his house. Vincent needs the loan to pay school fees for his children

loans.use: Paying school fees for his children

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 32 años, convive con Vidal, de 36 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Edwin, de15, Lourdes, de 13 y Magaly de 11 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Palca. La siembra de alverja, papa, verdura y demás hortalizas, es su principal actividad económica. Según cuenta comenzó, a los 17 años, cuando se hizo cargo de producir el terreno agrícola que sus padres la heredaron. Pero no solo a eso se dedica está hermosa y emprendedora mujer, ella cría un número considerable de vacas; los cuales le proporciona, queso y leche. La producción de queso, le brindan de cinco a seis litros diarios; el cual vende a un promedio de 2 nuevos soles cada litro. A Nancy, según cuenta le va muy bien en la elaboración de queso, leche y en la siembra. Por ello desea intensificarse en la producción de lácteos así como desea sembrar habas. Está es el primer crédito con MFP, y como buena integrante de su banco comunal, se compromete en no defraudar el apoyo que le brindaron en este momento muy importante. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una bolsa de semilla de alverja, que oscila entre 280 nuevos soles cada una, asimismo comprará 5 sacos de abono, para esparcirlos en sus sembríos de habas, que está sembrando y que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en:
Nancy is 32  years old and lives with her partner, 36 year-old Vidal.  They have 3 children: 15 year-old Edwin, 13 year-old Lourdes and 11 year-old Magaly.  They live together in their own home which is in the town of Palca.  Nancy's main business activity is growing peas, potatoes, greens and other vegetables.

According to Nancy, she started this work at the age of 17 when she took charge of sowing the plot of land which she inherited from her parents.  However, this beautiful and enterprising woman doesn't just grow crops, she also raises a considerable number of cows which provide her with cheese and milk.  She gets five to six liters of milk a day from her cows which she sells for an average of 2 Peruvian soles per liter.  Nancy says that her cheese, milk and farming business is going very well.  For this reason, she would like to intensify her dairy production as well as grow some beans.

This is Nancy's first loan with MFP and as a good member of her community bank she pledges not to let down the people who are providing her with support at this very important time.  She will use her loan to buy a bag of pea seeds which cost around 280 nuevos soles each.  She will also buy 5 sacks of fertilizer to spread on her bean crops which she is sowing and which she will harvest very soon.

loans.use: To buy a bag of pea seeds and 5 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre dedicado al comercio, hoy en día  trabaja en venta y compra de chatarra, desde hace varios años esta en este negocio en donde hay mucha demanda.
Iniciando con poco dinero, y que gracias a los financiamiento en Afodenic sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más productos de aluminio. En el transcurso de la semana  le toca andar por los barrios comprando metal, a si como tiene clientes que le llegan a ofrecer metal en su casa de habitación en donde al final del terreno tiene su pequeña bodega.
Como objetivo de padre desea  dar los estudios a sus cuatro hijos, por el cual trabaja mucho para lograr lo necesario cada día.
Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en la compra de hierro, aluminio, bronce, que es lo que se vende más.
texts.en:
Miguel is a man who is dedicated to business.  He now works selling junk.  He has been in this business, which there is a great demand for, for several years.

He started with little money.  Thanks to loans from Afodenic, his sales levels rose when he offered more aluminum products.  In a week’s time he walks through the neighborhoods buying metal.  He has customers who come to his house to sell him metal.  He has a small store at the edge of his land.

As a father’s objective, he wishes to give his four children an education.  That is why he works a lot in order to give them the daily necessities.

He will use the new loan to buy iron, aluminum, and bronze because this is what sells the most.

loans.use: To buy iron, aluminum, and bronze in order to sell more and have better results

loans.name: María Sulema

texts.es: María Sulema C. H. de 46 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad, junto a los cuales reside en San Martín, en el departamento de San Salvador. Con el deseo de poder suplir todos gastos y necesidades del hogar, desde hace 6 años y medio que María inició su propio negocio el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. María atiende el negocio de lunes a domingo, su faena inicia cada día a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 10 de la noche, a pesar que su trabajo es pesado ya que debe atender clientes a lo largo del día, le permite poder cuidar a sus hijos. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir comprando mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad y de esta manera mejorar sus ventas, las cuales le permitan suplir todas las necesidades de sus hijos y del hogar.
texts.en:
María Sulema C. H. is 46 years old.  She lives with her two children, aged 13 and 9, in San Martín, in San Salvador department.

Six years ago, with the desire to be able to cover all her household expenses and needs, María set up her own business.  She owns a store selling perishables which is located in her own home.  María works in her business from Monday to Sunday.  Her work begins every day at 6.00am and finishes at 10.00pm.  In spite of the fact that her work is hard, since she must serve customers all day long, it allows her to be able to care for her children.

María is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business, buying a larger quantity of basic products for her store so that she can improve her sales which will, in turn, allow her to cover all her children's and household expenses.

loans.use: To buy basic products for her store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a widow who lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running three businesses: pig fattening, a general store and a game station. She has one child who is 18 years old. Delia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Delia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for a water dispenser, home appliances and a tricycle. Delia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: Milka, de 20 años, es una luchadora madre soltera. Ella vive con su hija, en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Como mujer joven, ella tiene muchas ambiciones, hace 2 años su padre le heredó un terreno agrícola, con el que comenzó a sembrar café, ahora ella tiene unos cafetales jóvenes, que le proporcionan buenos granos. Aprovechando esa ventaja, manda a procesar el grano, vendiendo el café natural en grandes cantidades, a las diferentes tiendas de la ciudad de La Merced, donde tiene clientes fijos. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder ser independiente y tener oportunidad de crecer, pues a pesar de sus limitaciones y responsabilidades, ella no se amilana, por el contrario; tiene deseos de estudiar, y poder tener una empresa exportadora de café. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde encontró el apoyo que tanto necesitaba. Milka muy pronto cosechará sus grano de café, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, con lo que estará lista para los próximos meses de cosecha.
texts.en: Milka who is 20 years old is a hard-working single mother. She lives with her daughter in her parents' house located in the community of Union Palomar (central Peruvian jungle). As a young woman, she has many ambitions. Two years ago, she inherited farming land from her father with which she began to sow coffee. Now, she has young coffee plants that provide good kernals. Exploiting this advantage, she sends the grain to be processed, selling natural coffee in great quantities to the different shops in the city of La Merced where she has fixed clients. What she likes the most is to be able to be independent and have the opportunity to grow. Despite her limitations and responsibilities, she is not daunted. On the contrary, she has desires to study and to be able to have a coffee exportation business. She belongs to the "Prestatarios de la Union" community bank and this is the first loan that she's had with MFP where she found the support that she needed so much. Milka very soon will harvest her coffee grains. For this, with the loan she's requesting, she will buy various bags of organic fertilizer, with which she will be ready for the next months of harvest.

loans.use: Purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Samer is a 37-year old single man and owner of an electrical goods shop since 2006.   He has 15 years of experience in this area. Samer is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the 8th time, in order to buy new items to offer.   All his previous loans helped in getting better prices from the market. Samer is an excellent borrower, in addition to being a smart businessman. His clients come from everywhere, and his work is improving day after day. Samer hopes to expand his business and start wholesale trade some day.

loans.use: To buy new items to offer

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo tiene 35 años, por lo su actividad económica es brindar el servicio el de soldadura. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues no tenía el capital suficiente para mantener a su familia. Tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Como esta es su principal fuente de ingresos, Wilfredo trata de brindar una calidad en los servicios que ofrece para que sus clientes siempre lleguen a su negocio a solicitar sus servicios. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de hierro, guantes, herramientas entre otros productos.
texts.en: Wilfredo is 35 and works as a welder.  He has had this business for more than 5 years, but he didn't have enough capital to support his family.  He has a young son to take care of.  Since this is his main source of income, Wilfredo tries to offer quality services so he customers always come back to his business to request his services.  This is why he is requesting financing to buy iron, gloves, tools, and other products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro es padre de familia de 37 años de edad. Vive en casa propia con su esposa y tres hijos en la ciudad de Morropón en Piura, a unas cuatro horas de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 13 años, gana su vida como trabajador de campo en un terreno cerca de su domicilio. Con este trabajo, ha podido solventar sus gastos familiares. En Perú, ha empezado la temporada escolar e Isidro desea comprar útiles escolares para sus tres hijos menores. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles. Edpyme le ofrece su crédito a una tasa de interés muy baja. Eso le permitirá al cliente trabajar tranquilo sin tener que recurrir a prestamistas informales que le cobran tasas altísimas, lo cual perjudica su liquidez diaria y retrasa su crecimiento tanto laboral como familiar. Isidro es un cliente recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa y tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales. Les agradece mucho a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en la mejora de su condición familiar.
texts.en: Isidro is a family father of 37. He lives in his own house with his wife and three children in the city of Morropón in the region of Piura, some four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. For more than 13 years he has made a living as an agricultural laborer in a field near his home. This work enabled him to provide for his family. In Peru the school year has begun and Isidro wants to buy school supplies for his three young children. Therefore he thought it was appropriate to come to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and apply for a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles. Edpyme offers him this loan at a very low interest rate. This would allow him to do his work with peace of mind without being forced to resort to informal moneylenders who charge very high rates and would negatively impact his daily available money and his ability to ensure progress both for his work and his family. Isidro is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa with good personal and work references. He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support in improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his children

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie is 44 years old and widowed with four children.

Menchie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Menchie has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income with food vending.

Menchie aspires to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Daniel Kariuki

texts.en:
Daniel has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 23 years.  He is 73 years old, married to Mary Wambui.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Daniel hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mayra Concepcion

texts.es: Mayra Concepción tiene 36 años, su actividad es brindar los servicios de sala de belleza. Tiene más de 8 años en este negocio, pues siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy emprendedora y se siente contenta al tener un medio de ingreso para su hogar. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo siempre le enseña a saberse ganar la vida de la manera más humilde. Ella trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche ya que tiene ciertos clientes que llegan tarde. Este crédito es para la compra de peines, cepillo, aceites, tratamientos, planchas, secadoras, shampoo entre otros productos. ella desea comprar su propia casa ya que alquila.
texts.en: Mayra Concepción is 36 years old; she works in a beauty parlor. She has worked on her business for over 8 years since she has always enjoyed being a very enterprising person and feels very happy having a mode of income for her home. She has 2 underage children under her care and they have taught her to earn a living in a humble way. Mayra works from 7 in the morning until 8 in the evening since she has customers that arrive late. This loan is to buy combs, brushes, oils, treatments, flat irons, dryers, shampoos and other products. Mayra hopes to buy her own home since she rents.

loans.use: buy combs, brushes, oils, treatments, flat irons, dryers, shampoos and other products.

loans.name: Georgea Group

texts.es:
