El grupo Georgea lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras quienes tienen 14 ciclos de trabajar con Adim y han tenido tres préstamos con Kiva. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Miriam de 41 años desde joven inicio su taller de costura con unos ahorros y una máquina de coser. 

Miriam tiene tres hijos de 15, 17 y 19 años quienes estudian y su hija en sus tiempos libre le ayuda con el negocio. Ella con el crédito comprara telas.

Las otras integrantes son María de los Ángeles de 55 años tiene una pequeña venta de gaseosas, fresco y hielo…etc.y Paulo Antonio quien vende Sandillas.
texts.en:
The Georgea Group consists of three hardworking and enterprising individuals who have participated in 14 loan cycles with ADIM.  Three of those loans have been with Kiva.  The group coordinator is Sra. Miriam, age 41.  As a young woman, she started a dressmaking shop with some savings and a sewing machine.  

Miriam has three children (ages 15, 17, and 19) who are in school.  Her daughter helps with the business in her spare time.  Miriam will use her loan to buy fabrics.  

The other members are as follows:
•	María de los Ángeles is 55 years old and has a small vending post where she sells sodas, refreshments, ice, and other items.
•	Paulo Antonio sells watermelons.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 27 years old and single. He has been operating a grocer shop for three years, with one employee. Previously, he was selling cabbages and was able to add other vegetables and fruits after earning more profit.  

Through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya, David has learned business management skills. This has helped him to run his business well. He has requested for 40, 000 KES to renovate his business premises.

loans.use: To renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: As a married parent of eight children, Emma works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fresh fish in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional fresh fish to sell. Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 35 years old and a hard-working business lady. She is married and a proud mother of four children age 17, 12, 7 and 2. She has been running a retail shop for the last year. Previously, she was a housewife.
 
In the next five years she wants her business to grow into a mini-supermarket and she hopes tht someday it will grow into a full fledged super market.

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, this dream is becoming a reality as she receives finances for expansion and valuable managerial advice.

She wants 100,000 KES to expand her retail shop.

loans.use: To expand her retail shop.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 43 años, convive con Alejandro de 46 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Denis, de 19 y Adeliz, de 18 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. El trabajo de está laboriosa mujer es la agricultura, donde siembra papa, arveja y maíz, ya tiene 32 años dedicándose a esto, y según afirma le gusta mucho compartir momentos de dificultades y alegrías junto a su familia, ya que juntos se dirigen los fines de semana a limpiar, fertilizar  y cosechar sus cultivos. En tanto que los demás días de la semana se dedica al cuidado de su tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, ya es conocida entre todo los pobladores del caserío, pues ofrece una variedad de productos necesarios para los alimentos del día. Asimismo su esposo se dedica al trasporte público dentro de la localidad. Ahora Rosa tiene sembrado arveja y papa que dentro de estos meses cosechará, y por lo que cuenta obtendrá buenas ganancias ya que el precio de venta subió en el mercado. Y como secretaría de su banco comunal se siente agradecida por ejercer un cargo dentro de su asociación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Además le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal por ello se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente. Rosa de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, semilla de gladiolo y varios sacos de abono orgánico para empezar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Rosa, 43, lives with Alejandro, 46.  They have three children but only two of them, Denis, 19, and Adeliz, 18, still live with them together as a family in their own house located in Cumutay.  

This hard working woman’s work is farming.  She grows potatoes, peas and corn.  She’s been in this line of work for 32 years and, according to her, she likes to share moments of difficulty and joy with her family very much because on weekends they all go to weed, fertilize and harvest their crops together.  The rest of the week she tends to her grocery store where she sells basic need items.  She is well known among the settlement’s residents because she stocks a variety of products needed for daily meal preparation.  In addition, her husband works providing public transportation services within the locality.

Currently, Rosa has peas and potatoes planted which will be harvested in the upcoming months and she states that profits will be good because market price has risen.  

As Secretary of her communal bank she feels grateful to carry out this job within her association.  She’s a member of the “Pioneros de Cumutay” (Cumutay Pioneers) communal bank and this is the 9th loan with MFP where she hopes for your cooperation to make her plans come about.  Besides, she enjoys her communal bank’s work and because of that she commits to make her installment payments on time.

If Rosa were to receive your support, she will invest the requested money in the purchase of two sacks of pea seeds, gladioli seeds and several sacks of manure to start her next planting successfully.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds, gladioli and several sacks of manure.

loans.name: Áreas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Áreas está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras los cuales se dedican a comercializar perecederos. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Raquel quien vende frutas desde hace 2 años en el mercado de Masaya. Ella semanalmente vende aproximadamente 12,800. 
Raquel con el crédito comprara cosechas de perecederos de temporada.
Los otros integrantes son  Sebastiana de los Ángeles quien comercializa frutas y verduras desde hace cinco años y  José Alberto quien desde 1992 se dedica a la compra y venta de piña.
texts.en:
The A. group has three members, all enterprising and hard-working, who operate businesses selling perishables.  The group coordinator is Sra. Raquel who has sold fruit in the market at Masaya for 2 years.  She sells approximately 12,800 cordobas per week.  
Raquel will use this loan to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables.  
The other members of the group are Sebastiana de los Angeles who has operated a business selling fruit and vegetables for five years and Jose Alberto who, since 1992, has operated a business selling pineapples.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for food-sales business.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio de 39 años, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con sólo servicios de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Julio desde hace 4 años se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (cerdos, cabras, ovejas y aves de corral), los cría en sus corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento ideal, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.  Julio con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo a logrado sacar adelante a su familia, algo que le da mucha tranquilidad y orgullo.
texts.en:
Julio is 39 years old, single, and lives in his own house which has only electrical services. It is located in Tambogrande district, Piura department. The economy of the zone is characterized by agriculture, livestock raising, and artisan crafts.

Since he was 4 years old, Julio has sold corral animals (pigs, goats, sheep, and chickens). He raises them in corrals at the back of his house, on livestock feed, grains and natural grasses. Once they have reached ideal size, Julio sells them to customers, or in the different markets of the zone, and with the income he provides for his family's obligations.

Julio is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 new sols to buy animal feed. Once his animals are  fattened, he will sell them to his customers. With the earnings, Julio will pay off the loan and improve his family's quality of life. Julio, with much work and effort, has been able to advance his family, which gives him much pride and tranquility.

loans.use: buy larger quantities of livestock feed.

loans.name: Nestor Raul

texts.es:
El cliente es un joven Doctor, es Odontologo de la ciudad de Pilar, hace un año que esta ejerciendo su profesión, es soltero, sin hijos, vive en casa de sus padres donde también tiene su consultorio totalmente equipado.
Su papá es Abogado y su mamá Docente, es el menor de cinco hermanos. Todos los demás hermanos ya no viven con sus padres ya que todos han formado sus respectivas familias y todos son profesionales independientes. El se considera una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, a quien le gusta trabajar. Desea seguir creciendo como profesional para una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Él solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos a utilizar en su consultorio, con lo que podrá atender a sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
This client is a young doctor, he is a dentist in the city of Pilar.  He has been working in his profession for the last year.  He is single and without children, and lives in his parents home where he also has his fully equipped consulting office.

His dad is a lawyer and his mom is a teacher; he is the youngest of five siblings.  All the other siblings no longer live with his parents, as they have all formed their own families, and are all independent professionals.

He considers himself to be a very hard-working and enterprising person, who enjoys working.  He wants to continue to grow as a professional, so as to provide better service for his patients.

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies to use in his consulting office, with which he will be able to tend to his patients.  He is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity they are giving him.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his dental consulting office.

loans.name: Idalia Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Idalia es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y a sus padres que son ya persona de edad avanzada y están enfermos. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar los útiles escolares que son cuadernos, lápices, libros, colores y las mochilas, pagar la inscripción para que puedan estudiar. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y padres, ya que es la responsable en los gastos familiares. 
Doña Idalia trabaja en las oficina del gobierno en el departamento de limpieza, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en: Señora Idalia is a single mother. She is responsible for her two children and her parents who are elderly and sick. She is asking for a loan to pay for her children's school fees as she does not have enough money to buy school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, books, coloring pencils and backpacks and also pay the school fees. She wants to improve her children's and her parents' quality of life as she is the one responsible for the family expenses. Doña Idalia works in a government office, in the sanitation department, and she plans to use her salary to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and buy school supplies.

loans.name: Kahor

texts.ru: Кахор занимается выращиванием абрикосовых деревьев и имеет питомник. Начиная с февраля и марта, он начинает продавать саженцы, а также летом приобретает абрикосовый сад. В этом году он высушил более 800 килограмм кураги. А также он занимается откормом скота и её продажей. Его сыновья находятся в России на заработках. Ежемесячно они отправляют денежные переводы своим родителям, а Кахор строит дом за эти деньги.  Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и горюче смазочные материалы.
texts.en: Kahor is involved in growing apricot trees and has a nursery.  He starts selling seedlings in February and March and buys an apricot garden in the summer.  He prepared over 800 kilograms of dried apricots this year.  He is also involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  His sons are in Russia for work.  They send money home to the parents every month, and Kahor is building a house using this money.  He wants to obtain a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel and lubricant materials.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel and lubricant materials

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 46-year-old man. He is married and has two sons and one daughter. As a municipality employee, he receives a decent salary, but he also has two other ventures, selling vintage home appliances and a chicken shop. These two side projects are another source of income for the family. Jamal wants to improve his two ventures by purchasing more vintage home appliances for sale as well as more chickens for his shop. He needs to take out a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN and combine it with the amount he has to cover the full price. When Jamal gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to make the payment and improve his work on the two side projects. He will have a better collection of vintage home appliances for sale and higher quantities of chickens for sale. This way he will increase his income and his family will live in better conditions. Jamal is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more vintage home appliances and more chickens for his shop.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Remedios has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Remedios is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 33, married, and a mother of two children. She runs a tailoring business in Jomvu, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last five years. 

This is her second loan to finance her business which is doing well. With this loan she plans to purchase more cloth, buttons, zips, scissors and threads for her business. 

The anticipated profits which will be generated from the business will be reinvested for the gradual expansion of the business and the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful businesslady.

loans.use: purchase more cloth, buttons, zippers, scissors, and threads

loans.name: Manuel Julian

texts.es:
Manuel Julian tiene 31 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo vive  con el hijo  en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC Vuelve la Esperanza está conformada por 13 socios y socias, está ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la Oficina.
Manuel se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, soya y cacao las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, insumos, urea, abonos agrícolas, líquidos para la maleza para los cultivos.
Con la ayuda del crédito mejorara  y aumentará la producción para obtener mejores ingresos.
El sueño es verle al hijo que culmine los estudios y llegue ser un profesional exitoso.
 Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta diariamente es la competencia entre comerciantes, vías de comunicación, las enfermedades.
En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar por el campo y le gusta disfrutar de los carnavales.
texts.en:
Manuel Julián, 31, is single and has a son that he lives with in Chillanes, Bolívar Province. 

The “Vuelve la Esperanza” (Hope Returns) communal bank has 13 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the Office.

Manuel is a corn, soya and cocoa bean farmer.  His purchases and his sales take place in San José del Tambo every weekend.

He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, supplies, urea, farm manure and weed killers for the crops.

With help from the loan he will improve and increase production and earn better income.  

His dream is to see his son finish his schooling and become a successful professional.

The challenges he faces daily are competition among merchants, the roads and illnesses.

In his free time he likes taking walks in the countryside and he enjoys the carnivals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
 
He has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for ten years. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Vicente has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Selvester

texts.en: Selvester,  a 31-year-old Ugandan from Kyenjojo district, is the father of four children between the ages of 10 and 1.  Selvester is requesting this loan to purchase a gas cylinder to use in his welding business, which he has operated for three years. He dreams of developing his enterprise into a hardware store and educating his children.

loans.use: to buy a gas cylinder for use in his welding business.

loans.name: Iason

texts.en:
Iason is from the village Sakuneti, Southern part of the country. He is 59 years old and lives in the village with his wife, Dali. The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. They grow potatoes, maize and beans on family-owned plot of the land. They also have milkng cows and produce cheese. Cheese and harvested vegetables/corns are sold on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. 

Iason requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. The family will increase the amount of milk cows, thus they will be able to produce and sell more cheese. It will positively affect the income of the family. Increased income will allow Iason and Dali to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Jolie Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des familles polygamiques, les cinq femmes du groupe Jolie ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants, habitent le quartier Darsalam  de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali)  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Médine Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente d’habits de la friperie, d’habits  pour enfants, produits cosmétiques (encens), sacs à mains et parures (colliers). 
Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mariam (1ère femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente d’habits de la friperie dans le quartier  Darsalam Ségou. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux ballons d’habits de la friperie au grand marché de Ségou.  La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, au marché Médine et en ambulant dans la ville de Ségou  à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux petits besoins du foyer en nourriture et frais de scolarisation. Elle a pour objectif de réinvestir l’épargne dans l’activité afin de devenir grossiste dans son petit commerce.
texts.en: The five women of the Jolie group are all married and live in polygamous families.  They have an average age of 37, three children, live in the Darsalam of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through community and kinship ties and their revenue-generating businesses at the Médine Ségou market. The members of the group buy and sell used clothing, children's clothing, cosmetic products (incense), handbags and jewelry (necklaces). With the goal of building up their sales stock, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 5th solidarity loan. Madame Mariam (1st woman on the left of the photo) has a great reputation for selling used clothing in the Darsalam Ségou neighborhood. She plans to use her loan to buy two bales of used clothing at Segou’s Grand Market.  She sells them for cash or credit at the Médine market and by walking from place to place in Ségou to a clientele consisting mainly of women. With this loan, Madame Mariam hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 26,000 CFA that will be used to provide for the basic needs of the family — food and school expenses. Her goal is to reinvest her savings in her business in order to become a wholesaler in her trade.

loans.use: To buy two bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Reachny

texts.en: Reachny, 22 years-old, is married, and resides with her husband and her parents in-law in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a truck driver. Reachny is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 in order to purchase construction material to build her house. In the future, she plans to runs a business of buying and selling rice.

loans.use: to purchase construction material to build her house.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in the coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. She is married and has five school going children. Monica owns a preparatory school; an education center that offers primary level education. She also owns some rental houses.

Monica was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to build additional classrooms and carry out some renovations. 

The main challenge Monica faces is late payments by some parents which hampers the school's operations. She aspires to have a fully integrated school providing education through the primary school years and to meet all the government requirements.

loans.use: to build additional classrooms and carry out some renovations.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is a happy man. His boutique business has improved. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He is now applying for his second loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He intends to use the loan to stock up his business with more hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes. 

He will save the anticipated profit and help take care of his children. In the future, Ernest hopes to expand his shop and also venture into other businesses.

loans.use: to stock up his business with more hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Teodoro tiene 44 años y es un padre de familia ejemplar pese a estar separado de su pareja, tiene 3 hijos que son el motivo de sus esfuerzos. Sus hijos están a su cargo y vela por que reciban una buena educación. Teodoro se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con un terreno agrícola el cual ya lo abono con excremento de cuyes. Tedoro solicita el préstamo para poder realizar la siembra de papa,él comprara semilla seleccionada de papa orgánica y también lo invertirá para pagar la limpieza del terreno agrícola. El único anhelo de Teodoro es que pueda apoyar a sus hijos siempre y espera pronto ver a todos sus hijos profesionales.

loans.use: Para compra de semilla seleccionada de papa organica

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 42 years old and married with two children. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, fruits, and other groceries.

Editha has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, fruits, and other groceries

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar sells of fruits and vegetables in his own car. He has not a shop. This car is his own. His car did not not work good. He had a problem with his car. This problem disturbed to him to expand his business.
Having borrowed a loan amount of $400, he repaired his car and bought the fruits and vegetables.
The second loan $800 he spent to buy 4 wheels and 1 accumulator and increased the amount of the fruits and vegetables. 
Vugar was born in 1969. He is married, has 1 child.
He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Fizuli region Mirzenagilli village. He and his family settled in Khirdalan settlement.
Now he needs a loan amount of $1200 to build a shop. He plans to be busy with sale agricultural products

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Ngon

texts.en: Ngon N. and her husband live in Phnom Penh, Cambodia and are the parents of nine children.  N. grows rice in the rainy season, while her husband works as a musician and can earn up to $500 per year.  Five of their children help them to grow crops, while the others are construction workers and factory workers.  N. and her husband hope to use part of this loan to buy a motorcycle taxi that their son can drive to help supplement the family's income.  They hope to use the rest of the loan to buy a machine so that they can increase their annual rice production.

loans.use: To buy a machine to help harvest crops and to buy a motorcycle to use as taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a place for collecting and recycling

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
Santusa runs a small dairy and farm where she grows vegetables such as parsley, lettuce, sweet corn, turnips, and so on. Her husband is a salaried driver for the interprovincial public transportation system. They derive their family income from these efforts, and they support a 16-year-old son, who helps out on the farm.

Santusa lives in the region of Palomar--Rio Abajo, to the south of La Paz and about an hour and a half from the city.

She would use the loan to buy a milk cow so that she can increase production. This is her first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation conducted qualifies her to receive this loan, with which she hopes to increase the family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Santusa, es productora de leche de vaca y es pequeña agricultora de hortalizas como ser el perejil, lechuga, choclo, nabo, etc., el esposo es chofer asalariado de transporte público interprovincial. Sus ingresos familiares provienen de estas actividades, con lo que se mantienen, tiene un hijo de 16 años que ayuda con el trabajo del campo. Santusa vive en la Comunidad de Palomar – Rió Abajo (Ubicado al Sur de la ciudad de La Paz, a una hora y media de esta ciudad). El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le permite acceder al préstamo y de esa forma incrementar sus ingresos familiares.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese, 39 years old, married and mother of one child owns a small tailor shop in Bourj Hammoud in the Northern Suburbs of Beirut. 
She has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 3 years and has a very good record of on time repayment. Before opening the shop a couple of years ago, Therese was working from her home. With time, she understood that if she wants to get more exposure and expand her business, she needs to open a shop and offer a better visibility for her work.
As expected, since the opening of the shop, she enlarged her clients base  and increased her monthly revenues in a substantial way.
This time, Therese needs a loan for an amount of USD 750 to buy a stock of fabrics and sewing threads. Indeed, she has received from 2 schools in her neighborhood a request to provide them with a large number of students uniforms.

loans.use: Purchase of a large stock of fabrics and sewing threads

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and lives with her husband, three children (ages 18, 13, and 8), two younger sisters, and their assistant. She opened a new restaurant called “Mama Rwecho Café” a month ago. Prior to that, Maria was a charcoal vendor, but found that it was not a stable source of income. Her café is now open from 6am until 11pm each day, and serves around 50 customers. A meal costs about 91 cents per plate. While Maria makes a profit of around US$18 a day, almost US$3 goes toward rent. She also employs 4 cooks to help her.

Previously, Maria took out a loan to open the restaurant. Having paid it back successfully, she now hopes to take out another loan of US$900 to buy rice and other cooking items in bulk quantities.

Maria belongs to the group "Giraffe," which consists of 27 other members who keep each other accountable and help each other pay back their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of cooking items for a restaurant

loans.name: Kilisitina

texts.en: Kilisitina is a relatively new member of our program, and she fully paid off her first loan in just four weeks! Before joining SPBD, she already had an existing business, a flea market stall, but didn’t have enough items to sell. She borrowed from SPBD and used it to buy good quality handicrafts which she said are all sold out now. She is requesting another loan to buy more handicrafts for her market stall. This lady also has a good savings account which she is preserving "for a rainy day".

loans.use: To buy handicrafts to sell at her flea market stall

loans.name: Bokasa A Group

texts.en:
Christine is 32 years old, married and has five children. She runs a wholsesale business that distributes goods to various retail merchants. Hasifa offers tailoring services. Jannet and Ritah both have retail shops, and Porssy sells groceries. Christine wants to use the extra profits earned by her business to pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for several business.

loans.name: Esta

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Esta L., who has one child.

In 2005, Esta established a tailoring and DVD rental business. Working 9 to 12 hours a day, and assisted by her partner and child, she earns about $160 per month from this business. Esta now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional DVDs and tapes for rent, as well as material and sewing accessories for her tailoring business. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Many women are therefore considered not creditworthy by financial institutions in Tanzania, as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and therefore poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase DVDs and tapes for rent, as well as material and sewing accessories for her tailoring business

loans.name: Munira's Group

texts.en:
I am Munira M. and a mother of two: one girl and one boy. Both my kids attend a nearby local school. My husband is a welder and works at a local factory; along with this job, he also runs a small welding store. I mostly do my household chores, but whenever I get free time, I embroider clothes to order for various clients. We are borrowing for the first time and need this loan to expand our welding store. Once our business is established, my husband will longer have to work at the factory.

My group members are: Suriya K., who is borrowing to buy a cow; Sharifan B., who wants to expand their milk shop; and Irshad B., who will buy a donkey cart with her share of the loan.

loans.use: Expand welding business

loans.name: Bakte1 Group

texts.es:
Ms. Esperanza H. is a 35-year-old woman who would like to start a pig farming business from home. She hopes that with the profits generated from the business, she will be able to buy more pigs and build a large pigpen so that she can raise many piglets. She would also like to contribute to covering the family expenses because she has three children. She hopes to start her business with this loan. The other members of the group are: Rebeca M. G., who sells beverages; Leonides Pérez V., who raises and sells pigs; Edilia C. M., who sells clothing; and Matilde H. A., who raises and sells pigs, as well as foodstuff.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

DOÑA ESPERENZA TIENE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD, QUIERE COMENZAR SU NEGOCIO DE CRIANZA DE PUERCOS EN SU CASA, DECEA QUE CON LOS INGRESOS QUE LE GENERE ESTE NEGOCIO COMPRAR MAS PUERCOS Y CONSTRUIR UN CHIQUERO GRANDE PARA TENER MUCHOS PUERQUITOS , TAMBIEN DECEA APORTAR AL GASTO FAMILIAR YA QUE TIENE TRES HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO DECEA INICIAR SU NEGOCIO, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON REBECA M. GIRÓN VENDE REFRESCOS, LEONIDES PÉREZ V. VENDE Y CRIA PUERCOS, EDILIA C. M. VENDE ROPA Y MATILDE H. A. CRIA Y VENDE PUERCOS Y VENDE ABARROTES.

loans.use: Purchase pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Delvis Janeth

texts.es:
Ms. Delvis Janeth is a very brave person who is from the municipality Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega. She has a grocery store where she sells all types of products such as food and home products. It is necessary to point out that this is her only form of income to support her humble home.

Today she has requested a loan from Ceprodel to invest in the purchase of the products she sells. She is in need of a loan because her revenues have been low. However, she is aware that once she obtains the loan she will increase her clientele by being able to offer more products which will allow her economic condition to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Delvis Janeth es una persona muy esforzada originaria del municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, se ha dedicado al negocio de pulpería donde oferta todo tipo de productos como lo son comestibles, personales y del hogar. Es necesario destacar que este es su único ingreso para la manutención de su humilde hogar de habitación.

Hoy en día ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para invertirlos en la compra de los productos para su venta. Ha acudido a este créditos por el hecho de que sus ingresos han sido muy bajos sin embargo está muy conciente que al obtener el crédito aumentará sus ingresos por lo que al ofrecer mas productos aumentara su clientela y de esta manera logrará mejorar su condición económica.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Fahim

texts.en: Fahim lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a retail shop and he has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. He took his first loan to support his business to this point. Now he wants to take his second loan to complete his inventory to become strong in his business. He is happy with this loan process that helps poor people in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his inventory

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan baji is the wife of M., and she lives in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, and she has been living in this house for the last 20 years. She is the mother of two children: one daughter and one son. Her daughter sews clothes, while her son washes clothes. Her husband owns and operates a cigarette shop. She has already successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and she is now applying for a loan for her husband so that he can diversify his cigarette business.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Bushra baji, who seeks a loan to expand her cosmetics business; and (2) Safia baji, who requests a loan to buy a donkey cart.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing a donkey cart or cosmetics)

loans.name: Marina Luz

texts.es:
Marina’s ultimate goal is to help generate greater income for her family by purchasing a cart and sell salchipapas (a common fast food in Peru consisting of sliced sausages and french fries in various sauces) and roasted chicken in the afternoons along the main street of Catac. This will enable Marina, a member of the communal bank “Señor de Ramos” to augment the family income. Although her current work generates 140 Soles a week (~$48 USD) and her partner is a chauffeur, their current combined income is not enough to support their six children and provide for their educational needs. For five years Marina has sold ice cream and other sweets, which she purchases in the city of Huarez, outside of a secondary school in Catac

With this loan of $50 USD, which she will be granted by the Manuela Ramos Movement and which will be repaid in four installments, she will initiate her new business with the purchase of ice cream, cones, lollipops and ice cream spoons.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La meta de Marina, que pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Ramos” es comprar su carrito salchipapero y vender por las tardes en la calle principal de Catac, salchipapas y pollo broaster, para así tener mas ingresos, aunque su actual negocio le genera una ganancia de 140 soles semanales y su conviviente es chofer, esto no les es suficiente para mantener a sus seis hijos, ya que no se abastecen para darles lo necesario para sus estudios. Durante cinco años ella vende en el colegio secundario de Catac, helados y Chupetes, que los compra al por mayor de la ciudad de Huaraz. Con este préstamo de 100 soles, que le otorgará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y que será pagado en 4 cuotas, ella implementará su negocio con la compra de Barquillos, Helados, Chupetes y palitos para helados.

loans.use: Purchase provisions for food sales

loans.name: Irma Marleni

texts.es:
La señora Irma Marleny, tiene 43 años, está casada, estudió la carrera de Contabilidad	en el Instituto Trujillo, nunca lo ejerció porque se dedicó al negocio y cuidar a sus hijos, tiene 04 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente, optó por poner negocio estable de suelas, plantas de PVC cuando sus hijos crecieron, tiene 03 años en este negocio, anteriormente viajaba a Lima para comprar ropa, después dejó ese negocio. Tiene 02 años en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, una amiga la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA” ella decidió pertenecer a este Banco porque necesitaba capital para tener un negocio sólido y con el primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 que recibió compró plantas de PVC a sus  proveedores.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,100.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de plantas, suelas de PVC.

La empresaria sueña con seguir creciendo dentro de sus posibilidades.
En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de presidenta, cuya función es dar bienvenida, animar a las nuevas socias para que paguen puntualmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma Marleny is 43 years old, married, and she studied Accounting in the Trujillo Institute. She has 4 children who are students, and she lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province in La Libertad state. To help herself economically she opted to open a stable business of insoles and soles of PVC while her children were growing up. She has had this business for 3 years, previously she would travel to Lima to buy clothing but she left this business. She has been involved with Manuela Ramos for 2 years as a friend recommended the Communal Bank “Esperanza del Mañana” and she decided to join this Bank because she needed the capital to have her business be solid. With the first loan for S/. 500.00 that she received she bought PVC insoles from her suppliers. With the loan for S/. 1,100.00 which will be repaid in 4 months, she is thinking of investing in the purchase of insoles and soles of PVC. This businesswoman dreams of continuing to grow the possibilities of business. She is the president of the Communal Bank to which she belongs, her function is to welcome and inspire new members to pay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soles and insoles for shoes

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen A. D. is a 45 year old man. He is married and has two children who are currently in school.  He belongs to the community group named Adjinyemise Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee each other as social collateral to access loans and provide peer support. Stephen is in the photo which was taken during a group meeting. 

He is a fisherman who fishes in the Kpong River in the Volta region of Ghana. Many traders purchase his fish because it is fresh and affordable. With the loan, Stephen wants to purchase a fishing net and repair his fishing canon. For sometime now, Stephen's canon has been giving him problems. He hopes that the loan will help him meet the demand and also provide him with enough income to sponsor his childrens' education. He appreciates the assistance.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and repair his fishing canon

loans.name: Flor Johanna

texts.es:
Flor es socia de Banco Comunal El Pino. 
Flor es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años. El mayor esta en la escuela. 
Flor tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos como ambulante empezó con este negocio desde hace 2 años, le hacen pedidos y los reparte a las casas de sus clientes.Flor vende todos los días.
Flor desde que recibe los préstamos ha mejorado , porque puede traer mas pedidos y le mas ganancias y tiene otra entrada económica.
Flor necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa y zapatos pues ya tiene sus pedidos.
Flor sueña con tener una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the El Pino (The Pine Tree) microfinance institute. Flor is a 32-year-old woman who has a domestic partner and 2 children ages 9 and 2. The eldest child is in school. Flor sells clothing and footwear as a street vendor for a living. She started this business 2 years ago. Her customers order merchandise, and then she distributes it to their homes. She works everyday. Ever since she has received the loans, Flor’s economic situation has improved because she can fill more orders and bring in more profits with this extra income. Flor needs a loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing clothing and footwear to fill existing orders. Flor dreams of having her own boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and footwear

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat S., a 25-year-old mother of one living in Ptasrong Commune, Pursat Province, grows and sells rice and vegetables for a living. She is married to Mr. Pros Phon, 26, a status carver since 2001.

Sinat is now requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more wood for her husband’s business and fertilizer for her rice crop. Mrs. Sinat's husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор окончив первый свой кредит решил взять ещё кредит для закупа мелкого скота и корма для них.Сейчас у него более 30 голов мелкорогатого скота.Он рад сотрудничать с нами. Поняв что кредит ему идёт впользу он с радостью кредитуется в Микроинвесте.
texts.en:
After successfully repaying his first loan, Abdusattor decided to take out another loan in order to purchase small-horned cattle and feed for them. Now he has 30 head of cattle. He is pleased to work with us. Having learnt how the use of credit benefits him, he is happy to get his financing from MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria  es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Gloria es conviviente, tiene 53 años,  tres hijos todos mayores que estudian y trabajan.
Desde joven vendió productos de belleza por catalogo y entro a trabajar en un taller de costura por varios años, hasta que renuncio, pero hace tres años se dedica a dar menús, su esposo es jefe de una obra de construcción y ella lleva los menús cada día, reparte de 70 a 100 menús, en la cocina cuenta con un ayudante de cocina, todo tiene que estar listo a los 11 de la mañana lo lleva hasta la avenida arequipa. 

Necesita un crédito de 3000 soles, para comprar una olla arrocera de 10 kilos, implementar su cocina con la compra de licuadora, sartenes,  y remodelarla  
El sueño que tiene es de poner un negocio de bazar por que es mas reposado,  ella esta pensando en su vejez
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Bancomunal 24 de Octubre ("October 24th Communal Bank"). She is married, 53 years old, and has three older children who study and work. Since she was young, she sold beauty products from a catalog. She worked in a sewing shop for a number of years until she quit. But three years ago she started providing meals. Her husband is a construction boss. Every day, she brings the meals and hands out 70 to 100 of them. In the kitchen she relies on an assistant. Everything has to be ready by 11 A.M. She takes the food to Avenida Arequipa ("Arequipa Avenue"). She needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy a 10 kilo rice cooker, stock her kitchen with a blender and frying pans, and to remodel the kitchen. Her dream is to run a bazaar because of the more relaxed atmosphere. She is thinking about her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy a 10 kilo rice cooker, to buy a blender and frying pans, and to remodel her kitchen.

loans.name: Adyamaa

texts.en:
Adyamaa Y. has been taking loans from XacBank, Kiva's partner micro-finance institution in Mongolia, for four years. She is married with three children. To help her husband to feed the children, she engages in retail business at the "Narantuul" market, the biggest Mongolian outdoor market, which operates in all four seasons. In the winter, it's very challenging to operate her business as temperatures routinely fall below -20 degrees Celsius.

Adyamaa's business is selling used clothes. She buys used clothes by the kilogram, imported from South Korea. A couple of years ago, she leased a car through XacBank for use in her business. From the previous loan profit, she fixed her house, a traditional Mongolian "ger" (form of nomadic housing). Adyamaa is a hard-working person. She plans to use her Kiva loan to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to increase her business inventory

loans.name: Mumtaz M.ramzan Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz baji is the wife of M. R. and has resided in a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the last 10 years. Mumtaz baji’s husband has a business selling cosmetics. He buys cosmetics from a famous city named Lahore and sells in parlors and cosmetic shops. He has been in this business for the last seven years. Mumtaz baji is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics to expand her husband’s business. 

She is the group leader for some more women in her locality. Noreen anjum baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor. Shamim baji wants a loan to pay off the installments on her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy paints to sell. Riaz baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each group member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Akhtar Baqir Ali Group

texts.en:
Akhtar B. is the wife of B. A. who lives in a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan.  She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for 23 years. 

Akhtar’s husband has had a dairy business for five years.  He sells milk to shops and earns a profit.  Akhtar and her husband get up at 4:00 a.m. to get milk from the buffalo.  Then they pour the milk into pots.  Akhtar successfully repaid four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her milk selling business. 

Akhtar is the group leader.  Two other women are involved locally.  Shafqat Nawaz wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.  Majidan A. wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business.

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy a buffalo for milk selling business.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  cinq femmes du groupe Sabougnouma sont  toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers populaires de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  de pagnes wax, de chaussures, de tasses, de condiments alimentaires et de poissons.
Elles  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour renforcer leur capacité de commerce et de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles  sont à leur dixième  prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été  correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce  prêt, elles comptent acheter, 60 paniers de tomates, 15 pièces de pagne wax et 50 colis de tasses.  Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Médine et au grand marché de Sikasso. Les marchandises sont vendues  au marché, dans les concessions de  façon ambulante à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de santé de nourriture de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Sabougnouma are all married and average 34 years of age and 3 children each. The group members live in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, a working-class district of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do various work, including the sale of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), shoes, tubs and basins, condiments, and fish.

The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to bolster their capacity to do business and to satisfy the needs of their customers. They are on their tenth solidarity loan, and all the preceding ones have been correctly repaid.

With this loan, the group members plan to buy sixty baskets of tomatoes, fifteen bolts of Wax pagnes, and fifty packages of basins. Supplies are gotten at the Médine marketplace and at the grand market of Sikasso. The merchandise is sold to men and women customers, mostly in cash transactions, at the marketplace and door-to-door in the concessions.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for the food and health needs of the family, and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, cloth, and basins

loans.name: New Miracle Praise Ministry Primary School, Waterloo Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the New Miracle Praise Ministry Primary School, Waterloo. New Miracle Praise Ministry Primary School was established in 2006 by Harold E. T., an American who got donations from missionaries. The school has a staff of seven teachers and 173 pupils.

This will be the first loan teachers of the New Miracle Praise Ministry Primary School, Waterloo are requesting from SMT/Kiva. This loan will certainly be of immense help to these teachers. Since salaries are usually small in Sierra Leone, especially so for people in the teaching profession, they could not use such salaries to buy or do anything great. But with a loan, they can now buy or do something big and then repay over a period of time. Some of them will use their loan to begin or continue building a house; others to pay either for themselves to pursue further studies or pay for their children’s education. Some will use the loan to invest in businesses in order to complement their monthly salaries. And still, others will use theirs to buy pieces of furniture.

John B. (third from right) is a head teacher at the School. He was born in Bo district, southern Sierra Leone. He is age twenty-eight, married with one child who is in class one. He has been a teacher for five years now. However, John supplements teaching with some petty-trading. He will therefore invest this loan in his palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) business. He will be able to get at least ten barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm oil which he will store until there is a price hike.

loans.use: Buy at least ten barters of palm oil

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro tiene 39 años, vive en pareja con Celia de 28 años, están juntos hace como diez años y tienen un hijo de 8 años que va la escuela. Isidro comenta que proviene de una familia muy humilde, que desde muy temprano le ayudaba a su padre en el campo, razón por la cual no pudo terminar sus estudios. Aún así se siente afortunado por que cuenta con su pareja quien le ayuda con la venta de huevos, leche, gallinas y otras aves que el mismo cría en su pequeña granja. Isidro también se dedica al cultivo de tomate, locote, caña de azúcar, etc. Comenta que está muy agradecido con lo que tiene porque gracias a su dedicación y el apoyo de su familia puede tener una vida digna y así darle una vida mejor a su hijo.
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima e insumos como: semillas, insecticidas, abonos, productos químicos, etc. debido a que quiere ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Isidro is 39 years old and lives with his partner Celia, 28. They have been together for 10 years and have an 8-year-old son who is in school. Isidro tells us that he comes from a very humble family and from a very early age he helped his father in the field, which is why he was never able to finish his studies. However, he feels fortunate because he has Celia, who helps him sell eggs, milk, hens and other birds that they raise themselves on their small farm. Isidro also dedicates himself to cultivating tomatoes, peppers, sugar cane and other crops. He tells us that he is very grateful because thanks to his dedication and the support of his family he can have a worthy life and offer a better one to his son. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of more raw materials such as seeds, insecticide, fertilizer, chemicals, etc. because he wants to expand his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming raw materials such as seeds, insecticide, fertilizer, chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Réhoboth Plus Group

texts.fr: Chantal a passé une bonne partie de sa vie dans la micro-entreprise. Elle s’est donnée corps et âme pour faire prospérer son activité malgré quelques étapes difficiles traversées. Elle a commencé le commerce en 1984 avec un capital initial de $50. De 1984 – 1990, la vente des vivres frais lui a procuré un capital de plus de $100 qui lui ont permis de diversifier l’affaire en y ajoutant une boutique générale. Celle-ci a prospéré de 1994 en 2000 lorsque Chantal connut un accident en route pour les achats de la marchandise pour sa boutique. Son hospitalisation pendant 4 mois causa une baisse sensible de son affaire. Après la convalescence en 2000,  elle décida de lancer un autre type d’activité, la vente des produits de beauté pour dames. Suite à l’expérience de la bonne gestion acquise depuis des années, Chantal parvint à réaliser en 2006, un capital propre de $500 qui lui ouvrit la porte à une petite usine de fabrication d’eau pure qu’elle monta jusqu’à ce jour. Compte tenu de son rêve d’ouvrir un jour une grande usine de fabrication d’eau pure afin de servir la population de son quartier qui en a grandement besoin, elle décida en décembre 2007 d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Réhoboth Plus » dans le but de renforcer financièrement son affaire. Chantal est une cliente fidèle de Hope qui a reçu plusieurs fois les crédits et les a remboursés totalement et à temps. Le crédit obtenu le mois de juin courant lui a servi à acheter 1000 paquets des sachets d’eau pure en vue de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et ainsi accroitre le bénéfice. Actuellement, son capital propre est de plus de $500. Son activité génère $40 de bénéfice par semaine. Chantal est une dame âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 12 enfants âgés de 4 à 24. Onze d’entre eux étudient.
texts.en:
Chantal has spent a good deal of her life working in micro-business. She has put body and soul into her business's prosperity despite difficult periods. She began a business in 1984 with an initial capital of US$ 50. Between 1984 and 1990, the sale of fresh foodstuffs brought her up to a capital of US$ 100, which allowed her to diversify her business by adding on a general store. This also prospered from 1994 to 2000, at which point Chantal was in a traffic accident as she was out buying goods for her store. Her hospitalization of 4 months caused a noticeable diminishing of her business.

After her convalescence, in 2000, she decided to undertake a different type of business, selling beauty products for women. Since she had acquired so much experience in business management over the years, Chantal was able to accumulate a personal capital of US$ 500 by 2006, which allowed her to open a little factory for pure drinking water that she maintains up to today.

In view of her dream of one day opening a big factory making drinking water so as to serve the population of her neighborhood, which has great need of this product, she decided in December of 2007 to join one of the groups of Hope RDC called « Réhoboth Plus » with the goal of increasing her business's financial base. Chantal is a faithful client of Hope and has received several loans, reimbursing them completely and in a timely manner.

The loan she has received in this month of June allowed her to buy 1000 packages of bags of pure water so as to satisfy the needs of her customers and thus increase her profit. Presently, her personal capital is more than US$ 500. Her business generates $40 in profit per week. Chantal is a 41-year-old woman, married and the mother of 12 children from 4 to 24 years of age. Eleven of them are enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 1000 packages of bags of water for resale

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 3 Biira Rose Group

texts.en: B. Rose is 38-years old, married, and has nine children in schooling. She has been selling cassava flour as a business for eight years, so far. She is using the loan to purchase bags of cassava flour for sale. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to educate her kids and to buy a plot of a land.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Melagros

texts.en:
Melagros O. is from the town of Quiboro, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 45 years old. Melagros is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Melagros owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling grilled chicken and pork. Melagros has just started this business.

In July 2008, Melagros joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melagros has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. Melagros is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients for her business . This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Melagros from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Doña Tomasa O. V. cuenta con 48 años de edad Casada vive con sus 4 hijos, actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de cortes típicos lleva 10 años dedicándose  a este oficio también vende este producto a diferentes clientes que ella tiene, cuenta con un  pequeño taller con operarios que trabajan para ella  según las exigencias y variedades de sus clientes han ido en aumentado y acudio a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR para acreditar un préstamo para la compra de materia prima que ella utiliza en su trabajo facilitando a otras personas la demanda, como también mejorar sus ingresos y así poder sufragara sus gastos personales obteniendo mejores ganancias de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Doña Tomasa O. V. is 48, is married, and has 4 children. She has made traditional suits for 10 years. She sells these products to various customers that she has. She has a small workshop with employees who work for her. As the demand from her customers has increased, they have expanded and turned to the offices of ASDIR to receive a loan to purchase supplies to use in their work. She would like to increase her income to be able to defray personal expenses and to make more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artisanship

loans.name: Elena De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Elena D. Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 74 años y 07 hijos ya independientes.

Elena D. Jesús, lleva varios años dedicándose a la costura, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, se dedica a arreglar pantalones, blusas y vestidos y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, se encuentra establecida en su misma casa, donD. atienD. a sus clientes.
Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos D. sus clientes anticipadamente.
En la actualidad continua con su negocio y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuD. a su casa para realizar sus trabajos, es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Elena D. Jesús, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena D. Jesús is a member of the Communal Bank "Honestidad y Trabajo" (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 74 years old, widowed, and has 7 adult children.

Elena D. Jesús has worked several years as a seamstress, gradually earning her own income and setting asiD. some savings. She makes trousers, blouses, and dresses. She says business is doing well. Her workshop is set up in her house, where she attends to her customers who place their orders in advance.

She continues with her business as usual. Her customers have demonstrated their loyalty by frequently returning to her home to place more orders. In return, she greets them personally with the warmth and kindness that she is known to display.

With her loan of 800 soles, she will buy meters of different fabrics, as well as tools and supplies such as scissors, hand sewing needles, sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons.

Today Elena D. Jesús is a very accomplished woman. She has more desire to achieve and realize her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women start and grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & sewing supplies

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
Abdurahim is very demanding in his work, having been a farmer since childhood. Today, as a head of household, he works tirelessly to generate stable income. He works caring for his animals, getting up very early to gather grasses so he can keep his livestock well-fed. Abdurahim sells both the milk they produce, as well as the grasses that he cultivates on his land. He is seeking this current loan for the purchase of additional cows for expanding his business. Please help support Abdurahim’s efforts so he can continue to improve his standard of living. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: La señora Socorro Álvarez de 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de  cuatro hijos mayores de edad, los cuales trabajan, residen en el barrio Héroes y Mártires de Ayapal en la capital de Managua, su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos, negocio que inicio que inicio con ahorros y finiciamiento para incrementar el inventario y poder ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes: quiere comprar granos básicos, gaseosa golosinas ,productos de limpiezas, pintura de uñas, cuadernos y otros para aumentar las ventas . sus planes es seguir mejorando su casa, y apoyar a sus hijos. Agradece Afodenic por el préstamo ya que será de beneficio para aumentar su inventario y elevar las ventas.

loans.use: Comprar granos basicos, golosinas, gaseosas y otros para variar sus ventas

loans.name: Musi

texts.en:
R. is married with seven children. She lives at mile 19 Mbengwi- Cameroon.  R. and her entire family are living in a house with two rooms,
R. had to overcome some challenges in life such as the death of her husband which has caused to be sponsoring her children single handed and even taking care of her self. 
She does pig farming as her major activity and also farming of crops such as coco yams, , cassava.. She plans to invest this loan in buying of piglets for rearing 
This will be R.’s eight time to receive loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since the year 2000. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location of her business, and her reasonable prices.  Also with the experience, she is now having good pigs for sale and good harvest from her farm.
 
Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family and give them good medication when ever they  are sick and will use part of it to plough back in to her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: purchase of piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Favour Group

texts.en:
Favour group is a group of 5 borrowers led by Korto M., 40 years old, married with 7 children aged 10-22 years old. Their educational levels are 5th-9th grade. Korto is an illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in Ziggida Town, a small town close to Zorzor, a district in Lofa county, northern Liberia.

Korto’s business is the sale of general goods like candles, matches, batteries, foodstuffs, etc. She buys general goods wholesale and sells retail on a table to residents of Ziggida town. She has been running this business for 7 years and is hoping to expand to a bigger table.

Korto sells quality goods in order encourage customers to continue buying from her. She was a farmer but later decided to get into business because farming in Liberia is a very poor business because most people make farms just to feed their family.

Korto needs this loan in order to purchase more general goods wholesale to improve business. She dreams of giving her family a better living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more general goods wholesale to improve business

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun C., 36, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She makes and sells cow bells in the village to earn approximately $2 of profit each day, while her husband is a moto-taxi driver. On average, he makes about $9 in revenue per day. This couple has four children, two in school and two yet too young to attend. Chhun C. is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike to operate a moto-taxi business.

loans.use: To operate a moto-taxi business.

loans.name: Feature Treasure Group

texts.en:
Dan Dada C. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called Feature Treasure. He is 22 years old and single without any children.
He is an 11th grade student who is fending for himself because of poverty. Dan lives in the VOA community, north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.
His business is the sale of kerosene. He buys kerosene from wholesalers and sells at retail to residents of VOA, north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.
He has been running this business for three years, and hopes to have a petroleum station in the future. Dan talks to his customers in a good manner in order to encourage customers to continue buying from him. He started selling with LD4000.00 that was given to him by his uncle. Dan needs this loan to purchase more kerosene to improve his business. He dreams of getting a higher education and building a house.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Gladys Monserrate

texts.es:
La señora Gladis pertenece al Banco Comunal Aves Fénix este banco se reúne en Nuevo Portoviejo un lugar de bastantes habitantes en las afueras de de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se dedica a las tareas del hogar, pero también se da tiempo para vender mercadería, como ropa intimas y se ayuda con los productos de belleza de diferentes marcas, lleva 4 años en este negocio, y cada día crecen más sus ventas gracias  a los prestamos que le facilita la Fundación Espoir, le va muy bien, recorre en el sector donde vive a sus amigas y familia son sus clientes, ella sola trabaja ya que sus hijos trabajan, invierte 200 o a veces 300, en ocasiones viaja a Guayaquil a comprar o compra en Portoviejo a los mayoristas para poder obtener buenas ganancias.

Para que en ésta navidad pueda vender más la señora Gladis invertirá todo su préstamo que está solicitando en incrementar su negocio, ya tiene pedidos, ella vende por docena la ropa intima, está muy contenta con lo que hace y no piensa en cambiarlo.
texts.en:
Gladis is a member of the Aves Fénix communal bank which meets in Nuevo Portoviejo, a highly-populated area on the outskirts of Portoviejo. She is a housewife but also sells merchandise like underwear and beauty products of various brands. She has been in this line of work for 4 years and her sales increase daily. Thanks to the loans she gets from Fundación Espoir, she does quite well. She is able to go around the area where she lives visiting her friends and family who are her customers. She works by herself since her children also work. She invests 200 or sometimes 300 and occasionally visits Guayaquil to shop there or she buys in Portoviejo from wholesalers so that her profits will be larger. In order to increase sales during the Christmas shopping season, Gladis will use the entire loan requested to increase her stock inventory; she already has orders pending. She sells underwear by the dozen. She is very happy with what she does and has no plans to change it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy underwear for men and women, beauty products, etc.

loans.name: Nueva Amistad Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento NUEVA AMISTAD, es un Banco que ya esta en su segundo ciclo este Banco esta conformado por 11 integrantes 8 Mujeres y 3 Varones y las socias se dedican a la venta de carne, verduras, comida y tienda de bario y otros, Sra. LUZ es la presidenta del Banco y tiene un hijo y su actividad es otorgar viveres a facilidad a requerimiento de las personas y tiene su madalidad de pagos semanales, quincenales y mensuales tambien trabaja en un Hospital y de esta manera tener otra fuente de ingreso . La Sra. BEATRIZ VIRGINIA, es la secretaria del banco y tiene 2 hijos y se dedica al comercio venta de verduras, fletes de VHS y punto viva es decir tiene una tienda de barios en su mismo domicilio y con el prestamo ha logrado incremetar  su capital de trabajo y siempre esta pensando en invertir en nuevos  negocios , la Sra. Betariz es una persona muy responsable y tiene muchas ganas de superarse. La Sra. MICAELA KARINA,  es la tesorera en el banco y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, con el prestamo ha logrado comprar en cantidad sus productos que estan en oferta como ser perfumes, desodorantes, talcos y otros, para mejorar sus ingresos e incrementar su capital de trabajo ella es muy responsable y se observa muchas deseo de superarse.
texts.en:
The “NUEVA AMISTAD” Community Bank is already on their second loan cycle. This Bank has 11 members, 8 Women and 3 Men. The group members sell meat, vegetables, food and have a neighborhood store and other jobs. Mrs. LUZ is the Bank president. She has one son and she sells supplies as per personal order. Her method of payment is weekly, biweekly and monthly. She also works in a Hospital so this way she has another source of income. Mrs. BEATRIZ VIRGINIA is the bank secretary. She has 2 children and she works selling vegetables, VHS rental and phone booth, meaning she has a neighborhood store in her own home. She was able to increase her working capital with the loan and she is always thinking about investing in new businesses. Mrs. Beatriz is a very responsible person and she would like to do better. Mrs. MICAELA KARINA is the bank treasurer and she sells beauty products. With the loan she was able to buy her products that were on sale in bulk such as perfumes, deodorants, powders and others, to improve her income and increase her working capital. She is very responsible and she shows a great desire to do better.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INCREASE WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Mrs. Sothim Poa Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty members who are located in Liek village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sothim P. is the village bank president. She is 45 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are working in a garment factory and the other is studying at the local public school. Mrs. Sothim P. is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Vean Gneab, is a construction worker.

Although her husband tries to work hard, he still earn less income than needed to support the family so Mrs. Sothim P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a thousand kilograms of rice for eating.

loans.use: To buy a thousand kilograms of rice for consumption

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es:
