The six women of the Yiriwaso group are all married and on average 34 years old with 3 children. They live in monogamous households in Médine, one of the areas of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They are on their fourth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their constantly increasing clientele and to increase their sales. They run a range of businesses, which include among others the sale of shoes, oranges, potatoes, and children's clothing. With this loan, they intend to buy 50 pairs of shoes, 25 100-kg sacks of oranges, 10 100-kg bags of potatoes, and 18 children's outfits. They supply themselves at the grand market in the city of Sikasso and in Burkina Faso. Their merchandise is sold on-the-spot at the Sikasso grand market and often door-to-door to a clientele composed of women and men, in cash at retail and on credit. They foresee realizing an average monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA each, of which one portion will be used to pay for their children's education and health, and the remaining portion will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a range of items

loans.name: Cinthya Jakylin

texts.es:
Cynthia es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Cynthia es casada, tiene 22 años y 2 hijos, Cynthia vende gelatinas que prepara con la ayuda de su esposo, sus ventas los realiza en la puerta del hospital de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Cynthia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, gelatina.
Los sueños de Cynthia son tener una tienda de calzados y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Cynthia is a member of the Banco Comunal Maria Celeste. She is married, 22 years old, and has 2 sons. Cynthia sells jellies that she prepares with the help of her husband. She conducts her sales near the doorway of the Ayacucho city hospital, coming there every day to sell. Cynthia needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar and gelatin. Cynthia's dreams are to have a footwear store and to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de azúcar, gelatina.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar Ashiq Masih Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar baji is a very determined and responsible lady. She cares for her family a lot and never sees them in trouble. She tries to fulfill all the wishes of her three children with her embroidery business. She prepares embroidered dresses and sells to the clothes shops and earns income.

Her husband has a poultry business. He has three years of experience in this business. Parveen baji is applying for a loan to buy chicken feed for her husband’s poultry.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality:

Sonia baji wants a loan to buy bed sheets to sell.

Kalsoom akhtar baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

Parveen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for her husband's poultry business

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 47 years old and lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Khaled has been selling fruits and vegetables for over 23 years. He has requested a loan of US$700 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables for his work. This is the first time that Khaled has requested a loan.

Khaled is unique because he sells a wide variety of merchandise in his business. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he faced some funding obstacles but decided to proceed because he had a good reputation on which to build a business. He plans to improve his business further in future.

loans.use: Khaled will use the loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for his work.

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw O. is single with no dependent. He has received schooling through senior high.

Yaw sells and rents compact disks and video cassettes at Bla in Hohoe. Yaw will use the loan to buy more of the current foreign movies to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Yaw plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more of the current foreign movies and sell

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru: Каримов Аъзам является активным нашим клиентом. Он печет отличные лепешки. Даже соседи  приходят что бы купить у него пару вкусных лепешек. У него много клиентов.  Клиенты к нему приходят с тележками (арба) заполняют тележки лепешками и везут на рынок. Вечером они приносят получившую прибыль Аъзаму.  Ему нравиться его работа, он считает что хлеб всегда будут покупать и это является постоянным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Azam K. is our active client. He bakes excellent flatbread. Even his neighbors come by in order to buy a couple of delicious flatbreads from him. He has many customers. His customers come to him with carts (arba), fill the carts with flatbread and take them to the market. In the evenings, they bring resulting profits to Azam. Azam likes his work; he thinks that bread will always be in demand. This business is his only source of income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of several bags of flour

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive con su hijo Junior de 12 años, quien es el motor que impulsa su vida. Desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder mantenerse, el comercio ha significado para ella su principal fuente de manutención, y cuando llegó su pequeño hijo, hace 12 años, tuvo que optar por una labor que le permitiera estar más tiempo en su casa para cuidarlo y ayudarlo con sus tareas y educación. Es por eso que empezó a vender ropa a domicilio, labor que consiste en visitar las casas de sus amistades y vecinos para ofrecer las diferentes prendas que compra en uno de los centros comerciales más conocidos de Lima, esto en el centro de la ciudad. Susana vende a precios cómodos, es por ello que obtiene gran cantidad de clientela, además las prendas son de buena calidad, siendo un negocio muy rentable para ella. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado comprar 2 motocarros, los cuales alquila al día, obteniendo un ingreso extra por ello. Para un futuro cercano, a Susana le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa en su domicilio para no tener que caminar tanto. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y está muy feliz con su grupo solidario, ya que ha quedado  las socias más puntuales, y todas son buenas amigas. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de más prendas, para así incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Susana, 32, is a very happy woman. She lives with her 12 year old son, Junior. He is the motor that drives her life. Since she was very young she has worked to be able to support herself. Commerce has been her primary source of support. When her small son arrived 12 years ago, she had to choose work that would allow her to spend more time at home taking care of him and helping him with his homework and education. That is why she started to sell clothes at home. She visits the homes of her friends and neighbors to offer different articles of clothing that she buys in one of the most well known commercial centers in Lima, which is in the center of the city. Susana sells at low prices, and that is why she has a lot of customers. Through her work efforts she has been able to buy two “motocarros” (three wheeled motorized cart). She rents them out by the day, which gives her extra income. In the near future, Susana would like to have a clothing store in her house so that she would not have to walk so much. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is very happy with her supportive group. The members are very punctual, and they are all good friends. The money will be used to buy more clothes in order to increase her sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Vian John

texts.en:
Vian John Q. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old and married with 4 adult children. To make a living, Vian John provides motorcab services in the local community. Vian John has been in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Vian John joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase equipment and he plans to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase equipment.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia V., 58 years old, is married with 3 children. She lives in Sitio Magtalisay, Brgy. Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental.  Virginia strives hard to help increase her family's income. Her main objective is to save enough so that she and her husband can secure a good future for their children, and also to acquire some productive assets that can be used to help increase the family's income.

When Virginia went into the fish vending business 20 years ago, she knew that if she worked hard enough, she could achieve all her goals. The business earns her PHP 6,000 per month, and after her household expenses, she puts the rest back into the business so that she can slowly but surely expand her operations and income capacity.  

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 for her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon to add to her revolving working capital, because she plans to use the profits to renovate and repair the family home.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Francisca de 27 años de edad, vende ropa y zapatos desde hace tres años en el cual ha logrado tener una buena clientela vende al  crédito de quincena y al contado. Reside en el barrio Waspan Norte en la capital de Managua, junto con su esposo y un hijo de un año, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada y la apoya con todos los gastos. Ella inicio su negocio con ahorros que su compañero le dio y luego con préstamo que Afodenic dio el cual incremento su inventario. Con este préstamo comprara ropa variada para dama y caballeros y poder elevar las ventas. Espera obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su vivienda para dar a su hijo una vivienda digna. Agradece Afodenic por la oportunidad del financiamiento ya que obtendrá mejores utilidades.

loans.use: Comprar ropa variada para dama y caballeros

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba S. est marié à une  femme, père de 6 enfants, il est né le 31 Décembre 1974 à Kaï dans la commune rurale de  Loulouni, préfecture de Kadiolo, 3eme région administrative de la république du Mali.  Il vit avec son épouse et ses  enfants à Kaï dans un foyer monogame.
Il est commerçant  d’articles divers de boutique depuis plusieurs années  et fait  en plus, le commerce de céréales depuis 11 ans. Expérimenté en raison des années dans le commerce, Il les mène avec réussite.
Il est à sa deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt passé a été bien remboursé et il souhaite continuer avec l’institution pour pouvoir satisfaire ses clients. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, 5 paquets d’articles divers de boutiques(des fournitures d’écoliers) et 1 tonne de céréales (riz et haricot). Il s’approvisionne à Sikasso ville et au marché de Loulouni les jours de foire. Il vend au comptant ou à crédit, en gros et en détail, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il ambitionne  construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Sikasso.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers de boutique et de céréales.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la cuidad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 65 años, madre D. siete hijos, todos mayores D. edad. Anita se dedica a la venta D. menús (comida), este negocio lo realiza en su casa, ella da pensión a unos trabajadores D. construcción civil. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las  Ucayalinas” desD. hace cinco años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles, que fue utilizado para comprar abarrotes y vender, actividad que ya no realiza.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito D. 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos e insumos para la elaboración D. sus comidas, ya que ella cobra semanalmente a sus comensales (clientes). La meta D.  Ana María es tener un restaurante bien implementado.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 65 years old and the mother of seven children, all of whom are adults. Anita sells “menú” (plates of food) for a living. She works out her home and pays a salary to a few to a few civil construction workers. She has been part of the comunal bank “Las Ucayalinas” for five years. Her first loan was for 300 soles with which she bought groceries to sell. She is no longer in that business. Isabel now needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy products and supplies to make her meals, since she charges her clients on a weekly basis. Ana María’s goal is to have a well established restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare meals

loans.name: Moul

texts.en: Moul K., 40, is married with four school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she sells fish and vegetables at the market, earning approximately US $5 per day. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Her husband is a middleman, buying cows from the local farmers in the village and selling them to the markets in town, earning an income of US $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Mrs. K. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, K. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase cows, fish, and vegetables to expand the current business.

loans.use: To buy cows, fish and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: Mariposas fue fundado el 22 D. julio del 2009, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir en un negocio  .Se encuentra situado en el B/ 1ro D. Agosto D. la Zona D. La Colorada. El grupo  esta en su 2do ciclo, compuesto por 15 personas, como Presidenta tenemos a la señora: Lucinda, Tesorera: Mary Luz  y como secretaria: Clara. En el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta D. bijouteria, comida, promotoras D. cosmeticos, venta D. pastillas y refresco D. mocochinchi,  venta D. horneados y panaderia, que son actividades que nesecitan creditos rapidos. Las Señoras estan muy contentas D. trabajar con Emprender, porque aprendieron ahorrar y tener mucha responsabilidad, respeto y al mismo tiempo compartir con sus amigas y vecinas cada quincena. 
La Sra.Lucinda es Presidenta del grupo, es la segunda vez que esta como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento MARIPOSAS. La Sra. nacio en Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. Ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes al credito que distribuye entre sus vecinos del barrio y D. otros barrios cercanos,  atienD. a sus dos hijos, es una persona amigable y muy dinamica, ademas D. ello es una persona cumplida y responsable en el grupo es por eso que la han elegido como presidente y las reuniones se realizan en su casa.Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas. Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su hogar.			
La Sra. MAry Luz, es socia antigua del Banco D. Emprendimiento MARIPOSAS. Se dedica a la panaderia, cocina y además es promotora D. cosmeticos por catalogo. Todos los dias se levanta a las 3:00 am para hornear el pan que venD. hasta las 7:00 am, luego sigue con sus actividades D. cocina y en su tiemnpo libre visita a sus amigas para ofrecer sus cosmeticos. Hace 6 años que se dedica a la panaderia,  tambien realiza labores D. casa. Ella es muy responsable dentro del grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender es importante para ella. Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su familia, las socias del grupo la consideran responsable y cumplida en el grupo. Ella es unas D. las fundadoras del grupo.			
La Sra. Balbina,  es socia del BE MARIPOSAS, se dedica a la venta D. ropa a credito, ropa para mujeres, niños y varones, la misma que distrubuye a sus clientes en diferentes empresas y entre sus conocidos del barrio, se ocupa D. esta actividad desD. las14:00 hasta las 22:00,  ella nacio el 30 D. marzo D. 1977 en la provincia Cordillera D. Santa Cruz, hace 2 años que se dedica a este rubro  su trabajo mayormente es atender los pedidos D. ropa que le hacen. La Sra es fundadora en el grupo  y la  oportunidad que le brinda el Banco D. Emprendimiento Mariposas es muy importante para ella.
texts.en:
The Mariposas communal bank was founded on 22 July 2009 by initiative of a group of women who hA. small businesses and want to grow in their business. It is located in the 1ro D. Agosto neighborhood in the La Colorada zone. The group is in its second cycle, maD. up of 15 persons. As group president we hA. Lucinda. Mary Luz is treasurer. Clara is secretary. In the group are some women who sell costume jewelry, prepared meals, cosmetics, mocochinchi (A popular drink in Bolivia maD. form cooked dehydrated peaches), bread and pastry making. These activities require quick financing. The women are very happy to work with Emprender because they learn how to sA. and to be very responsible and respectful as well as sharing with their fellow members and neighbors every two weeks. This is Lucinda’s second term as president. She was born in Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. She sells groceries on credit among her neighbors and in adjacent neighborhoods. She cares for her two children, is a dynamic and friendly person. Besides, she is a responsible and polite person and this is why she was reelected group president. Group meetings are held in her house. She is one of the group leaders and sees that the other members meet their obligations. Her earnings help to support her household. Mary Luz is a long-standing member of the Mariposas communal bank. She is a baker, cook and sells catalogue cosmetics. Every day she rises at 3am to bake bread until 7am. Then, she continues with her cooking and, in her free time, visits her friends to offer her cosmetics. She has had the bakery for 6 years; she also does all the household chores. She is very responsible in the group and the opportunity that Emprender offers her is very important to her. The earnings she makes help to support her family. Her fellow members consider her to be responsible and polite. She is one of the group founders. Balbina is a member of the Mariposas communal bank. She sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothing on credit which she distributes to her customers in various companies and among her acquaintances in the neighborhood. She works at this from 1400 until 2200 hours. She was born on 30 March 1977 in the Cordillera D. Santa Cruz province. She has been in this line of work for 2 years. Her work, for the most part, consists in filling clothing orders for her customers. She is a group founding member and the opportunity that the Mariposas communal bank offers her is very important to her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capitals and merchandise.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: K. Jeanne est née en 1968 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Jeanne vit depuis une dizaine d’année à Minonkpo à Cotonou. Mariée à VIHO Simplice, un soudeur, Jeanne est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Jeanne a un autre enfant à charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Jeanne n’a pas été à l’école ; elle vend de la nourriture (riz, haricot accompagné de sauce et de friture, etc.) devant sa maison. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Jeanne fait ses achats. Jeanne rembourse bien ses crédits. Dans l’optique de développer plus son activité et de mieux satisfaire ses clients, Jeanne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jeanne K. was born in Cotonou, the economic capitol of Bénin, in 1968. For the past ten years Jeanne has lived in Minonkpo at Cotonou. Married to Simplice Viho, a welder, Jeanne is the mother of four children who are all sent to school. Jeanne has one other child in her care. Jeanne lives with her children and her husband. The couple shares the family expenses. Jeanne did not go to school; she sells food (rice, beans with sauce and fried food, etc.) in front of her house. Jeanne does her shopping at Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Jeanne repays her loans. In order to further grow her business and better satisfy her customers, Jeanne is requesting another loan through ALIDé.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food supplies (bags of rice and beans), sauce condiments and peanut oil.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 33 years old and her husband is an engineer. They are blessed with four children.

Joy owns a beauty accessories shop where she sells hair extensions, beauty cream, hair cream and cosmetics. Her expectation is to see her business progress and attract more customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more beauty accessories to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Joy is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty accessories to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta S. lives in Sto.Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 60 years old, married and has one grown child. To make a living, she makes and sells food, mostly bread, salted fish and other items. She has been in business for more than 13 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Vicenta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, which she used to buy supplies to make more food. She is applying for a new loan, for 15,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve her living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is a leading cooperative in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr Mario es soltero vive en casa propia en el barrio Kennedy en la ciudad de Caacupe, desde muy joven emprendió su micro empresa de venta de sus mercaderías en forma ambulante ( compra ventas de ropas y zapatos deportivo), cuenta con clientela bien formada, solicita un crédito a la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva, para poder sastifacer la demanda de su clientela para tener todo activo y así generar mas ingresos a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Señor Mario is single living in his own house in the neighborhood Kennedy, in the city of Cacupe, where since he was young he started his own business selling goods by traveling (selling clothes and sports shoes). With his well-formed client base, he is asking for a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya, an affiliate of Kiva, in order to satisfy the demand of his clientele to have everything active, and in order to gain more income for his family unit.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy athletic clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hija en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo desde hace más de cinco años, ella nos cuenta que empezó en esta actividad porque le gusta siempre mantenerse activa y porque así puede apoyar a la economía de su familia. Isabel siempre se encuentra buscando nuevos clientes y ahora es muy conocida en la zona.

Isabel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de belleza con los cuales pueda tener un stock permanente que ofrecer a sus clientes. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Isabel es conocida por su buen carácter y su honradez. Esta es la segunda vez que trabaja con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Isabel is a mother of 50 years old. She lives with her husband and their youngest daughter in the district of Cayaltí, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. She sells beauty products and has for more than five years. She told us that she began with this activity because she likes to always be active and because in this way she can support her family economically. Isabel is always finding new clients and is well known in the area. Isabel wishes to increase her business with the purchase of more beauty products with which she can keep as a permanent stock to offer to her clients. This is why she is seeking from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles that will help her to achieve her objective. Isabel is known for her good character and her honesty. This is the second time that she has worked with Edpyme Alternative and has demonstrated herself to be a punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products to increase her businbess

loans.name: Nancy Jepkorir

texts.en:
Nancy is a 29-year-old woman who is married to Albert Kibet and they are blessed with two children.

Nancy farms in Eldoret and has been farming for the last six years. Besides farming she sells vegetables and milk to her neighbors. She also supplies milk to one of the biggest suppliers of milk in Kenya called the new KCC (Kenya Cooperative Creameries).

Nancy was introduced to KADET by an employee of KADET and she has applied for a loan which she will use for her farming activities. This includes paying for the hire of a tractor which helps her to plow faster and also to buy maize seedlings for planting. 

Nancy’s goal is to become a popular and prosperous farmer in Eldoret.

loans.use: To hire a tractor to plow and to buy seedlings to plant

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeun Non and her husband, Mr. Sorn Chhin, live along National Road Number Five, about 18 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. They have been married since 1993 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. Thoeun sells fruit in front of a factory. Her husband has been a hairdresser since he was young. In addition, he also grows rice in the village. The road on which their house is located is too small and carries very heavy traffic. Thoeun has applied for a loan for $500 to move the building farther away from the road.

loans.use: To move her house away from a road that is small and very busy.

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
Renilda O. is from the village of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Renilda has a business butchering and selling pork in the market. She has been in this business for over 16 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Renilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Renilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more electrical accessories and  stationery to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children and is the sole income provider for his family. He has been running a bakery since 1995. Throughout Lebanon it is common to find small bakeries with delicious bread, pastries, and “manouche”, a type of Lebanese pizza. The borrower is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to invest in a new machine for mixing dough. This will be his first loan from Ameen. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in a new dough mixing machine.

loans.name: Djekabaara Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Djekabaara sont mariées majoritairement dans des foyers monogames avec en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché Château de Ségou. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers avec la préparation et vente des jus, la vente de céréales, de produits cosmétiques, de tissus etc.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et pérenniser leurs activités génératrices de revenus, elles décidèrent de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Connue sous le nom de Oumou  la Glace à Hamdallaye, Madame Oumou S. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des ingrédients pour la préparation des jus de gingembre et d’oseille de Guinée : 10kg de gingembre, 3kg de feuilles d’oseille, un carton d’essence et un sac de sucre. 
Pour préparer un jus, elle broie le gingembre et le laisse au repos pendant quelques heures, elle recueille cette décoction par filtrage avec un tamis à maillon faible, elle rajoute à cette dernière du sucre, de l’eau et des essences en fonction du goût de sa clientèle. Ce mélange obtenu est ensuite repartis dans des plastiques et mis au frais. Mais quand c’est l’oseille, elle est d’abord bouillie pendant 2 heures au moins avant de suivre les autres processus de transformation. 
Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou et revend ses jus en détail à domicile et au marché Château de Ségou à une clientèle composée de femmes, d’hommes et d’enfants, au comptant et à crédit. 
Madame Oumou S. compte réaliser un bénéfice de 27 500FCFA par mois en moyenne qui sera utilisé pour être épargné, payer les fournitures et les frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of group Djekabaara are predominantly married in monogamous families with an average age of 35 years and 3 children. They all live in in the Hamdallay community of Segou town( 4th administravtive region of Mali) and they know each other through their income generating businesses at the Chateau market of Segou. This group of women trade in various items, preparing and selling juice, selling grains, cosmetic products,fabrics etc. With the aim of increasing their business and making durable their income generating activities, they decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second cycle group loan. Known by the name Oumou la Glace at Hamdallaye, Madame Oumou S. intend to use her loan to buy some ingredients for the preparation of ginger juice and sorrel (drink ) of Guinea: 10kg of ginger, 3kg of sorrel leaves, a carton of essential oil and a bag of sugar. To prepare some juice, she grinds ginger and allow it to stay for several hours. She then collects this brew by filtration with a weak sieve link. She adds some sugar, water and some oil to it according to the taste of her client. This mixture obtained is distributed in plastic and allow to cool. But, with sorrel drink, it is first of all boiled for at least 2 hours before following the other processes of conversion. She gets her supplies on the spot at Segou and sells her juice at retail at home and in the Chateau market of Segou to a clientele composed of women, men and children for cash and credit. Madam Oumou S. intends to make an average profit of 27 500FCFA each month which will be used for saving and to pay for provisions and the school fees of her children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for preparing juice

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita B. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Poblacion, Damulog, Bukidnon. Anita has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Anita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Virgette

texts.en:
Virgette A. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Virgette is single and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Virgette owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of used-clothing (ukay-ukay), and also buying and selling ready-to-wear products in the local community. Virgette has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virgette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Virgette is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virgette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Loraida

texts.en:
Loraida G. is from the town of Dumabel Aglipay Quirino. She is 39 years old. Loraida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Loraida owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food such as peanuts, banana chips and pastillas, or milk candies. Loraida has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Loraida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Loraida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Loraida is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Loraida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nyakabungo Traders United, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
Kaguna A., 36 years old, with a family of 6, has been operating a repair and spare parts store for bicycles and motorcycles in Burambira, Rukungiri for 5 years. With his determination and hard work, he has been able to earn 200,000 UGX on a monthly basis, which he uses to meet his family's daily requirements including buying food and paying tuition fees.

For a long time, A.'s motive has been to set up a spare parts shop as there is a ready market available. This would help him advance his mechanics job and earn more profit since he would have fewer expenses, such as purchasing machines from other people. Therefore, with this loan, A. hopes to buy spokes, sprockets, tires, chains, realms, frames and so on for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical items and spare parts

loans.name: Chynygul's Group

texts.en:
Chynygul M., leader of the group, is 24 and single. She works as an accountant at village administration. She needs a cell phone in order to communicate with her colleagues and relatives who are in different parts of Kyrgyzstan and outside of Kyrgyzstan. Unfortunately, she is not able to buy a cell phone due to absence of money. Therefore, she applied for a loan to buy a cell phone.

Group members: Nargiza A. is treasurer of the group. She is 24 and single. Like Chynygul, she works at village administration. She also needs a cell phone. She applied for a loan in order to buy a cell phone which will move her to a new level of communication with her relatives, friends, and colleagues. As she receives her wages, she will gradually repay her loan.

Kanatbek M. is 28 and married. He has two children, a four-year-old daughter and a two-year-old son. His wife is a housewife. Two years ago, he decided to start cattle breeding with an initial investment of 2,000 soms. For now, he receives 1,500 soms monthly, but he plans to increase the number of cattle and, as a result, increase profits from cattle breeding. Also, cattle breeding helped him to buy his car, a Daewoo Tico. In order to increase the number of cattle, he needs to buy more heads of cattle. Unfortunately, he doesn’t have enough funds. Thus, he is applying for a loan. With the profit from cattle breeding, he plans to increase the number of cattle.

Gulhan T. is 58 and married. She has five children. Her sons are 33 and 26, and her daughters are 37, 36, and 29. Her daughters are married and live independently. Her first son is a teacher at a college, and her second son is in Russia. Her husband is a pensioner, while she breeds cattle with the help of her first son. Six years ago she decided to buy a cow because, in her opinion, it was safer than just holding money. After that, she decided to breed cattle. Now, they have 25 heads of cattle, which they will fatten and sell. With the profit from cattle breeding, she could buy a car for her son and make capital repairs to her house. Starting her business with 2,000 soms, she now makes 20,000 soms monthly. She is applying for a loan in order to buy two goats, fatten them, and resell them in the future at a higher price. With the profit from cattle breeding, she plans to buy a truck for transportation of cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstanat http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Florence has a cosmetics store.  She has been in this business for five years, and works six days a week. Florence sells her products in a retail shop. Florence has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of creams and relaxer braids. The main business challenges for Florence include the rainy season and transportation of boxes of cosmetics from Kikuubo in the city of Kampala to her shop in Nakulabye. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked cosmetics shop and a bridal salon. Florence lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics and braids

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man with one baby girl. He lives with his family in Lebanon.

He has been running a shoe store for the past five years in his town and is the main income provider for his wife and daughter. He offers women’s and children’s shoes in his store and his shop is well-known by his customers because his prices are lower.

Today, he is requesting $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand his store’s inventory and to diversify his merchandise selection. In the future, he is hoping to expand his business and sell men’s shoes as well.

loans.use: to expand his store’s inventory and diversify his merchandise selection

loans.name: Liela

texts.en:
Leila V. is thirty years old and is married; her husband is a business man. She has eight children and they all go to school.

Leila currently runs a small business selling fish, onions and tomatoes. She is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to stock clothes to sell as well.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence F. sells secondhand clothes in Abura. Florence has received senior high school education. She is divorced and has three children. Florence has been selling secondhand clothes and is also a seamstress. She is responsible for paying for accommodation and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more secondhand clothes for sale and sewing supplies to do her sewing work. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in the education of her children.

The picture displays some of her secondhand clothes and shows Florence doing her sewing work.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand cloths and sewing supplies

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen, de 22 años, es una mujer luchadora, ella cuida de su pequeña hija Nicol, de 3 años, quien es su razón de vivir. Ambas viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). Como madre soltera, Karen se las ingenia para salir adelante; ella realiza una variedad de actividades. En las mañanas, trabaja en un banco muy reconocido en todo el país. También los fines de semana, vende CD y, DVDs; de películas en las ferias dominicales de la zona, también alquila a algunas personas que lo solicitan; la demanda es mucha ya que los días libres las personas gustan mucho de ver una película nueva o recién estrenada. Paralelamente a ello Karen, estudia periodismo en un reconocido instituto “a pesar de mis múltiples responsabilidades, deseo ser profesional”, afirma. Por ello desea comprar una computadora, para que le facilité su trabajo, de la misma manera quiere abrir un local comercial, para poder vender los CD y, DVDs, todos los días, con la ayuda de personales de servicio. Karen, agradece el apoyo de MFP. Ya es el cuarto crédito que tiene y agradece el apoyo de su banco comunal, pues lo integran personas honestas y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá obtener más CD Y DVDs, de diferentes películas, con las que podrá surtir su negocio.
texts.en: 22-year-old Karen is a fighter. She is raising her little 3-year-old daughter Nicol, who is her reason for living. They both live in a rented home in the city of La Merced (Peruvian central jungle). As a single mother, Karen manages to get ahead undertaking a variety of activities. In the mornings, she works in a bank that is well-known throughout the country. On the weekends, she also sells CDs and DVDs of movies at the Sunday fairs in the area. She also rents them to a few people that request that. There is high demand, since people really enjoy watching a new movie, or one that has recently come out. Additionally, Karen is studying journalism in a recognized institute. “Despite my multiple responsibilities, I want to be a professional,” she affirms. Therefore, she wishes to buy a computer to facilitate her work. She also wants to open up a store to sell her CDs and DVDs every day, with the help of service personnel. Karen is thankful for the support of MFP. This is already her 4th loan, and she is thankful for the support of the communal bank, made up of honest and caring people. With the requested loan, she will be able to buy more CDs and DVDs of various movies to stock-up her business.

loans.use: To acquire more DVD movies to stock her business.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola tiene 50 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 10 años, Lola se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, es así que viene  recorriendo las calles de su distrito, ofreciendo estos productos por medio de catálogos a sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio, quienes la conocen. Es así que pasada del medio día empieza con las cobranzas de sus clientes, por lo que tiene que caminar de casa en casa, además aprovecha para realizar algún otro pedido.  Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que tiene clientes muy responsables en sus pagos, esto hace que su negocio sea muy rentable, por lo que trabaja con mucho motivación, tratando de vender mucho más cada día. Con el tiempo, desea tener un negocio de venta de anticuchos, de esa manera se generaría más ganancias. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete  pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente,  ya que le gustaría acceder a otras ayudas. De su banco comunal tiene buenas referencias y espera integrarse al grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos de belleza, para abastecer todos los pedidos por entregar.
texts.en:
Lola is 50 years old. She lives in her own house, along with her husband and 3 children. For the past 10 years, Lola has been selling beauty products. She offers these products through catalogs to her friends and neighbors who know her. 

A little after noon everyday, she begins collecting payments from her customers; to do this, she goes door to door. She also uses this time to get more orders. What she likes most about her business is that she has customers who are very responsible with their payments. This makes her business very profitable, so she is very motivated and tries to sell as much as possible every day. Eventually, she hopes to have a business selling antichuchos [shish kebabs of beef heart], so that she can increase her income. 

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she promises to make her payments punctually, as she would like to have other loans. She has good references from her communal bank and she hopes to join the group. With the loan, she will buy more beauty products so that she can fill all of the orders she has.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie V. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 34 years old. Jennie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as spices, beverages and vegetables like cabbage and tomatoes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jennie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Jennie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables like squash and eggplants. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables like squash and eggplants

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista, de 50 años, vive en su casa propia sola, pues sus hijos ya tienen sus propias familias y la visitan de vez en cuando. Desde hace 4 años esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado de la zona donde vive. Cada día se despierta muy temprano para empezar a cocinar pues debe tener listos, al mediodía, 30 platillos que ofrece a sus habituales comensales; y le gusta mucho su labor pues le entretiene y le genera regulares ganancias que le permiten vivir cómodamente. Lo que no le agrada es que cuando brinda los platillos a crédito algunos comensales se atrasan en el pago puntual y esto retarda un poco sus ganancias. Vende sus platillos desde las 12 hasta las 2 de la tarde y ya en la tarde descansa de su labor. Y como tiene muchos planes, para el futuro tiene el anhelo de instalar un restaurante en su zona, donde ofrecerá sus mejores platillos, de esta manera espera seguir progresando. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Evarista tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes, al por mayor, que le hacen falta para continuar preparando sus platillos en mayor cantidad, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en: Evarista is 50 years old and lives alone in her own home, as her children now have their own families and they come to visit from time to time.  For the last 4 years this enterprising woman has sold food in a local market.  Every day she wakes up very early to start cooking, for by noon she must have available 30 meals, which she offers to her regular diners.  She likes her work a lot, for it keeps her busy and generates regular earnings, which allow her to live comfortably.  What she doesn’t like is that when she offers meals on credit, some diners fall behind in paying punctually, and this slows down her revenue.  She sells her meals from 12 noon to 2 in the afternoon, and then rests from her work.  She has many plans, such as for the future she would like to set up a restaurant in the area, where she will offer her best meals.  She hopes thereby to continue to grow.  This is the second loan she will have with MFP, and she promises to pay the installments promptly, for she is very grateful to all those who have made this support possible, which will enable her to keep working and moving forward.  Evarista plans to use the requested loan to buy wholesale the commodities needed to continue preparing her meals in larger quantities.  She thus hopes to keep on making progress.

loans.use: To buy commodities wholesale, and avoid problems when preparing her meals

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim S. is a 54-year-old widower and is blessed with seven children; three are single and four are married. Tim S. is a domestic construction foreman, who has employees to help provide his service. Recently, Tim S. has been very busy at his business with clients who need him to build their houses. Tim S. could earn an income average of US$2.8 per day. Tim S. has a son who is working at a private company. His son has to hire a motor taxi when he goes to work. To save the traveling expense, Tim S. is asking from a loan from Kiva for his son to buy a second familymotorcycle to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a second motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem S., 35, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia- an area known for rubber plantations. S. is a farmer, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Her husband is a goldsmith, earning an income of 2.50 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 49 USD on food and 10 USD on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase pig feed and pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: buy pig feed and pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
MeS. is a single woman who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a boutique shop, selling retail to her neighbouring community.  MeS. faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She hopes to establish real estate agency in the future.

With the  20,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase ladies dresses and Kikoi's for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase ladies dresses and Kikoi's for resale

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel F. T. es padre de familia que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos a los que desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Con este préstamo será el tercero que tramita en esta institución; el cual ha demostrado tener una cultura de pago muy buena. Con los créditos anteriores el levanto la barda de enfrente este nuevo desea instalar protecciones y un portor para obstruir el paso a personas desconocidas y así su familia mejor protegida.
texts.en:
Miguel F. T. is a father who is conceded about the wellbeing of his children and wants to offer them a better quality of life.  This loan will the his third with the institution; he has shown good repayment habits.

He used prior loans to erect a front wall and wants this one to install safety devices and a front gate to obstruct passage of unknown people thus having his family better protected.

loans.use: To install safety devices.

loans.name: Arcoiris Palmira Group

texts.es: Este foto fue tomada en el negocio de la señora Sofia H., un integrante del grupo "Arcoiris Palmira" que esta ubicado en el estado de veracruz, se puede observar al grupo alrededor de la mercancia, la señora Sofía se dedica al alquiler de peliculas que inicio hace 10 años, solicita el prestamo para renovar su mercancia, al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente contenta ya que podrá invertir más en su negocio, tiene 59 años, estudio la primaria, es casada y tiene 2 hijos; quiere este crédito para renovar su mercancia, tembién espera hacer crecer más su negocio. Esther es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 54 años, estudio hasta la secundaria y es viuda, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercancia y así poder incrementar sus ventas, con el fin de tener una estabilidad economica ya que ella sola mantiene a sus hijos y para ella es indispensable ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
This picture was taken in Señora Sofia H.'s business who is a member of the "Arcoiris Palmira" group, located in the state of Veracruz. The group is seated around the merchandise. Señora Sofia works renting movies, a business she started 10 years ago, and is asking for the loan to renovate her merchandise. Since asking for the loan she feels happy that she can invest more in her business. She is 59 years old, has a middle school education, and is married with two children. She is asking for the loan to renovate her merchandise, and also hopes to grow her business. 

Esther is the president of the group, is 54 years old, studied until middle school, and is a widow. Three years ago she began her business selling clothes. She is asking for the loan to purchase merchandise and to improve her sales with the goal of having economic stability, since she supports her children alone. She thinks it is essential to offer them a better quality of life and a professional career.

loans.use: To improve the business and increase profits

loans.name: Weymer Omar

texts.es:
Weymer de 40 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene un expreso escolar. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su expreso ya que le ayuda a mantener a su familia. 

Trabaja todos los días haciendo expreso escolar desde la mañana hasta la noche. Trabajaba haciéndoles expresos a sus vecinas pero como ya comenzaba la época escolar decidió hacer expreso a los niños de una escuela. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su carro por eso quiere el préstamo para darle mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Weymer is 40 years old and a hard-working man who operates an express school bus.  He has many aspirations for his express bus because it helps him support his family.

He works every day transporting students from the morning until night.  He used to make express bus runs for his neighbors, but since the school year started, he decided to operate an express service for children going to school.  

He has many aspirations for his van, so he is asking for this loan to do maintenance on it.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his van.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
A married parent of four children, Marcelina works hard to support her family.

She has a water refilling business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Marcelina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase refill bottles for her water refilling business.

Marcelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to support her grandchildren in school.

loans.use: to purchase bottles for her water refilling business

loans.name: Vasilina

texts.en:
Vasilina A. is divorced with three children. She lives in Uzhgorod, Ukraine. Vasilina sells souvenirs in one of the local markets called “RIO.” She owns two stores there and has been in this business for ten years. Vasilina has her own loyal clientele who value her quality merchandise and always come back looking for something new and unique. Currently, Vasilina receives 6,000 UAH of net profit a month.

Vasilina is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase a variety of authentic Ukrainian souvenirs for the upcoming tourist season. She is hoping to offer a large range of souvenirs and gift items to potential customers, thus generating additional income for herself and her children whom she is raising alone.

loans.use: To purchase assorted souvenirs

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania se dedica a la venta y destace de cerdo, siempre ha sido una persona muy luchadora por lo que disfruta de su actividad. Ella tiene a sus hijos que mantener por lo que siempre está pendiente de proporcionarles lo necesario.  Este financiamiento es para la compra de cerdos ya que tiene ciertas ofertas muy favorables. Melania sabe que sus clientes llegan a buscar los productos que ofrece pues son de muy buena calidad.
texts.en: Melania makes her living buying and selling pigs, and is a hardworking person who enjoys her business. She cares for her children and makes sure that her family has all they need.  This credit will be used to buy more pigs, and she already has several very profitable options. Melania knows her client base and offers them the best quality service possible.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 53 years old. 

Catalina has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Catalina requested an 18,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linen, thread, etc. to sew. 

Catalina has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Catalina would like to save enough to buy farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linen and thread

loans.name: Griselda Raquel

texts.es:
Griselda tiene 25 años es soltera, no tiene carga familiar directa y vive en la casa de sus padres, en una comunidad rural llamada Pueblo Nuevo ubicado en el distrito de Chepen.

Ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de ropa en uno de los mercados de su localidad. Griselda adquiere sus productos en la ciudad de Lima y los comercializa entre el público que diariamente acude a este mercado de abastos. El negocio tiene un poco tiempo de haber sido inaugurado. Las prendas que vende son para todo público y actualmente ella quiere fidelizar a sus clientes ofreciéndoles variedad en sus productos.  

Griselda desea realizar un incremento en su mercadería debido al cambio de temporada. Por ese motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales comprará diversas prendas como jeans, blusas, conjuntos para niños, entre otros, atendiendo a las solicitudes de sus clientes ya que existe una alta demanda de estos  productos.

Griselda se ha propuesto invertir en mostrar una mayor calidad de prendas puesto que es la única que vende prendas novedosas y de calidad  en el mercado.
texts.en:
Griselda tiene 25 años es soltera, no tiene carga familiar directa y vive en la casa de sus padres, en una comunidad rural llamada Pueblo Nuevo ubicado en el distrito de Chepen.

Ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de ropa en uno de los mercados de su localidad. Griselda adquiere sus productos en la ciudad de Lima y los comercializa entre el público que diariamente acude a este mercado de abastos. El negocio tiene un poco tiempo de haber sido inaugurado. Las prendas que vende son para todo público y actualmente ella quiere fidelizar a sus clientes ofreciéndoles variedad en sus productos.  

Griselda desea realizar un incremento en su mercadería debido al cambio de temporada. Por ese motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales comprará diversas prendas como jeans, blusas, conjuntos para niños, entre otros, atendiendo a las solicitudes de sus clientes ya que existe una alta demanda de estos  productos.

Griselda se ha propuesto invertir en mostrar una mayor calidad de prendas puesto que es la única que vende prendas novedosas y de calidad  en el mercado.

loans.use: Comprar mercadería novedosa  para su negocio.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine, age 35, runs a tailoring business in Bamburi, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last two years. Josphine is an existing  KADET client, and this is the second loan she has accessed to help finance her business. 

With this loan, she plans to purchase a sewing machine and cloth. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to help support her family her family. 

Her dream is to own a boutique in future.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Sandra Devotha

texts.en: Sandra Devotha is 24 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 5 years and 5 months old. Her husband is a driver. Sandra Devotha sells secondhand clothes and baskets. She started with just a few baskets, but now she sells many of them. It's been 8 months since the business started. Sandra Devotha needs a loan to buy more baskets and make more profits. She will buy a piece of land with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy baskets for sale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina es natural D. la ciudad D. Quimbiri, tiene 51 años, es una mujer viuda que lucha por el mejor bienestar D. sus 02 queridos hijos a quienes les brinda un techo donD. pasan con tranquilidad sus días. Sus años no son impedimento para seguir luchando por el mejor bienestar D. sus hijos y D. si misma. Sabina es una mujer D. negocios y con muchas ganas D. seguir trabajando, se dedica al negocio D. verduras donD. ofrece variedad D. hortalizas como lechugas, ajos, apios, zanahorias. Su puesto D. ventas esta situado en el mercado del distrito D. Quimbiri donD. Viene trabajando 25 años continuos. Anteriormente vendía sus productos D. manera ambulante; desD. que la Municipalidad del distrito D. Quimbiri concluyó con la construcción del  mercado modelo gracias a ello  sabina y muchos comerciantes más hoy en día  ofrecen su mercadería cumpliendo con el reglamento D. las ordenanzas municipales. La venta D. verduras le genera buenas ganancias porque gracias a ello concluyo con el asfaltado D. su terreno. Pero el gasto D. educación D. sus hijos es mas granD., razón por la cual acuD. a los prestamos para que pueda implementar su negocio comprando variedad D. verduras. Su plan a futuro es comprar otro puesto donD. pueda vender productos D. primera necesidad y así depender D. dos ingresos. Este será su sexto crédito por lo cual esta agradecida a los financistas por apoyarla a seguir progresando, esta vez espera contar con el apoyo D. ustedes para  seguir avanzando y por enD. se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará variedad D. verduras.
texts.en:
Sabina is from the city of Quimbiri.  She is 51 years old.  She is a widow who struggles for the well being of her 2 dear children for whom she provides a roof where they quietly spend their days. Over the years she continues to fight for the best welfare of her children and herself.

Sabina is a business woman and eager to continue working.  She works in the vegetable business where she offers a variety of produce such as lettuce, garlic, celery, and carrots.  Her selling post is located in the Quimbiri market where she has worked for 25 years.  Previously she would sell her products door to door.  

Since the Municipality in the Quimbiri district finished construction of the market, Sabina and many other merchants nowadays offer their goods in compliance with the regulation of municipal ordinances.

The sale of vegetables generates good earnings thanks to them asphalting the land.  However, the expense of her children's education is very large and the reason why she has turned to the loans so that she can buy vegetables for her business. Her future plan is to buy another post where she can sell staple products and thus rely on two incomes. 

This will be her 6th loan and she is pleased to have the financing to help her continue progressing.  This time she hopes to get the support of you guys to continue advancing and therefore she agrees to pay her dues on time.  With the 1,000 soles she will buy a variety of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
La Sra. Ceferina es viuda tiene un hijo ya mayor de edad que trabaja como mecánico, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante. 
Ella comenta que por medio de sus ventas puede generar los ingresos que necesita para la manutención de la casa. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que por medio de su sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante, uno de sus máximos sueños es poder tener un local donde poder exponer o exhibir las ropas que vende.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de invierno, pues está recibiendo mucha demanda de ese tipo de ropas. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Ceferina is a widow.  She has an adult son who works as a mechanic.  She is a clothing vendor.

She comments that her sales make it possible for her to generate income that she needs to support her household.  She defines herself as a very hard working, tenacious woman who through her sacrifice has managed to get ahead.  One of her greatest dreams is to be able to have a locale where she can display the clothes she sells.

She is asking for the loan to buy winter clothes because she’s getting a lot of demand for this type of clothes.  She is very hopeful about the loan because it will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Voun

texts.en: Voun is an electrical mechanic and sometimes he offers a motor taxi service when he can not get any electronics to fix. His income is $6 per day. He is staying with his parent and other three siblings. Every month, he has to support his family with $100 for other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a new motorbike for traveling to fix electronics and for doing his motor taxi service. In the future, he hopes to have enough money to start a small business selling electronic equipment. He wants to help his brothers and sister to study in the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a twenty-seven year-old married woman with three children.  She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling shoes for nine years. She started with capital of 30,000 shillings, selling from a friend's stall, but now has her own shop with stock worth two million. Her challenge is high licensing fees.  Her vision is to open another boutique and to educate her children.  Aisha intends to use the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: G.s. Guisquiliapa Group

texts.es: La señora Aura Lila tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera con un niño de tres años, ella habita en Guisquiliapa. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, nacatamales y productos derivados del maíz, tienen 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual dio inicio debido a que mi mama me impulso a generar nuestros propios ingresos desde pequeña, ella nos enseño a hacer las tortillas, además que antes salían a venderlas. Otro integrante del grupo es doña Dora Elizabeth la cual tiene 24 años de edad, es casada, Ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, además vende frijoles cocidos y demás productos derivados de maíz como tortilla dulce, etc. Ella inicio el negocio ante la falta de empleo que aqueja el país, por lo que tuvo que buscar una forma de generar ingresos propios para el sostenimiento del hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra de maíz, bolsas, cal, comal entre otros. La señora Guadalupe del Socorro también pertenece al grupo, la cual  tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor cultivando unas tierras de su propiedad. Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo a su negocio que es la venta de nacatamales, tortillas, manuelitas, etc. Ella sale a vender de manera ambulante sus productos, aunque las personas que ya la conocen le solicitan le envié tortillas diariamente.
texts.en:
22-year-old Aura Lila is a single mother who has a three-year-old son.  She lives in Guisquiliapa.  Aura Lila makes tortillas, nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and corn-based products.  She has been in this business for five years and started out in the business because her mother pushed her to make her own income from a young age.  Her mother taught her how to make tortillas and, before that, she used to go out and sell them.

Another member of this group is Dora Elizabeth who is 24 years old and married.  Her business is making tortillas.  She also sells baked beans and  other corn-based products such as 'tortilla dulce' (sweet tortillas) etc.  She started her business because of the lack of work that plagues her country.  She had to find a way of making her own income in order to support her household.  Her loan will be used to buy corn, bags, lime and a 'comal' (pan for making tortillas), etc.

Guadalupe del Socorro also belongs to the group.  She is 45 years old, married, and has five grown-up children.  Her husband works as a farmer, growing crops on some land that he owns.  She is requesting this loan to invest in her business selling nacatamales, tortillas, 'manuelitas' (typical Nicaraguan food), etc.  She goes out to sell her food as a street vendor though people who already know her ask her to send them tortillas every day.

loans.use: to buy corn, bags, lime and a 'comal' (pan for making tortillas)

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a 29-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with one parent and two siblings. She has 10 years of experience selling perfumes, souvenirs, etc. In 2009, she opened her own store which is located next to her house. Patricia is a new business owner, and she says that today she is applying for a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. in order to strengthen her business. She will purchase a wide variety of new products (perfumes, accessories, souvenirs, etc.) with the intention of increasing her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of new products (perfumes, accessories, souvenirs, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos.

La señora Maria aprendió la profesión de elaboración de hamacas desde los nueve años de edad, fue su mamá quien le enseño este oficio, ya que este a sido generacional, por que su abuela le enseño a su mamá y esta a sus hijas, todas tienen su negocio propio dedicado a la elaboración de hamacas y es su fuente de ingresos.

Ella elabora las hamacas en su casa, para esto debe ir a comprar los materiales que necesita una vez por semana a la ciudad, para esto ella sale de su casa a las 5:00 de la mañana hacia un pueblo, debido a que la señora Maria vive en una loma y camina media hora para llegar al desvió, donde toma un bus que la lleva al pueblo. A las 7:30 a.m. ella ya esta preparando la soga (material para elaborar hamaca) para convertirla en la pita.

La señora Maria quiere incrementar y mejorar su producción, por lo que esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar mayor cantidad de materiales y uno que es el pito el cual es más caro, pero es más cotizado y se vende la hamaca más rápido.

Con el préstamo ella estaría comprando materiales de mejor calidad, al elaborar hamacas mas suaves que son mas vendibles, que le permitirían incrementar sus ingresos y al mismo tiempo satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Ella desea hacer más grande su casa y construirla de bloque, ya que sus hijos van creciendo y necesitan espacio, los que viven en la casa son cinco personas, así que el espacio para elaborar las hamacas es pequeño.
texts.en:
Maria, age 29, is the single mother of two children.  When she was nine years old she learned the profession of making hammocks.  Her mother was the one who taught her this craft, which has been generational.  Her grandmother taught her mother, and her mother taught her daughters.  All of them have their own business making hammocks, and it is their source of income.
