She makes the hammocks at her house.  In order to do this she needs to go to the city once a week to buy the materials she needs.  She leaves her house at 5:00 in the morning headed towards town.  This is due to the fact that Maria lives on a hill, and she walks a half an hour to get to the route where she takes the bus that takes her to town.  At 7:30 a.m. she is preparing the pita fiber (material for making hammocks) in order to turn it into the rope.

Maria wants to increase and improve her production.  That is why she is requesting a loan from the Fundación Campo.  She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of materials.  One thing she will buy is the pita.  It is more expensive and more sought-after, and the hammocks sell more quickly.

With this loan she will be purchasing better quality materials to make the hammocks softer, which make them more sellable.  This will allow her to increase her income and at the same type satisfy her customers’ demand.

She wishes to make her house bigger and to build it from concrete blocks.  Her children are growing and need space.  Five people live in the house, therefore the space for making the hammocks is small.

loans.use: to buy materials to make her hammocks.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.en:
Dinara is 44 years old and is married to a security guard. Together with her husband she has raised three children, all of whom are married and have their own families. In order to earn money to meet her daily needs, Dinara breeds livestock. She started her business eleven years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS that she used to purchase three sheep that she resold at a higher price.  Her current monthly profit from her business is about 3,000 KGS. 

Dinara is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock to breed, fatten, and resell. She will also use a part of her loan to organize an anniversary celebration of her wedding. In the future, she plans to build a livestock shed. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, maize, cooking oil, soap, and mealie-meal.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene sigue participando en unos de los bancos comunales de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Rene sigue trabajando en el sector publico y también dedicándose a la carpintería y le está yendo muy bien. 

Rene con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Rene requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo pintura, cola de carpintero, madera y clavos.
 
Rene se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rene continues to participate in one of the communal banks of the Arariwa Association's microfinance unit in the city of Cusco. He continues to work in the public sector. He also does carpentry and this work is going very well for him.

Rene did very well with the prior loan and he was able to obtain lots of benefits. This is his motive for wanting to request another loan because it will help him a lot.

Rene needs this loan to purchase work materials like paint, carpenter’s glue, wood and nails. 

Rene is grateful for this opportunity and commits to make his payments on time according to the schedule.

loans.use: purchase materials for work like paint, carpenter's glue, wood and nails.

loans.name: Kimasi A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Kimasi A Group in Western Kenya! Maximilla is the facilitator of the Kimasi A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Maximilla takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Maximilla had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Maximilla was only able to harvest four and a half bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Maximilla and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Maximilla will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Kimasi A group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 30-year-old man living in Sana'a. He is a father of three children. Two of the children are still in primary school and the youngest is two years old. Mohammed completed only primary school and could not go ahead with his study due to the difficult living conditions he faced.

Mohammed's business is a grocery store that he started 14 years ago with limited capital and income. By sticking with his business, which is the main source for feeding his family, Mohammed was able to attract new clients. This had an impact on expanding his business capital and income. Mohammed was happy for the increase in clients but on the other hand, Mohammed faced a financial challenge because he was not able to meet the demands of his clientele.

Mohammed took a loan of 400,000 YER from Al Amal Bank in order to meet the demands of his clients by providing the needed grocery goods. It is worth mentioning that Mohammed is one of the trusted clients of AMB, as this loan is the third loan to be disbursed to him.

In the future, Mohammed hopes to expand his business and capital by opening another grocery as well as purchasing a truck, which he will use to pick up goods from wholesalers to deliver to his grocery. He also is saving to enroll his youngest child in a private school to guarantee a good education.

loans.use: to purchase goods and requirements for his grocery store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married and has a rice retail business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Gina has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years now, and also earns additional income from raising ducks and chickens.
In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Tchangotade Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TCHANGOTADE est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Raïma, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Raïma est âgée de 26 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Pierre. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à sa charge. Raïma vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges. Raïma n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis cinq ans, Raïma exerce comme activité, la vente des chaussures et des ustensiles de cuisine ; Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Raïma s’approvisionne au Togo. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Raïma désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Raïma sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe TCHANGOTADE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
TCHANGOTADE Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, named Raïma, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

This is the first time that the members of this group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Raïma, age 26, is married to a welder named Pierre. The couple has two children to support, out of whom one attends school. Raïma lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the various expenses together.

Raïma never attended school. For five years, she's been selling shoes and kitchenware. This business enables her to provide for her family's needs without much difficulty.
 
She gets her supplies in Togo. Eager to better meet customer demand, she would like to increase her stock and bolster her business. To this effect, she's seeking a first loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy shoes and kitchenware

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a hardworking young man who is married with three children. They live in a semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children. He rides a motorcycle for someone and he has the challenges of poor roads, high fuel, and having to remit 70% of his daily earnings to his bosses. Amos needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Akuot

texts.en:
Akuot is 36 years old.  She is married and has two children, neither of whom attends school.  She operates a business selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan.  She has been in business for two years.

Akuot is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase beans, rice and onions.   She will use the extra income generated from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice and onions to sell.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en: Dahiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dahiru would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dahiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Dahiru expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Abizeranye Sub Group B

texts.en:
Jean d`Arc is a group leader; aged 35 years.She is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 15 years. 2 of them go to school.The group is called ABIZERANYE means “the trusted people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She owns a beauty salon and has been running her business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more equipment for the salon for and also have items for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for her beauty salon and items for sale to clients

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en: Nigora was born in 1977 year. She has four children. Her husband works in farm. She was start working 15 years ago in farming sphere. Every year she gets a good income. For the next year she wants to enlarge her business and to get a good harvest. She wants to buy seeds, fertilizer and other products for new sowing. She needs to money. She is asking for a loan of 8000 with this aim. She hopes with your help and mercy she can buy seeds fertilizer and necessary things for farming and will get a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer for new sowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start an internet cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Paula Belen

texts.en:
Paula is 50 years old, has five children and her husband is self-employed, painting houses in the city. She originally began helping her husband with the family budget by washing clothes, but now she has installed a small business withing her home where she sells consumable products such as salt, sugar, oil, tea, pasta, etc. She is one of the two members of the group SOLIDARIO SONORA 3, the other woman is Mrs. Maria H. Jimenez (she sells vegetables in the market).And so the loan will be shared between the two women, according to each of their needs in order to increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

PAULA TIENE 50 AÑOS , CINCO HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN FORMA PARTICULAR PINTANDO CASAS DE LA CIUDAD , ELLA INICIALMENTE COMENZO AYUDANDO A SU ESPOSO EN EL PRESUPUESTO FAMILIAR LAVANDO ROPA AJENA , AHORA INSTALO UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCITO EN SU CASA DONDE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO SAL , AZUCAR , ACEITE , TE , PASTAS , ETC. ELLA ES UNA DE LAS DOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SOLIDARIO SONORA 3 , LA OTRA SEÑORA DOÑA MARIA H. JIMENEZ ( VENDE VERDURAS EN EL MERCADO ). POR LO TANTO ENTRE LAS DOS SE REPARTIRAN EL PRESTAMO SEGUN LAS NECESIDADES DE CADA UNA PARA AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS .

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
Maria Gloria, 35, is married with 3 children. Her husband works in the fields growing maize. She has a small grocery store in her house where people in the neighborhood come to shop. She belongs to the Lourdes 3 group along with dona Adela Diaz Zuniga (sales of licores, a fruit- and sugar-based drink). With the loan, dona Maria Gloria will buy more merchandise to better stock her store and dona Adela hopes to buy kitchen equipment so that she can improve how she prepares the licores.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA GLORIA, tiene 35 años, casada, 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en la siembra del maíz, ella tiene en su casa una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes donde compran las gentes de la comunidad. Ella pertenece al grupo Lourdes 3 junto con doña ADELA DIAZ ZUÑIGA ( venta de licores de fruta y caña ). Con el préstamo doña María Gloria comprara mas mercadería para abastecer mejor su local y doña Adela espera comprar implementos de cocina para preparar en mejores condiciones sus jugos.

loans.use: Grocery store.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This valiant woman of 45 lives with her husband and their four children. The couple owns a confectionery (pastry-making business) in Herrera, a secluded area of Santo Domingo. As an excellent confectioner, Francisa prepares different kinds of succulent sweets like pies, buckwheat cake, pudding, and so forth. At the midday, her confectionery shop is turned into a cafeteria where food is sold to a number of people.

Presently, Francisca has a well-established clientele which continues expanding. Due to that fact, she is asking for a loan to buy raw materials so she can offer her customers more variety. Francisca is requesting a loan of US$ 325.

loans.use: To invest in her business in order to offer more variety to the customers

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 50 years old, and she sells provisions, drinks and oil to people in her community. She is married to Mr. I., has 4 children, and they live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. In 1973, she sold cooked food and later changed to the selling of provisions in 1989. She has been a LAPO member for 4 years. With a $475 loan she will buy more provisions, drinks, and oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and oil for sale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 23-year-old Mama Hythan (that name comes from her 4-year-old son who's named Hythan). In 2005 she opened a grocery store (randomly called Dar Pub), where she sells a range of food items; butter, biscuits, rice, oil etc. Mama Hythan requires a loan of $900 to expand this business by purchasing additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Watafutaji E Group

texts.en:
Kuruthum, age 41, is married with 4 children (ages 18, 14, 13, and 9).  She owns a business of selling clothes which she began a year ago.  She opens her business from 10am to 5pm daily, and makes a monthly profit of about $45.

In the past, Kuruthum took out 3 previous loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business.  She hopes for a new loan to start a new business of selling maize flour. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who have businesses dealing in selling clothes, hardware, sarongs, soap, and food.

In the picture, Kuruthum is first from left.

loans.use: To start a new business selling maize flour

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat A. is a 48 year old mother of 4 children and lives in Mushin, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells clothes and drinks to the people in her community and she has been with LAPO for the past 3 years. She solicits for the loan amount of $450 to enable her buy more clothes & drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes & drinks for sale

loans.name: Kidawa

texts.en:
Kidawa is 28 years old and is married with two children, ages 7 and 1 1/2. She and her husband also take care of two other adults. Kidawa owns a small shop, which she opened in 2007. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $140.

Kidawa now hopes for a loan of $175 to buy more goods for resale in her store.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her general store

loans.name: Ricardo Rodolfo

texts.es:
Mr. Ricardo F. is 23 years old, lives in the Memorial Sandino district, is an engineer for Sistema and is married. He has alwasy planned to build his house to give better and more comfortable conditions to his family.

Mr. Ricardo hopes that in the future to gain a better standard of living for his family. With this loan, he hopes to build a room and he needs to buy materials for this. He is asking for a loan for a time period of of 9 months, by means of monthly guarantees.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

El Señor Ricardo F. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Memorial Sandino, es ingeniero en Sistema y es casado.Entre sus planes ha estado siempre construir construir su casa para darle mayor comodidad y condiciones de vida a su familia.

Don Ricardo espera en un futuro lograr un mejor estatus economico y social para el y su familia , con este credito el espera construir un cuarto y necesita comprar materiales de cosntruccion por lo que solicita un prestamo con un lapso de 9 meses, mediante abonos mensuales

loans.use: To buy construction materials to continue working on his house.

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es:
Santos Alexander is a humble man that earns a living in the cattle farming business in the Cinco Pinos municipality of the city of Chinandega. He is the father of a young son, who motivates him to work harder everyday to be able to meet his needs.

It is important to note that this business requires a lot of physical work mainly because he needs to transport the animals from one point to another crossing long distances under the exposure of the sun. This can cause illnesses and can weaken the body. Nonetheless, Santos continues to work hard and it has now come to Ceprodel to obtain the loan that will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero Santos Alexander es una persona muy humilde que labora en el negocio de ganadería en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es padre de un hijo pequeño el cual es el motivo por el cual cada día se esfuerza aun mas para satisfacer sus necesidades.

Es necesario destacar que el negocio requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico por la sencilla razón de que debe de trasladar los animales de una distancia a otra atravesando largos trechos de camino bajo la exposición al sol lo que provoca enfermedades y mucho desgaste físico. A pesar de esto, Santos continua trabajando fuerte y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de novillos para su desarrollo y comercialización en su zona donde se desempeña.

loans.use: To purchase young bulls

loans.name: Madawa P.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Madawa P. S.. She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 8. She has four dependents, who live with her because they are orphans and relatives. In 2005, Madawa established her hair salon. Madawa has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy hair dryer and also some cosmetics in bulk. In the future, Madawa plans to be a popular hair designer. She thanks you for your support.

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and some cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S., 27, is a garment factory worker in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, and makes $3 USD each day. She lives with her husband, Noy Noeun, who operates a motortaxi service and can usually make $6.60 USD each day. They have one small child at home and have been looking for ways to increase their income and improve their standard of living.

Heng S. has asked for a loan of $500 USD to invest in her husband’s taxi service and to purchase a new motortaxi to replace their old one. Their old one uses a lot of gas and is constantly in need of repair, which cuts into the income her husband is able to make. She believes that this investment can help the family in the long-term and looks forward to seeing the results.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
After having a disastrous relationship, as she describes it, where her partner beat and mistreated her, she started her life as a merchant, some 18 years ago. This was in spite of the fears she had of starting a business due to her low self esteem.

Ana is part of the Señor del Cautivo II community bank and currently has 3 stores, 2 of which are rented (internet service and cleaning products sales) and the other is a children's footwear store.

Taking advantage of the market day of Huaraz, and this loan of 1,700 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will rent two stands and set them up, one selling various toiletry items and the other selling typical foods.

Ana, who is 49 years old and without children, hopes to finish building her house and to open stores in Lima to be able to live on the income in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Después de tener una relación desastrosa, como lo califica ella ,donde su conviviente la golpeaba y le maltrataba, ella inicio su vida de comerciante hace 18 años, a pesar de los temores que le causaba comenzar un negocio debido a su baja autoestima.

Ana forma parte de Banco Comunal “Señor del Cautivo II”, en la actualidad tiene 3 tiendas, dos alquiladas (servicio de internet y venta de productos de limpieza) y la otra para la venta de sus productos de calzado para niños.

Aprovechado la feria de Huaraz, y el préstamo de S/. 1,700 soles, el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, alquilará dos stand e implementará, uno para venta de diferentes artículos de tocador y otro para la venta de comidas típicas.

Ana de 49 años y sin hijos espera concluir la construcción de su casa y abrir tiendas en Lima y en su vejes vivir de sus rentas.

loans.use: Purchase of toiletries to sell.  Ingredients for selling food.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia tiene 34 años D. edad, estudió tercero D. secundaria, es casada, madre D. cuatro hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Machacmarca.

Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva D. la  Comunidad D. Machacmarca, Distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao-Puno, con su primer préstamo 
D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles compró 03 ovinos para su posterior venta, Doña Flavia manifiesta que desD. los 15 años D. edad empezó a vender gaseosas en la feria D. Pilcuyo, desD. que convive con su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno, ovino, los días martes compra D. Huacullani y venD. los días domingos en la feria D. Ilave.  

Con este crédito D. S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 01 toro para su posterior venta.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar una casa en la ciudad D. Puno y seguir con su negocio aumentando más ganado para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Flavia is 34 and studied through her third year of secondary education. She is married and the mother of 4 children, they live in the Machacmarca community, Pilcuyo District, Collao-Puno Province. With her first loan of $110, she bought 3 sheep for future sale. Doña Flavia has proven herself, since at the age of 15, she started selling soft drinks in the Pilcuyo street market. Since she has been living with her husband, she has supported herself by buying and selling sheep. She buys on Tuesdays in Huacullani, and sells on Sundays in the Ilave street market. With this loan of $575, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy a bull for future sale. Her biggest dreams are that her children would become professionals, to buy a house in the city of Puno, and to continue to grow her business by purchasing more livestock for market.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock (a bull)

loans.name: Azel

texts.en:
Azel Q. is a 38-year-old married man with three children. Azel is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work another job, started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business eight years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales, and he is proud to say that the business has been running well, but he now needs additional capital to expand his business. 

Therefore, Azel is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase four calves.; He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy E., 47, and her husband, Mr. Seng Sun, 52, live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1979, and have four children; three sons and one daughter. The oldest son is a soldier, two are weavers, and the youngest son is in school.

Mrs. Savy has been a silk weaver since 1985, a skill she learned from her neighbors. She also buys them from other villagers to sell in other provinces. Her husband is a school principal. She is requesting a loan of $500 to buy silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To buy silk fabric for resale.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad H. is a 32-year-old entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs and detergents in his store. His store is very famous in his community, so he has a good clientele. He also works as a policeman in the police department of the city where he lives, but his salary is not enough to cover the basic needs of his family. When he is at work, his wife replaces him in the store.

Today Elshad is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase his store's stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. Elshad’s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday they’ll become successful entrepreneurs. His perseverance and clear vision will be key factors in the success of his small business.

loans.use: Purchase more food inventory

loans.name: Yourn

texts.en: Mrs. Yourn C. was born in 1964 and lives in Doun Vong village in Kandal province. She is a widow with a child who works in a garment factory. Although they work hard, they live in an old house which is in poor condition. In order to improve her life, Mrs. Yourn C. is applying for a loan to buy wood with which to build a new house. She hopes she can provide better conditions to her family with this loan.

loans.use: To buy wood to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Zully

texts.es:
Pertenece al Banco Comunal  “Juntas hasta el final”, que se ubica en AV: bellavista 1247 del distrito de Calleria, tiene 26 años, 1 hijo, su esposo es chofer, como socia lleva 2 años en Manuela Ramos.

Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro algunos sacos de arroz y empezó a venderlo en el mercado, su esposo no tenía trabajo y estaba enfermo, al ver el progreso y esfuerzo  de su esposa el puso de su parte restablecer su  salud, y ahora la apoya con su negocio.

Con este préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 1500.00, compro una tonelada de arroz, y reparte en todos los mercados, su cobranza es al contado y diario.

Esta muy contenta , feliz porque su hogar está muy unido y su negocio crece cada día mas.
texts.en:
Zully is 26 years old and is married to a man who works as a driver. She has been a member of the Community Bank called “Together To The End” for two years. With her first loan of approximately $100 USD, Zully purchased several sacks of rice and began selling it in the market. At the time, her husband was ill and could not work. When he saw the effort Zully made in supporting them, he was better able to focus his efforts in getting well and now he also supports them as well through his business. With this current loan of approximately $475 USD, Zully will purchase a full ton of rice, which she will then sell in all the local markets. She keeps track of her earnings and sales on a daily basis. Zully is very happy these days because she and husband are working together towards their goals and her business grows every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Molloy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a full ton of rice to sell in all the local markets

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Mutabar Y. is a woman who on a daily basis seeks the betterment of her 3 children. She works with great effort for them and wants to continue to do so to build a prominent and promising future. Ever since she was a little girl, she has been dedicated to farming activities. She was raised this way and it has been a stable source of income until this day.

For more than 11 years, Mutabar together with her husband has been raising sheep and also growing some crops on their land. To continue to work and to obtain a very good quantity and quality, Mutabar wants to borrow money for growing hay and other feed for his sheep on his land. For that she needs to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Let’s show solidarity to this selfless mother who looks for what is best for her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Madame Mamou C. a 37 ans mariée, elle réside avec son époux et ses 2 enfants (1 garçon et 1 fille) à Banconi, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mamou C. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès au village, s’initia depuis deux ans, à l’activité d’achat et de vente des calebasses et divers dès  son arrivée en ville.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec  elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 3 colis de calebasses. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso avant de les revendre  en détail, au comptant et à crédit  à Nièna et dans les zones minières à  une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et surtout de miniers. Il s’agit de l’orpaillage (exploitations minières traditionnelles) dans les placers.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, rembourser les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Mamou C., age 37, is married and resides with her husband and two children (a boy and a girl) in Banconi, one of the outlying densely-populated districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work in the village unsuccessfully, she got introduced two years ago to buying and selling calebasses (cups and bowls made from a dried gourd) and various other goods as soon she arrived in the city.

Wanting to do better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which she is on her first individual loan. She plans to use this loan to buy 3 packages of calebasses. She supplies herself from rural producers in the towns near Sikasso and then sells the goods retail, cash or credit accepted, in Nièna and in mining zones. Her customers are generally composed of women and especially miners. This has to do with the washing of gold (a traditional mining process) at sites having alluvial deposits of gold.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help with family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calebasses

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en: Sosefina T. S., 38, is married and has 4 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public two days a week. This is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145 USD). SPBD loans are Sosefina’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.Sosefina use her loan to buy tools and chemical for her business also her home improvement.

loans.use: Purchases to buy some tool to use for planting taro &taamu also chemical to killed inset.

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es: El señor Orlando José tiene 41 años de edad, reside en el barrio Colonia Centro América en la ciudad de Managua de la Iglesia católica 3 c al Sur,  su esposa es ama de casa, y le tiene dos hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad, don Orlando es taxista desde hace ocho años le servi a la comunidad por sus servicios de carreras. El inicio comprando este vehiculo con ahorros  de su trabajo anterior, este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic que ha sido de muchos beneficios para seguir adelante con los objetivos y proyecciones en su vida, con esta solicitud va a comprar planta de batería para renovar el servicio de operaciones, sus planes es poder mantener en buen estado su vehiculo para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes, en un futuro espera cambiar de unidad de vehiculo.
texts.en:
Olando José is 41 years old and lives in the "Central America" suburb in the town of Managua of the Catholic church on the Third South road. His wife is a a homemaker and they have two children aged 4 and 7. Orlando is a taxi driver and for the past eight years he has served the community through his journey services. He started by buying his car with savings from his previous job. This is his third cycle in Afodenic which has been of considerable benefit in allowing him to move forward with his objects and aims in life. With this loan he is going to buy a battery unit in order to improve the services he offers. His plan is to be able to maintain the good state of his car in order to be able to continue to offer a good service to his customers and in the future he hopes to change his car.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a battery unit to improve the services he offers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana B. tiene 52 años de edad, es Casada de oficios tejedora, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, habita junto con sus hijos, ella y su Esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 35 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Primero Palemop, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Juana B. is 52 years old and is married. She is by trade a weaver "making typical skirts for women". She has a workshop with two looms and lives together with her children. She and her husband both work in the same trade and have two employees working in the same activity. She has 35 years experience making skirts in her home, which is located in Primero Palemop hamlet, in the Vásquez neighbourhood of the department of Totonicapán , Guatemala. Currently the demand from her customers is growing, but because of the current economic climate she is not able to increase her capital. It's for this reason that Teresa approached the ASDIR Association in order to ask for a loan, with the intention of purchasing primary materials and in this way be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artesan: Increase capital

loans.name: Michèle Victorine

texts.fr:
T. Michèle Victorine est née le 23 mars 1974 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin dans le Département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin. Michèle Victorine est mariée à MOHAMED Kémal. Michèle Victorine est mère de cinq enfants, tous à la charge de son mari et elle. Michèle Victorine est Coiffeuse de profession. Michèle Victorine a son atelier de coiffure dans la zone des Ambassades et mène à côté de l'atelier la vente des cartes de recharge téléphonique dans une petite cabine téléphonique. Michèle Victorine a déjà bénéficié de trois créditsq pour son activité de téléphonie. Michèle Victorine sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcer cette activité. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
T. Michèle Victorine was born on March 23, 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in Littoral County in southern Benin. She is married to MOHAMED Kémal and is the mother of five children, who are all supported by her and her husband. Michèle Victorine is a hairdresser by profession. She has her own salon in the embassy row area and manages the sale of mobile phone recharge cards in a small phone booth next to her shop. She has already benefited from three loans for her telephone business. She's requesting a fourth loan for it. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy phone recharge cards wholesale

loans.name: Al Ahli Group

texts.en:
A. Ahli is a group of four women who are living in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon.

Afandiya is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children. She has owned livestock for 40 years and she is also involved in milk production. Afandiya is sucessful in her work because she is experienced. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties since she learned it when she was young. Afandiya decided to set up her business because it is in demand in her region. She requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to increase her livestock and milk production. This is the first time that Afandiya has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on expanding her livestock.

Zeinab is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. She has been working in agriculture for eight years and she owns livestock. Zeinab is successful in her work because she enjoys it. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided to set up her business because of her financiA. needs. She requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Zeinab has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Saada is a 35-year-old married woman with one child. She has been working in agriculture for 20 years and she owns livestock. Saada is successful in her work because of her experience. Her clients are people from her region. Saada decided to set up her business because it is in demand in her region and because she likes animals. She requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Saada has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Chama is a 21-year-old woman. She has been working in agriculture for ten years and she owns livestock. Chama is successful in her work due to the experience she has gained since she was young. Her clients are people from her region. She requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Chama has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her livestock.

About group loans
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To increase her livestock

loans.name: By The Grace Of God Group

texts.en:
Sanga is a married woman with 8 children.  Her oldest child is 25 and her youngest child is 10.  Those of her children who are still in school, go to private schools.    

Sanga has two businesses.  For her primary business, she sells various small things at a local market in the Lakpazee community of Monrovia, Liberia.  At this market she sells mainly onions, spices, bottles of oil, and salt.  She also has a business doing agriculture.  In that business, she grows rice and fufu.     

This is her second loan, and she will be restocking her market stand.  Right now her table is very bare from the sales she has made, so she will be restocking.

loans.use: To buy onions, pepper, salt, spices, and more oil

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely P. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Mely is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mely owns & operates a business venture, fishing and retailing fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from fishing and selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Mely has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Mely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for additional working capital. Mely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase kerosene, and as working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Mely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional working capital, as well as the purchase of kerosene and additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús R. de 60 años de edad reside en Lourdes Colon del departamento de La Libertad. Jesús se dedica a la panadería, negocio propio que inicio hace doce años con el apoyo de su esposa, la panadería de Jesús posee una buena clientela y ha ido ganado la preferencia de muchos a través de los años y también por la fama que tiene el pan de Jose, el crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad es para destino en capital de trabajo ya que desea comprar materia prima para la elaboración de pan.
texts.en:
Jesús R. is 60 years old and lives in Lourdes Colon in La Libertad District. He operates a bakery, a business he started 12 years ago with the help of his wife. His bakery has a good customer base and has become a favorite of many over the years. Jesús is famous for his bread.

The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to buy ingredients for making bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem C., age 28, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she has to travel far to a market in the outskirts of Phnom Penh City to sell vegetables, typically earning a gross income of US $42 per day. Her husband also plays a major role in the family to generate a better source of income for his family. He is engaged in a business as a motor-taxi driver, providing his services to people in the city.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, C. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, C. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity to transport her vegetables to sell and generate a better income to raise the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: For motorbike purchase

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda manages a typical village store in the simple village of Centro 1 Angadanan, Isabela.  Aside from managing her store, she is also into vending of vegetables. From those businesses she is earning a weekly income of PHP3, 000 that is being revolved in the business to grow. In connection to this she wanted to avail a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP6, 000 as additional business capital for her store and vending of vegetables. 


Esmeralda is already 55 years old, she is married to Leoncio and they are blessed with 3 children namely; Alexander - 37 years old, Bernie - 36 years old, followed by Froilan - 35 years of age, and they also have an adopted child named Evangeline who is now 16 years old, and now a college freshman. Esmeralda hopes to give her adopted child a good education for her to have a better future someday thus, she is hoping to improve her business more.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
Iris tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus dos hijos en la casa de sus padres. A ella le gusta realizar las tareas agrícolas, ya que se dedicó a esto desde niña, por tal razón ayuda a su esposo a machetear los arbustos de sus chacras de plátanos. Pero como sus hijos ya están más grandes, sus necesidades se han incrementado, por lo que Iris decidió incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de frutas, con el fin de dinamizar su economía y que no le falte nada a sus hijos. Por ello, dos veces por semana recoge los plátanos de sus chacras y compra naranjas de sus vecinos, para que el jueves (día de feria) muy temprano acuda al mercado de la ciudad. Y luego de una ardua jornada, a eso de las 5 de la tarde, regresa a casa muy contenta con las compras para la semana y su esposo le da el alcance para ayudarla con la carga.
Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, en sus créditos anteriores ha demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos, además que le gusta asistir a la todas las reuniones de su banco comunal, pues se divierte mucho con sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en el incremento de su capital para la compra de más frutas. También adquirirá fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de plátanos.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y más frutas para la venta

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 31 years old.  She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom attend school. Rebecca sells porridge in her neighborhood. Almost all Ghanaians enjoy eating porridge for breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains and then boiled and eaten with sugar, milk and bread or with "kose." Kose is made from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so it is ready to be served with the porridge in about 20 minutes. With a growing customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar, and milk to increase production. She would be grateful for any assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 60 años, madre D. seis hijos mayores D. edad. Rosaura se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, actividad que desarrolla en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, él es jubilado (cesado,ya no trabaja) del magisterio. Rosaura forma parte del Banco Comunal “Ricardo Palma” desD. hace cinco años. El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 300 soles, que utilizó en la compra D. gaseosas, ahora ella necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles, que será utilizado para comprar una vitrina mas, para exhibir su mercadería y también para comprar prendas D. vestir. La meta D. Rosaura es  tener una tienda D. artículos D. regalos para toda ocasión.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the region of Ucayali, Peru, and is a 60-year-old mother of six, all of whom are grown up. She makes a living selling clothes, an activity she carries out from her home. She counts on the support of her husband, who is a retired teacher. She has been a part of the Ricardo Palmo Community Bank for the past five years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, and she used it to purchase soft drinks to sell. Currently she is requesting a loan of 2500 soles (approximately $875), which she plans to use to purchase a display case to show off her merchandise and to also purchase more clothing to sell. Rosaura's goal is to have a store selling gifts for all occasions.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and a display case to show offer her merchandise

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia E. is from the village of Pangabuan Tangub City. She is 45 years old. Verginia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Verginia owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products and dried goods products in the local community. Verginia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Verginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Verginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Verginia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to pay for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felista

texts.en: Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Felista A. from Tukuyu. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 7. Felista has been running a tailoring business since 2005, making and selling clothes. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and currently earns about 110 USD. Felista is requesting a loan in order to buy materials in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of her product. She thanks you for your support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials  in bulk for her business

loans.name: Gotitas Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento GOTITAS trabaja con nuestra Institución desD. el año 2007, este banco se caracteriza porque es antiguo y esta bien consolidado. PATRICIA .- Es una joven participante y ocupa el cargo D. presidenta, trabaja con un punto D. llamadas, con el prestamo a logrado emprender otro negocio que es L. elaboración y venta D. chocolates, D. esta manera a podido colaborar en aumentar los ingresos D. su familia.CARMEN; L. Sra. es tambien una D. las fundadoras D. este grupo y tiene a su cargo L. secretaria, con el prestamo a podido diversificar sus productos en L. venta D. ropa y peluches, tambien a podido compar diferentes productos  para su Salón D. Peinados D. esta forma a logrado mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad D. vida.TERESA, L. Sra ocupa el cargo D. tesorera, elL. se dedica al comercio, con el prestamo a podido diversificar y comprar más productos para su tienda y D. esta manera ahorrar y mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. elL. y su númerosa familia
texts.en:
The GOTITAS Entrepreneurs Bank has worked with our institution since 2007. This bank is known for being well established. PATRICIA - is a young member who acts as president. She works at a call center, and with this loan can start another business selling chocolate. In this way, she can increase the income of her family. CARMEN – She is another of the founders of this group and has the position of secretary. With this loan, she can expand her merchandise in clothing and stuffed animal sales. She can also buy different products for her hair salon. In this way, she can improve her earnings and quality of life. TERESA – She has the position of treasurer. She works in commerce. With this loan, she can diversify and buy more products for her store. In this way, she can build her savings and improve quality of life for herself and her large family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer
